GATO
4
131 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
2
RecommandÃ©
6.5 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 20 novembre 2013
This is the first game created by Gearbox - the legendary developers behind Borderlands and Brothers in Arms.

Opposing Forces is the first expansion to Half Life. Released in 1999, exactly a year after the original game.

Personally i like it just as much as the original Half Life, and in my book, original Half Life is in top 10.

It consists of 12 chapters, but don't let that fool you cause it's not nearly as long as the original Half Life. 6 hours is as much as you can get from it.

That said, the game has it's own identity. For example, just like any half life game, this one has a tutorial. Gearbox decided to have a bit of fun with it, since you start out in the boot camp.

It's a typical training mission, but a nicely done training mission. Had a lot of army stereotypes and FMJ references.

Unlike Blue Shift (2nd expansion), this game actually tried to add some things of its own.

  • Night vision googles instead of the flashlight.
  • Sniper instead of the crossbow.
  • Pistol with a laser pointer instead of the revolver.
  • Wrench and a knife instead of the crowbar
  • 2 new alien weapons - one is like a bazooka, the other has infinite ammo (shoots lightning balls).
  • Instead of long jumps, your protagonist climbs on ropes.
  • 1 new Black Mesa prototype weapon, that teleports you to Xen. The location you get teleported in generally have a lot of loot.
  • 1 completely new weapon, not just an alternative model - a machine gun (M249 SAW).
  • There are new alien types as well.

Also, throughout the game, you will encounter your comrades, the most important ones are medic and engineer. Medic can patch you up, while the engineer can drill through doors.

As for the story, neither Blue Shirt nor Opposing Forces are canon. That said, Opposing Forces has a lot of cameos. I personally wouldn't have minded to have it in the official lore.

Deep inside it's still the same game, but at least they tried to add a few things here and there. Like i said, it has it's own identity.

I highly recommend it.
 
Daniel Potter
1,336 produits enregistrÃ©s
8

Opposing Force Ã© a primeira das expansÃµes de Half Life em que Ã© mostrada uma outra face dos acontecimentos de Black Mesa. NÃ£o se trata de uma sequÃªncia, mas sim de acontecimentos que ocorrem em simultÃ¢neo. O personagem principal esta vez nÃ£o Ã© Freeman, mas sim Adrian Shepard, um dos oficiais de elite (HECU) que foram enviados Ã  instalaÃ§Ã£o durante o capÃ­tulo dos escritÃ³rios em HL1.

Ocorre que antes mesmo de chegar a base, a aeronave em que Shepard e sua equipe estava foi atingida por uma descarga elÃ©trica e caiu, antes mesmo de os soldados receberem as ordens sobre o que eles deveriam fazer em sua missÃ£o, ou mesmo qualquer informaÃ§Ã£o sobre o que de fato estava acontecendo.

Shepard fica desacordado por um bom tempo, e sÃ³ retoma a consciÃªncia jÃ¡ no final de HL1, quando os militares abortam a missÃ£o e estÃ£o prestes a deixar a instalaÃ§Ã£o. PorÃ©m ocorrem interferÃªncias alheias que fazem com que Shepard nÃ£o chegue a tempo Ã  nave de fuga e a partir daÃ­ passa a buscar outra forma de sair do local.

O jogo funciona da mesma forma que o original, mas desta vez foram adicionados novos tipos de alienÃ­genas com personalidades muito mais hostis e muito mais fortes que os do primeiro jogo. AliÃ¡s, os aliens antigos praticamente nÃ£o aparecem apÃ³s a metade do jogo, talvez em decorrÃªncia do desfecho de HL1. AlÃ©m disso, agora se pode usar algumas armas alienÃ­genas.

Uma coisa legal, Ã© que se manteve a preocupaÃ§Ã£o em fazer os cenÃ¡rios de forma que fosse possÃ­vel reconhecer os lugares por onde passamos no primeiro jogo. Em determinado ponto, inclusive, Ã© possÃ­vel ver Freeman.

Enfim, Opposing Force Ã© um grande complemento a aventura de HL1, que mantÃ©m o mesmo nÃ­vel de qualidade do jogo original, alÃ©m de introduzir uma sÃ©rie de coisas novas. Apesar de ser uma expansÃ£o, tem muito mais conteÃºdo que muito jogo completo vendido por ai, e apesar da idade, certamente ainda vale a pena. MUITO BOM (8/10).

Ğ’Ğ¾ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ğµ, Ğ±ÑƒĞ´ÑƒÑ‡Ğ¸ Ğ·Ğ°ĞºĞ»ÑÑ‚Ñ‹Ğ¼Ğ¸ Ğ²Ñ€Ğ°Ğ³Ğ°Ğ¼Ğ¸ Ğ¤Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ğ°, Ğ² Ğ½Ğ°ÑˆĞµĞ¼ ÑĞ»ÑƒÑ‡Ğ°Ğµ ÑĞ²Ğ»ÑÑÑ‚ÑÑ ÑĞ¾ÑĞ·Ğ½Ğ¸ĞºĞ°Ğ¼Ğ¸. Ğ˜Ğ½Ñ‚ĞµÑ€ĞµÑĞ½Ğ¾ Ğ¸ Ğ½ĞµĞ¾Ğ±Ñ‹Ñ‡Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ³Ğ»ÑĞ´Ğ¸Ñ‚ Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ¹, Ğ·Ğ°Ğ±Ğ°Ğ²Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ ÑĞ»ĞµĞ¼ĞµĞ½Ñ‚ Ğ»Ğ°Ğ·Ğ°Ğ½ÑŒÑ Ğ¸ Ñ€Ğ°ÑĞºĞ°Ñ‡Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ Ğ½Ğ° Ğ²ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ²ĞºĞµ.

ĞĞµĞ¿Ğ»Ğ¾Ñ…Ğ¾ Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ³Ğ»ÑĞ´ÑÑ‚ Ğ¸ ÑƒÑ€Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ½Ğ¸. ĞÑĞ¾Ğ±ÑƒÑ Ğ¸Ğ½Ñ‚ĞµÑ€ĞµÑĞ½Ğ¾ÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ¿Ñ€ĞµĞ´ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ²Ğ»ÑÑÑ‚ Ñ‚Ğµ, Ğ³Ğ´Ğµ Ğ¼Ñ‹ Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ĞµÑĞµĞºĞ°ĞµĞ¼ Ğ¼ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ°, Ğ·Ğ½Ğ°ĞºĞ¾Ğ¼Ñ‹Ğµ Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¼ Ğ¿Ğ¾ Ğ¿ĞµÑ€Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ¼Ñƒ HL, Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ´Ñ Ğ¸Ñ… Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¶ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğµ, ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğµ Ğ¼Ñ‹ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ»Ğ¸ ÑƒĞ²Ğ¸Ğ´ĞµÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ² Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ³Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ°Ğ»Ğµ. Ğ’ Opposing Force Ğ»ÑƒÑ‡ÑˆĞµ Ñ€Ğ°ÑÑĞºÑ€Ñ‹Ñ‚Ğ° Ñ‚ĞµĞ¼Ğ° Ğ¸Ğ·ÑƒÑ‡ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ Ğ³Ğ¸Ğ´Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ„Ğ°ÑƒĞ½Ñ‹ Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ñ€ĞµĞ´ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ²Ğ¸Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ĞµĞ¹ Ğ¼Ğ¸Ñ€Ğ° Xen. Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 21 aout 2016
On connait tous (ou presque) la sÃ©rie Half-Life (et surtout les memes par rapport Ã  HL3), mais on connait moins les extensions de HL1 crÃ©Ã©es par Gearbox (Oui oui, les crÃ©ateurs de la sÃ©rie Borderlands).

Half-Life Opposing Force est la premiÃ¨re des deux extensions, sortie en 1999, soit 1 an aprÃ¨s Half-Life 1.
Dans cette Ã©pisode, on incarne le caporal Shephard, qui est en mission de sauvetage. Pour sauver qui ? Gordon Freeman ! On peut d'ailleurs l'aperÃ§evoir Ã  un moment du jeu, quand il se tÃ©lÃ©porte vers la planÃ¨te Xen.
Le gameplay, par rapport au 1, ne change pas, ou peu. Il y a l'ajout de plusieurs armes, dont le sniper !
Au niveau de l'histoire, comme d'hab', c'est assez obscure, on apprends pas grand chose de nouveau.
Au niveau du dÃ©roulement des niveaux, on est moins dans le puzzle, et surtout dans la baston. On passe moins de temps Ã  se creuser la cervelle pour savoir oÃ¹ passer. Certains aimeront, d'autres moins.
On a un boss final bien sympa comparÃ© Ã  HL1, car plus compliquÃ© Ã  tuer (mais tout aussi â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ :D)

Le seul aspect nÃ©gatif qui apparait Ã  mes yeux reste la durÃ©e de vie, 5-6h, ce qui est vraiment court, mÃªme pour une extension.

Bref, c'est un must-have si on veut poursuivre et rallonger notre temps dans l'univers de HL. A prendre en solde, ou avec le Half-Life Complete en solde.

RecommandÃ©
7.6 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 10 juin 2017
Neat little expansion pack. The story follows one of the marines who were trying to kill Freeman in Half-Life but apparently all the bloodthirsty ones were in another squad. At various points Shephard, the protagonist in OpForce, temporarily links up with other marines and they frequently quip, "Government cover-ups were not in my job description" and they don't seem too happy about shooting up all the scientists. My favorite part was a funny little alien rocket / grenade (alternate fire) launcher you pick up midway through.

HAHAHA this gun is adorable. If you idle for a little bit Shephard will pet its head. 
Une capture d'Ã©cran de Half-Life: Opposing Force
Par : hoimingmissile


I don't know if there was just some glitch for me but the ending might be more horrifying than intended. Unlike with Freeman, G-Man doesn't offer Shephard an employment opportunity and only says he's going to put him somewhere he can do no harm but also no harm will come to him. Then the credits roll, the file says you have been Detained, and the screen goes black. But after the credits finish you can still see the HUD with your health/armor and you can still jump even though it's just a black screen. I only knew I was jumping because he still makes noise when he lands on the ground. Judging from footstep noise you can't move in any other direction either. What a fate. Trapped in a box in pitch darkness forever.

2 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation amusante
0
RecommandÃ©
11.2 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 5 janvier 2016
Oh man, oh man, oh man.
I was both curious and a little worried after HL - how can a totally new person (Shephard corporal) lead the story, and how will the story go on without Gordon Freeman. As I mentioned in my HL review, I wasn't too happy with Half Life's pacing - the environmental changes that were supposed to delay you were all too random-like - it was just obvious that game mechanics with the sole purpose of slowing you down. It was really unreal. Similarly, it kind of bothered me that even though Gordon IS the archetype of the clever protagonist, the man of science who rises and fights back - it's just surreal that every other scientist is older than him, and can't protect themselves at all. Hell, Gordon was more capable of fighting than the guards, employed by Black Mesa.

So, back to Opposing Force. You play with a soldier (not a bad guy, you don't need to kill scientists if you don't want to) , and your standard gear will be a Deser Eagle and a combat knife - I really liked how realistic this part is compared to Gordon's. The story and the character harmonizes, your character, and even HIS ACTIONS have their part and place in the story. Additionally, claimed by wiki it's his training, Shephard can climb ropes, which is an intresting mechanic in the game, and opens new dimensions in movement and game variety.

And at this point I still have 3 great things to say about the game, but they are kind of interlope -
first of all, the game introduces numerous new weapons - M249 (brutal machinegun), Displacer Cannon, Sniper rifle, the already mentioned Deser Eagle and then - New alien weapons! The rocket-launcher-like Spore Gun, the Shock Roach (my favourite) and the Barnacle Grapple.

Second great thing is partly about Barnacle Grapple - it can be used as a good-ish melee weapon, but it's main usage is just crazy - it can stick to any organic surface, including some pods on the walls, that appeared along with the alien invasion. You have a grapple that can be used to close distances and move around some parts of the map - it's just brilliant.
The Second Great Thing is the creativity of level design. FINALLY the expansion, while being shorter than the base game, uses it's features much more frequently, while inserting these into the game almost flawlessly. There are not only "push the box 3 metres to the right to jump" parts, there is a part when the same box needed to be used 3 times! I guess this is because they knew that after playing the base game, the player will know that they can be moved, and as s/he's accustomed with the feature, can use it in a more varied way.

And the third great things is the overall game integrity. It's good, in my opinion way better than the base game was. There is way less button pressing - once you need to free a medic to take care of the engineer, who can afterwards open a door with a flame cutter. Much intresting than pressing two buttons, isn't it? Most blockades during the game are legit - a huge worm or pillars of flame in the waste burner(?). Things that delay your progress won't just randomly happen, but your way goes through paths where they delaying elements DO exist, making - at least in my eye - Opposing Force a much more immersive game then the original story.

(On the sidenote - bossfight was less monumental, but far less frustrating than repeadly missing jumps in the shower of electric discharges of Nihilanth)

I won't throw numbers around, but while I felt Half-Life was fun/good, I *loved* Opposing Force. I wholeheartedly recommend this purchase if you enjoyed the base game, and you're intrested in the expanded story.
 
adam1224
3,313 produits enregistrÃ©s

22 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation amusante

RecommandÃ©
5.7 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 16 janvier 2015
TL:DR? See Conclusion

NOTE:
Also see my:
Half Life (1) Review
Half-Life 2 Review
Half-Life: Blue Shift Review
Black Mesa Review

INTRODUCTION:
Half-Life: Opposing Force (also known as Government Cover-up Simulator 1999 or Call of Half-Life: Black Mesa Warfare) is a first-person action shooter game that serves as the first expansion to the critically acclaimed and award-winning Half-Life by Valve. Unlike Half-Life however, this title was made by Valve alongside Gearbox Software. Interestingly, unlike Half-Life, the player will see the Black Mesa incident through the eyes of a U.S. Marine(the Military enemies in the first game).

PLOT (No Spoilers)
The player takes the role of Commanderâ€¦(I mean)â€¦Corporal Shephard, a U.S. Marine with the Hazardous Environment Combat Unit who were sent to the Black Mesa Complex for an unknown operation. While en route inside an Osprey to the Complex, Shephard and his team are attacked by Xen air-borne units forcing the Osprey to crash knocking him out. Follow Shephard in his trek across the massive Black Mesa Complex in an attempt to escape while uncovering a government cover-up that would pitch Shephard against U.S. Black Operations Units, Xen forces, and a new alien threat called Race X.

PROS:
+ New enemy types with unique abilities and weapons (instead of just rehashing the materials of the main game)
+ Fun and interesting new weapons such as the Displacer Cannon and Shock Roach
+ Well made action-packed story which shows players a different side of the Black Mesa Incident
+ Introduction of new game mechanics such as Rope Climbing, Secondary heavy melee attacks, Grappling hooks (Barnacle hook?), Night vision and Portal guns that send you (or your target) to another dimension (See Displacer Cannon above)
+ Possibly the first FPS game to implement a Military Squad game mechanic
+ Entertaining Tutorial with cultural references
+ Story intersects with some important Half-Life 1 events
+ Good voice acting for its time
+ Andrian Shephard is possibly a descendant of Jack (protagonist of Bioshock) due to his uncanny ability to wield a Wrench in battle against Black Ops Soldiers and Aliens.

â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥:
- Relatively short game with me clocking around 5 hours of game time on hard mode.
- New squad mechanics is clunky (I can actually forgive this since itâ€™s possibly the first squad mechanic on an FPS game)
- Puzzles are not that satisfying to solve
- Final chapter leading to the final boss feels rushed and underdeveloped
- Unsatisfying and easy final boss

CONCLUSION:
GREAT EXPANSION that I HIGHLY RECOMMENDED specially for those who played the first Half-Life game and I say this because it is littered with several subtle nods from the main game.

WORTH IT?
MUST BUY AND MUST HAVE. I, however, do recommend you purchase the Half-Life Anthology if you already have Half-Life 2 but if you do not have it, get Half-Life Complete.

FINAL NOTES:
Opposing Force is a good example on how to make an expansion; it introduces new game mechanics, new enemies, new weapons and all the while delivering a new story that still being closely related to the main Half-Life plot.

---------------------------------------------------------
Like my Reviews? Follow my Curator's Page:

Miyumi's Review Corner (MIRECO)
 
Miyumi

73 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
2 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation amusante

RecommandÃ©
24.5 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 27 septembre 2014
Making an expansion pack to Half Life was no small task. But Gearbox was more than willing to set the bar.

Opposing Force is fundamentally a similar experience to Half Life 1. But it expanded on it's core foundation in numerous ways. There are new actually interesting weapons, friendly squad members who serve different non-combat roles and a few other things.

But what Opposing Force does well is it continues the legacy left by Half Life 1. It has consistantly good pacing and like Half Life dynamically goes from low-key puzzle segments to high octane action horror. It's just so much fun to play it's an actual challenge for me to pick between playing either Half Life or Opposing Force. Since both games compliment each other so well.

If you like Valve games, or even first person shooters. You owe it to yourself to play Opposing Force. It is one of those games that you just can't stop playing.
 
Bluebeak

Half-Life: Opposing Force
*SciFi Action von 1999.

UrsprÃ¼nglich als Add-on zu Half-Life, ist es nun ein eigenstÃ¤ndiges Spiel. Gespielt wird wieder in der Black Mesa Research Facility.
Du schlÃ¼pfst in die Rolle von Corporal Adrian Shephard, ein TeamfÃ¼hrer der US Marines. Und das ist echt gut gelungen.

Der Name Opposing Force ist eine Anspielung auf ein physikalisches PhÃ¤nomen. Opposing Force spielt dabei auf das dritte Newtonsche Gesetz an, wo die entgegengerichtete Kraft im Englischen â€Opposing Forceâ€œ genannt wird.
Aber das nur so am Rande als Hintergrundwissen.

Das Spiel beinhaltet neue taktische MÃ¶glichkeiten: So ist es jetzt mÃ¶glich, an Seilen hochzuklettern oder sich von einem Seil zum nÃ¤chsten zu schwingen. Zudem ist hÃ¤ufig die Zusammenarbeit mit anderen Soldaten notwendig, um z. B. einen gemeinsamen Angriff zu starten oder sich von einem Pionier eine verschlossene TÃ¼r aufschweiÃŸen zu lassen. HÃ¤ufig findet man auch SanitÃ¤ter, die neben UnterstÃ¼tzung mit der Pistole auch Heilung von Wunden bieten.

Zudem gibt es auch neue Arten von auÃŸerirdischen Gegnern. Anders als bei Half-Life selbst, wurden die menschlichen Gegner in der deutschen Version diesmal nicht durch Roboter ersetzt.

Das Spiel setzt nicht die Handlung fort, sondern sie verlÃ¤uft parallel zu den Ereignissen von Half-Life. WÃ¤hrend Gordon Freeman durch Black Mesa eilt, wirst du als Shephard mit einem Team dorthin geschickt, um den Wissenschaftler auszuschalten. Die Transportmaschine wird jedoch beschossen und stÃ¼rzt ab. Du muÃŸt dich alleine durch Black Mesa schlagen, wobei dich nicht nur auÃŸerirdische Wesen aufhalten, sondern auch die Black Ops. Diese wurden geschickt, um nicht nur die VorgÃ¤nge in Black Mesa zu vertuschen, sondern auch die Marines auszuschalten, die daran beteiligt waren.

Du kehrst als MilitÃ¤rspezialist zur Black Mesa Research Facility zurÃ¼ck. Dein Auftrag: Gordon Freeman zu eliminieren.
... nÃ¶, weiter erzÃ¤hle ich nicht.
Also mach dich auf und finde selbst heraus was da los ist.
Genial gemachtes sehr witziges FPS, mit Tiefgang.

Meine Gruppe und mein Archiv mit Ã¼ber 2.750 Reviews hier:
https://steamcommunity.com/groups/hoi4deu
Ich habe etliches Recherchiert*.

ğŸ‘‘ Powered by HoI 4 Deu Kuratorengruppe auf deutsch/englisch ğŸ‘‘
â €â €â €ğŸ‰ Folgen
und mehr Reviews von mir entdecken ğŸŠ


Half-Life: Opposing Force
* SciFi Action from 1999.

Originally an add-on to Half-Life, it is now a standalone game. Again, the game is played in the Black Mesa Research Facility.
You take on the role of Corporal Adrian Shephard, a team leader in the US Marines. And that worked out really well.

The name opposing force is an allusion to a physical phenomenon. Opposing force alludes to Newton's third law, where the opposing force is called "opposing force" in English.
But only as a side note as background knowledge.

The game includes new tactical options: It is now possible to climb up ropes or swing from one rope to the next. In addition, cooperation with other soldiers is often necessary in order to e.g. B. to launch a joint attack or to have a pioneer weld a locked door open. Often one can also find paramedics who offer not only support with the pistol but also healing of wounds.

There are also new types of alien enemies. In contrast to Half-Life itself, this time the human opponents were not replaced by robots in the German version.

The game does not continue the storyline, but rather runs parallel to the events of Half-Life. While Gordon Freeman rushes through Black Mesa, you are sent there as Shephard with a team to take down the scientist. However, the transport machine is shot at and crashes. You have to fight your way alone through Black Mesa, where you are not only stopped by extraterrestrial beings, but also by the Black Ops. These were sent to not only cover up what was going on at Black Mesa, but also to take out the Marines who were involved.

You return to the Black Mesa Research Facility as a military specialist. Your mission: to eliminate Gordon Freeman.
... nope, I won't tell any further.
So get up and find out for yourself what's going on.
Ingeniously made, very funny FPS, with depth.

My group and my archive with over 2,750 reviews here:
https://steamcommunity.com/groups/hoi4deu
I did a lot of research *.

Ğ˜ Ñ‚ĞµĞ¿ĞµÑ€ÑŒ Ğ¾Ğ½ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸Ğ½ - Ñ Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ¼ ÑĞ¾ÑĞ»ÑƒĞ¶Ğ¸Ğ²Ñ†Ñ‹, ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‹Ğµ Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¼Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»ĞµĞ·Ğ½ĞµĞµ Ñ‚Ñ€ÑƒÑĞ»Ğ¸Ğ²Ñ‹Ñ… "Ğ±Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸ĞºĞ¾Ğ²".

Ğ Ğ°Ğ·ÑƒĞ¼ĞµĞµÑ‚ÑÑ, Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ†ĞµÑÑ Ñ Ñ‚Ğ°ĞºĞ¸Ğ¼ Ğ·Ğ°Ğ´ĞµĞ»Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ ÑĞ´ĞµĞ»Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ñ„Ğ°Ğ½Ñ‚Ğ°ÑÑ‚Ğ¸Ñ‡ĞµÑĞºĞ¸Ğ¹, Ğ¸ "ĞºĞ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ±ĞºĞ° Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ´Ğ°Ñ‡" Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ²ĞµĞ»Ğ°. ĞŸĞµÑ€ĞµĞ´ Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¼Ğ¸ Ğ½Ğµ "ÑÑ‚Ñ€Ğ°ÑˆĞ¸Ğ»ĞºĞ° Ñ Ğ°Ğ²Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼", Ğ° Ğ½Ğ°ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ÑÑ‰Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ğ±Ğ¾ĞµĞ²Ğ¸Ğº, Ñ ĞºĞ¾Ğ¾Ğ¿ĞµÑ€Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¼Ğ¸ Ğ´ĞµĞ¹ÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ¸ÑĞ¼Ğ¸ Ğ² Ğ½ĞµĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‹Ñ… Ğ¼ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ°Ñ…, Ğ½Ğµ Ğ»Ğ¸ÑˆÑ‘Ğ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹, Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ°Ğ²Ğ´Ğ° Ğ¸ Ğ¿ÑÑ‚Ğ¸Ğ¼Ğ¸Ğ½ÑƒÑ‚Ğ¾Ğº Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ·Ğ³Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ ÑˆÑ‚ÑƒÑ€Ğ¼Ğ°, Ğ²Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ´Ğµ Ğ·Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ ĞºĞ¸ÑĞ»Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ³Ğ¸Ğ³Ğ°Ğ½Ñ‚ÑĞºĞ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ñ‡ĞµÑ€Ğ²ĞµĞ³Ğ»Ğ°Ğ·Ğ°. Ğ‘Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ñ‹Ñ… ÑÑ†ĞµĞ½ ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¾ Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒÑˆĞµ, ÑÑ€ĞµĞ¶Ğ¸ÑÑĞ¸Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ğ½Ñ‹ Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ¸ Ğ½Ğ° Ñ‚Ğ²ĞµÑ€Ğ´ÑƒÑ "Ğ¿ÑÑ‚Ñ‘Ñ€ĞºÑƒ", Ñ‚ĞµĞ¼ Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ»ĞµĞµ, Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ² Ğ½Ğ°ÑˆĞµĞ¼ Ñ€Ğ°ÑĞ¿Ğ¾Ñ€ÑĞ¶ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğ¸ Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ğµ Ğ¾Ñ€ÑƒĞ¶Ğ¸Ğµ, Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ»ĞµĞµ Ğ´ĞµĞ¹ÑÑ‚Ğ²ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ğ¾Ğµ, Ğ½ĞµĞ¶ĞµĞ»Ğ¸ Ğ² Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ³Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ°Ğ»Ğµ. ĞšĞ°Ğº Ğ²Ğ°Ğ¼ "ĞŸÑƒÑÑ‚Ñ‹Ğ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‘Ğ»" Ñ Ğ»Ğ°Ğ·ĞµÑ€Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¼ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸Ñ†ĞµĞ»Ğ¾Ğ¼? Ğ Ğ¿ÑƒĞ»ĞµĞ¼Ñ‘Ñ‚? Ğ ÑĞ½Ğ°Ğ¹Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ÑĞºĞ°Ñ Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ½Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ²ĞºĞ°? Ğ Ğ¿ÑƒÑˆĞºĞ°-Ñ‡Ñ‘Ñ€Ğ½Ğ°Ñ Ğ´Ñ‹Ñ€Ğ°? RecommandÃ©
12.4 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 17 mai 2014
Another expansion pack for the original HL, this time giving us a look into the "enemy side" and the way that the events of Black Mesa affected the Marine Corps called to "contain" the situation. The main character Corporal Adrian Sherpard is brought into the facility but things dont go like planned and all hell is broken loose.
Another short game that complements the original story of Gordon Freeman, but the ending of this game leads me to believe that we might see more of this character in future installements of HL, so it might not be just an expansion pack game.

9/10.
 
Tiggaz

Â¿Que es Half Life: Opposing Force?

Para el ciego, es la luz
Para el sordo, es el sonido
Para el mudo, es la voz
Para el enfermo, es la cura
Para el cocinero, su mejor platillo
Para el obrero, su mejor obra
Para el hambriento, la comida
Para el soltero, el amor
Para el filosofo, la respuesta
Para el empresario, el dinero

Si Half Life: Opposing Force tiene un millon de fans, soy uno de ellos

Si Half Life: Opposing Force tiene cien mil fans, soy uno de ellos

Si Half Life: Opposing Force tiene diez mil fans, soy uno de ellos

Si Half Life: Opposing Force tiene mil fans, soy uno de ellos

Si Half Life: Opposing Force tiene cien fans, soy uno de ellos

Si Half Life: Opposing Force tiene diez fans, soy uno de ellos

Si Half Life: Opposing Force tiene un fan, soy ese fan

Si Half Life: Opposing Force no tiene fans, es por que ya no existo

Si el mundo esta en contra de Half Life: Opposing Force, yo estoy en contra del mundo

Si Half Life: Opposing Force ordena, yo obedezco

Si Half Life: Opposing Force habla, yo escucho

Pero sobretodo, cuando el apocalipsis azote este plano terrenal y todos seamos juzgados, rezare, por haber nacido y existido en el mismo tiempo que Half Life: Opposing Force y cuando el momento llegue morire sonriendo sabiendo que pude experimentar Half Life: Opposing Force en su maxima gloria.

Dios bendiga a Half Life: Opposing Force, amen
 
DJ ALEXIS EL NO. 1 DE VENEZUELA

Ğ¡Ğ¾Ğ±ÑÑ‚Ğ²ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ñ‡ĞµĞ¼Ñƒ Ğ±Ñ‹ Ğ¸ Ğ½ĞµÑ‚, Ñ‚ĞµĞ¼ Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ»ĞµĞµ Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ²ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ½ Ğ°Ğ´Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ½ Ğ±Ñ‹Ğ» Ñ€ĞµĞ±ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ¼ Ğ¸Ğ· Gearbox Software, Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ¸ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ»Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ½ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ¸ Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ñ‹Ğµ Ğ¸Ğ´ĞµĞ¸ Ğ²Ğ¾ Ğ²ÑĞµĞ»ĞµĞ½Ğ½ÑƒÑ, Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ğ¸Ğ² Ğ¸ Ñ€Ğ°ÑÑˆĞ¸Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ² ĞµÑ‘, Ñ‚Ğ°Ğº ÑĞºĞ°Ğ·Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ ÑĞ²ĞµĞ¶Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ğ²Ğ·Ğ³Ğ»ÑĞ´ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ½ĞµĞ¹ ĞºĞ¾Ğ¼Ğ°Ğ½Ğ´Ñ‹. Ğ¡Ğ¾Ğ±ÑÑ‚Ğ²ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ¸ Ñ‚Ğ°Ğº Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ğ¾ÑÑ‚ÑƒĞ¿Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ¸. ĞĞ´Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ½ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ñ€Ğ°ÑÑˆĞ¸Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ» Ğ²ÑĞµĞ»ĞµĞ½Ğ½ÑƒÑ Half-life, Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ´Ğ°Ğ¶Ğµ Ğ¿Ğ¾ Ğ¼Ğ¾ĞµĞ¼Ñƒ Ğ¼Ğ½ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ Ğ¿Ñ€ĞµĞ²Ğ·Ğ¾ÑˆĞµĞ» Ğ¿Ğ¾ ĞºĞ°Ñ‡ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ²Ñƒ Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ³Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ°Ğ». Ğ•ÑÑ‚ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ²ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ğ¾ ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ñ€Ñ‹Ğµ Ñ„Ğ¸ÑˆĞºĞ¸ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ±Ñ‹Ğ»Ğ¸ ÑƒÑ‚ĞµÑ€ÑĞ½Ñ‹, Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ğ¸Ğ¼ĞµÑÑ‰Ğ¸ĞµÑÑ Ğ´Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¸Ğ½ÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ° Ğ±Ñ‹Ğ»Ğ¸ Ñ Ğ»Ğ¸Ñ…Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½ĞµĞ½Ñ‹ Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ¼Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ğ»ÑÑĞ°Ğ¼Ğ¸, Ğ° Ğ½ĞµĞ´Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ñ‚ĞºĞ¸ Ğ»Ğ¸Ğ±Ğ¾ ÑĞ³Ğ»Ğ°Ğ¶ĞµĞ½Ñ‹ Ğ»Ğ¸Ğ±Ğ¾ Ğ¸ÑĞ¿Ñ€Ğ°Ğ²Ğ»ĞµĞ½Ñ‹. Ğ˜Ñ‚Ğ°Ğº, Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ¶Ğµ Ğ½Ğ°Ñ Ğ¶Ğ´ĞµÑ‚ Ğ² Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğ¸ Opposing Force?

Ğ¢Ñ‹ ĞºÑ‚Ğ¾ Ñ‚Ğ°ĞºĞ¾Ğ¹ Ğ¼ĞµÑˆĞ¾Ğº Ñ Ğ´ĞµpÑŒĞ¼Ğ¾Ğ¼?
Ğ¡ Ğ´ĞµpÑŒĞ¼Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ¸ Ñ Ğ»ĞµĞ´ĞµĞ½Ñ†Ğ°Ğ¼Ğ¸ Ğ½Ğ°Ñˆ Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ÑĞ¾Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¶, Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ»Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ½Ğ¾ ÑƒĞ·Ğ½Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ½Ğµ ÑƒĞ´Ğ°ÑÑ‚ÑÑ, Ğ°Ğ´Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ½ ÑĞ»ĞµĞ´ÑƒĞµÑ‚ Ğ·Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ¶ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ² Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ³Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ°Ğ»Ğµ Ñ‚Ñ€Ğ°Ğ´Ğ¸Ñ†Ğ¸Ğ¸ Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾, Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ³Ğ»Ğ°Ğ²Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ³ĞµÑ€Ğ¾Ğ¹ - ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ ĞºĞ°Ğº Ğ±Ñ‹ ÑĞ°Ğ¼ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ¾Ğº. Ğ Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ÑĞ¾Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¶Ğµ Ğ¸Ğ·Ğ²ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ½Ğ¾ Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒĞºĞ¾ Ñ‚Ğ¾, Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ´ Ğ¾ÑĞ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¼Ğ¸ ÑĞ¾Ğ±Ñ‹Ñ‚Ğ¸ÑĞ¼Ğ¸ Ğ¾Ğ½ Ğ±Ñ‹Ğ» Ğ¼Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾ Ğ¸ Ñ„Ğ¸Ğ·Ğ¸Ñ‡ĞµÑĞºĞ¸ ÑƒĞ½Ğ¸Ğ¶ĞµĞ½ ĞºĞ¾Ğ¼Ğ°Ğ½Ğ´Ğ¸Ñ€Ğ°Ğ¼Ğ¸ Ğ² Ğ°Ñ€Ğ¼Ğ¸Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾ÑˆĞµĞ» Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ³Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ²ĞºÑƒ ĞºĞ¾Ğ¼Ğ°Ğ½Ğ´Ğ¸Ñ€Ğ° Ğ²Ğ·Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ° ÑĞ¾Ğ»Ğ´Ğ°Ñ‚, Ğ° Ñ‚Ğ°ĞºĞ¶Ğµ Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ½ĞµĞ²ÑƒÑ Ğ¸ Ğ±Ğ¾ĞµĞ²ÑƒÑ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ³Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ²ĞºĞ¸, Ğ¸ Ğ±Ñ‹Ğ» Ğ·Ğ°Ğ±Ñ€Ğ¾ÑˆĞµĞ½ Ğ½Ğ° ÑĞ²Ğ¾Ñ‘ Ğ½Ğ°Ğ²ĞµÑ€Ğ½Ğ¾Ğµ Ğ¿ĞµÑ€Ğ²Ğ¾Ğµ Ğ±Ğ¾ĞµĞ²Ğ¾Ğµ Ğ·Ğ°Ğ´Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸Ğµ Ğ² ĞºĞ¾Ğ¼Ğ¿Ğ»ĞµĞºÑ Ğ¢Ñ‘Ğ¼Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¹ ĞœĞµÑÑÑ‹ Ğ§Ñ‘Ñ€Ğ½Ğ°Ñ ĞœĞµĞ·Ğ°. Ğ•ÑÑ‚ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ²ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ²ÑÑ‘ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ»Ğ¾ Ğ¸Ğ´Ñ‚Ğ¸ Ğ³Ğ»Ğ°Ğ´ĞºĞ¾, ĞºĞ°ĞºĞ¾Ğ¹ ÑˆÑƒÑ‚ĞµÑ€ Ğ±ĞµĞ· Ğ²Ğ½ĞµĞ·Ğ°Ğ¿Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸ÑÑ‚ÑƒĞ¿Ğ° Ğ¾Ñ‚ĞºĞ°Ğ·Ğ° Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ‰Ğµ Ğ²ÑĞµĞ³Ğ¾ Ñƒ Ğ»ĞµÑ‚Ğ°Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ°Ğ¿Ğ¿Ğ°Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ° Ğ¿ÑƒÑ‚Ñ‘Ğ¼ Ğ²Ğ¼ĞµÑˆĞ°Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ÑŒÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ° Ğ¸Ğ·Ğ²Ğ½Ğµ? Ğ’ Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ‰ĞµĞ¼ Ğ´Ğ¾ Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ‡ĞºĞ¸ Ğ²Ñ‹ÑĞ°Ğ´ĞºĞ¸ Ğ¼Ñ‹ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ»ĞµÑ‚Ğ°ĞµĞ¼, ÑƒÑĞ¿ĞµÑˆĞ½Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ğ°Ğ´Ğ°ĞµĞ¼ Ğ½Ğ° Ğ·ĞµĞ¼Ğ»Ñ Ğ° Ğ·Ğ°Ñ‚ĞµĞ¼ Ğ² Ğ¾Ğ±Ğ¼Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğº. ĞŸÑ€Ğ°Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾, Ğ·Ğ°Ñ‡ĞµĞ¼ Ğ²Ğ¾ĞµĞ²Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ, Ñ Ğ»ÑƒÑ‡ÑˆĞµ Ğ¿Ğ¾ÑĞ¿Ğ»Ñ, Ğ° Ğ²ĞµÑ€Ğ½Ñ‹Ğµ Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ñ€Ğ¸Ñ‰Ğ¸ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ñ‘ ÑĞ¿ÑÑ‰ĞµĞµ Ñ‚ĞµĞ»Ğ¾ Ğ² Ğ»Ğ°Ğ·Ğ°Ñ€ĞµÑ‚ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸Ñ‚Ğ°Ñ‰Ğ°Ñ‚. ĞĞ°Ğ²ĞµÑ€Ğ½Ğ¾Ğµ ĞĞ´Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ°Ğ½ Ğ¨ĞµĞ¿Ğ°Ñ€Ğ´ - Ğ½Ğ°Ñˆ Ğ³Ğ»Ğ°Ğ²Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ³ĞµÑ€Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ñ‚Ğ°Ğº Ğ¸ Ğ´ÑƒĞ¼Ğ°Ğ». Ğ’Ğ¾Ñ‚ Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾ÑĞ¿Ğ°Ğ» Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ½Ñƒ ÑĞ¾Ğ±Ñ‹Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ğ¸Ğ´ÑƒÑ‰Ğ¸Ñ… Ğ¿Ğ°Ñ€Ğ°Ğ»Ğ»ĞµĞ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾ ÑÑĞ¶ĞµÑ‚Ñƒ Half-life, Ğ¸ Ğ¾Ñ‡Ğ½ÑƒĞ»ÑÑ Ğ¾Ñ‚ ÑĞ»Ğ°Ğ´ĞºĞ¸Ñ… ÑĞ½Ğ¾Ğ² ÑƒĞ¶Ğµ Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ´Ğ°, ĞºĞ¾Ğ³Ğ´Ğ° Ğ²Ğ¾ÑĞºĞ¸ Ğ¾Ğ±Ğ´ĞµĞ»Ğ°Ğ²ÑˆĞ¸ÑÑŒ Ğ¾Ñ‚ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ñ‰Ğ¸ Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ»Ğ°Ğ½ĞµÑ‚ÑĞ½, Ñ€ĞµÑˆĞ¸Ğ»Ğ¸ Ñ€Ğ²Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ ĞºĞ¾Ğ³Ñ‚Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ğ¾ĞºĞ° Ñ†ĞµĞ»Ñ‹. ĞÑ‚ÑÑĞ´Ğ° Ğ¸ ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ñ€Ñ‚ÑƒĞµÑ‚ ÑÑĞ¶ĞµÑ‚ Ğ°Ğ´Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ° Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸ĞºĞ»ÑÑ‡ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ Ğ½Ğ°ÑˆĞµĞ³Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ‚ĞµĞ¶Ğµ. ĞĞ¿Ğ¸ÑÑ‹Ğ²Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ²ĞµÑÑŒ ÑÑĞ¶ĞµÑ‚ Ñ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ±ÑƒĞ´Ñƒ Ğ¿Ğ¾ Ğ´Ğ²ÑƒĞ¼ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸Ñ‡Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¼: 1) Ğ’Ğ´Ñ€ÑƒĞ³ ĞºÑ‚Ğ¾-Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ°Ğ», Ğ¸ Ñ Ğ¸ÑĞ¿Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‡Ñƒ Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼Ñƒ Ğ²Ğ¿ĞµÑ‡Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ»ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğµ, Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»ÑƒÑ‡Ñƒ Ğ¼Ğ¸Ğ½ÑƒÑ Ğº ĞºĞ°Ñ€Ğ¼Ğµ Ğ¸ Ğº Ğ¾Ğ±Ğ·Ğ¾Ñ€Ñƒ. 2) Ğ¯ - Ğ»ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ°Ñ Ğ¶oĞ¿Ğ°.

Ğ£Ñ‚Ğ¸-Ğ¿ÑƒÑ‚Ğ¸, ĞºĞ°ĞºĞ°Ñ Ğ¼Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ°Ñ Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ³Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ‡ĞµÑĞºĞ°Ñ Ğ½ÑÑˆĞºĞ°.
ĞšĞ°Ğº Ğ²Ñ‹ Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ·Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ°Ğ´Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¸ÑÑŒ, ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ñ‚ Ğ°Ğ±Ğ·Ğ°Ñ† Ğ±ÑƒĞ´ĞµÑ‚ Ğ³Ğ»Ğ°ÑĞ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ¾Ğ± Ğ¾Ñ€ÑƒĞ¶Ğ¸Ğ¸ Ğ¼Ğ°ÑÑĞ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ´ĞµĞ¼Ğ¾ĞºÑ€Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ¸. GS Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¿Ğ¾ÑĞºÑƒĞ¿Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ¸ÑÑŒ Ğ½Ğ° Ñ„Ğ°Ğ½Ñ‚Ğ°Ğ·Ğ¸Ñ: Ğ¾Ñ€ÑƒĞ¶Ğ¸Ñ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ±Ğ°Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ¾ÑÑŒ ĞºĞ°Ğº Ñ‚ĞµÑ…Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ‡ĞµÑĞºĞ¾Ğ³Ğ¾, Ğ²Ğ¾ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾, Ñ‚Ğ°Ğº Ğ¸ Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ»Ğ°Ğ½ĞµÑ‚Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¸ÑÑ…Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ´ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ.   • ĞĞ¾Ğ¶ - ĞµÑ‰Ğµ Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ½Ğ° Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ñ Ğ¼Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ¸ÑˆĞºĞ°. Ğ¡ĞºĞ¾Ñ€Ğ¾ÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ°ĞºĞ¸ Ğ²Ñ‹ÑˆĞµ Ñ‡ĞµĞ¼ Ñƒ ĞºĞ»ÑÑ‡Ğ°, Ñ‡ÑƒÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ¶Ğµ ÑƒĞ±Ğ¾Ğ¹Ğ½Ğ¾ÑÑ‚ÑŒ, Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ²ÑÑ‘ Ğ¶Ğµ Ğ²ĞµÑÑŒĞ¼Ğ° ÑÑ„Ñ„ĞµĞºÑ‚Ğ¸Ğ²ĞµĞ½ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ² ÑĞ»Ğ°Ğ±Ñ‹Ñ… Ğ²Ñ€Ğ°Ğ³Ğ¾Ğ² Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ¸ Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ»ÑƒÑˆĞµĞ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ñ… ÑĞ¾Ğ»Ğ´Ğ°Ñ‚.
  • Ğ‘Ğ°Ñ€Ğ½Ğ°ĞºĞ» - Ğ¸Ğ·Ğ²Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‰ĞµĞ½Ñ†Ñ‹ ÑƒÑ‡ĞµĞ½Ñ‹Ğµ ÑĞ¼Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ»Ğ¸ Ğ¾Ñ‚ĞºĞ»ĞµĞ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ½Ğ¸ĞºĞ° Ğ¾Ñ‚ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ»ĞºĞ°, Ñ‚Ğ°Ğº Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ² Ğ°Ğ´Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ½Ğµ ĞµĞ³Ğ¾ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ¸ÑĞ¿Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒĞ·Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ ĞºĞ°Ğº Ğ¾Ñ€ÑƒĞ¶Ğ¸Ğµ. Ğ¢Ğ°ĞºĞ¶Ğµ ĞµÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒÑ‚ĞµÑ€Ğ½Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ½Ğ°Ñ Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ°ĞºĞ° Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ĞµĞ¿Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‚Ğ¸Ñ€ÑƒÑÑ‰Ğ°Ñ Ğ²Ñ€Ğ°Ğ³Ğ¾Ğ² Ğ² Ğ½ĞµĞ¸Ğ·Ğ²ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ½Ñ‹Ğµ Ğ´Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¸, Ğ½Ğ¾ ÑĞ¼Ñ‹ÑĞ»Ğ° Ğ² Ğ½ĞµĞ¹ Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒÑˆĞ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ½ĞµÑ‚.
  • Ğ¡Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¹Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ÑĞºĞ°Ñ Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ½Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ²ĞºĞ° - Ğ¼ĞµÑ‡Ñ‚Ğ° Ğ»ÑĞ±Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ ĞºĞµĞ¼Ğ¿ĞµÑ€Ğ°. ĞœĞ¾Ñ‰Ğ½Ğ¾Ğµ Ğ¾Ñ€ÑƒĞ¶Ğ¸Ğµ ÑĞ½Ğ¾ÑÑÑ‰ĞµĞµ Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ğ» Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒÑˆĞ¸Ğ½ÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ¾ Ğ²Ñ€Ğ°Ğ³Ğ¾Ğ² Ñ Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾-Ğ´Ğ²ÑƒÑ… Ğ²Ñ‹ÑÑ‚Ñ€ĞµĞ»Ğ¾Ğ², Ğ¿Ğ°Ñ‚Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ½Ñ‹ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ°Ğ´Ğ°ÑÑ‚ÑÑ Ğ½Ğµ ÑĞ»Ğ¸ÑˆĞºĞ¾Ğ¼ Ñ‡Ğ°ÑÑ‚Ğ¾, Ğ¿Ğ¾ÑĞµĞ¼Ñƒ, Ñ Ğ½Ğ°Ğ´ĞµÑÑÑŒ Ğ²Ñ‹ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ±ÑƒĞ´ĞµÑ‚Ğµ ÑÑ‚Ñ€ĞµĞ»ÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ¸Ğ· Ğ½ĞµÑ‘ Ğ¿Ğ¾ Ñ…ĞµĞ´ĞºÑ€Ğ°Ğ±Ğ°Ğ¼?
  • Ğ¡Ğ¿Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¼ĞµÑ‚Ğ°Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ÑŒ - Ğ±Ğ¸Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¸Ñ‡ĞµÑĞºĞ°Ñ Ğ½ÑÑˆĞºĞ° ÑÑ‚Ñ€ĞµĞ»ÑÑÑ‰Ğ°Ñ Ğ·ĞµĞ»Ñ‘Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¼Ğ¸ ÑĞ¿Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ°Ğ¼Ğ¸, Ğ´Ğ²Ğ° Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ´Ğ° Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ°ĞºĞ¸ - Ñ€Ğ¸ĞºĞ¾ÑˆĞµÑ‚ÑÑ‰Ğ°Ñ ÑĞ¿Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ° Ğ¸ Ğ²Ğ·Ñ€Ñ‹Ğ²Ğ°ÑÑ‰Ğ°ÑÑÑ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸ ĞºĞ¾Ğ½Ñ‚Ğ°ĞºÑ‚Ğµ Ñ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ²ĞµÑ€Ñ…Ğ½Ğ¾ÑÑ‚ÑŒÑ. Ğ‘Ğ¾ĞµĞ¿Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ¿Ğ°ÑĞ°Ğ¼Ğ¸ ÑĞ»ÑƒĞ¶Ğ°Ñ‚ Ğ·ĞµĞ»Ñ‘Ğ½Ñ‹Ğµ ÑˆĞ°Ñ€Ğ¸ĞºĞ¸ Ñ€Ğ°ÑÑ‚ÑƒÑ‰Ğ¸Ğµ Ğ½Ğ° Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ³Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ‡ĞµÑĞºĞ¸Ñ… Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ²ĞµÑ€Ñ…Ğ½Ğ¾ÑÑ‚ÑÑ…, Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ±Ğ¾ĞµĞ·Ğ°Ğ¿Ğ°Ñ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½ÑĞµÑ‚ÑÑ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ³Ğ¾, Ğ¿Ğ¾ÑĞµĞ¼Ñƒ Ğ¿Ğ¾ÑÑ€ĞµĞ´Ğ¸ Ğ±Ğ¾Ñ ĞµÑ‘ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½Ğ¸ÑˆÑŒ, Ğ° ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ¶Ğ´Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ¼Ğ¸Ğ½ÑƒÑ‚ Ğ¿Ğ¾ 5 Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ±Ğ¾ĞµĞ·Ğ°Ğ¿Ğ°ÑĞ° ÑƒÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼Ğ»ÑĞµÑ‚. ĞœĞ¾Ğ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ¸ÑĞ¿Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒĞ·Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ±Ñ‹ÑÑ‚Ñ€Ğ¾ Ñ‚ĞµÑ€ÑĞµÑ‚ Ğ°ĞºÑ‚ÑƒĞ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾ÑÑ‚ÑŒ.
  • Ğ¨Ğ¾ĞºĞ¾Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ñ‚Ğ°Ñ€Ğ°ĞºĞ°Ğ½ - Ğ¼ĞµÑ‡Ñ‚Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¸ Ğ»Ğ¸ Ğ²Ñ‹ ĞºĞ¾Ğ³Ğ´Ğ°-Ğ»Ğ¸Ğ±Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¶Ğ°Ñ€Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ¿ÑÑ‚ÑƒÑ Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ‡ĞºÑƒ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ½Ğ¸ĞºÑƒ Ñ‚Ğ¾ĞºĞ¾Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ¼ Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ñ€ÑĞ´Ğ¾Ğ¼? Ğ•ÑĞ»Ğ¸ Ğ´Ğ°, Ñ‚Ğ¾ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ğ¾Ñ€ÑƒĞ¶Ğ¸Ğµ Ğ´Ğ»Ñ Ğ²Ğ°Ñ. Ğ‘Ğ¾ĞµĞ¿Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ¿Ğ°ÑÑ‹ Ğ²Ğ¾ÑÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ½Ğ°Ğ²Ğ»Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ°ÑÑ‚ÑÑ ÑĞ°Ğ¼Ğ¸ Ñ‡ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ· Ğ½ĞµĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğµ Ğ²Ñ€ĞµĞ¼Ñ, Ñ‚Ğ°Ğº Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ¸ÑĞ¿Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒĞ·Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ñ…Ğ¾Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ²ÑÑ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ñƒ Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ»Ñ‘Ñ‚.
  • ĞŸÑƒĞ»ĞµĞ¼Ñ‘Ñ‚ - Ğ´ÑƒÑ€ÑˆĞ»Ğ°Ğ³ Ğ¸Ğ· Ğ²Ñ€Ğ°Ğ³Ğ¾Ğ² Ğ¾Ğ±ĞµÑĞ¿ĞµÑ‡ĞµĞ½. Ğ–Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒ Ğ¿Ğ°Ñ‚Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ² Ğ½Ğµ ÑĞ»Ğ¸ÑˆĞºĞ¾Ğ¼ Ğ¼Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ°Ğ´Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ÑÑ.

ĞĞ´Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ½ Ñ‚Ğ°ĞºĞ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ ĞºĞ°Ñ‡ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ° Ğ±Ñ‹Ğ» Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ·Ğ½Ğ°Ğ½ Ğ½ĞµĞºĞ°Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¼? Ğ”Ğ° Ğ¸Ğ´Ğ¸Ñ‚Ğµ Ğ²Ñ‹ "@#$â„– Valve!
Ğ˜ Ğ²ÑÑ‘ Ğ±Ñ‹ Ğ¿Ñ€ĞµĞºÑ€Ğ°ÑĞ½Ğ¾: ĞµÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ñ‚ÑƒÑ‚ Ğ¸ Ğ³ĞµĞ¹Ğ¼Ğ¿Ğ»ĞµĞ¹ ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ´Ğ°Ñ‘Ñ‚ Ñ€Ğ°ÑÑĞ»Ğ°Ğ±Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒÑÑ, ÑĞ»Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ¿Ğ¾ ÑÑ€Ğ°Ğ²Ğ½ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ Ñ Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ³Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ·Ñ€Ğ¾ÑĞ»Ğ°, Ğ° ĞºĞ¾Ğ»Ğ¸Ñ‡ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ¾ Ğ²Ñ€Ğ°Ğ³Ğ¾Ğ², ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‹Ğµ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ³ÑƒÑ‚ Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ°Ğ²Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ¨ĞµĞ¿Ğ°Ñ€Ğ´Ğ° Ğ² Ñ€Ğ°Ğ¹ÑĞºĞ¸Ğ¹ ÑĞ°Ğ´ ĞºÑƒÑˆĞ°Ñ‚ÑŒ ÑĞ°Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¾-Ñ„Ñ€ÑƒĞºÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ²Ñ‹Ğµ Ğ¿Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ´Ñ‹ ÑƒĞ²ĞµĞ»Ğ¸Ñ‡Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ°ÑÑŒ Ğ½Ğ° Ğ¿Ğ¾Ñ€ÑĞ´Ğ¾Ğº, Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ°ĞºÑ‚Ğ¸Ñ‡ĞµÑĞºĞ¸ Ğ²Ñ‹Ñ‚ĞµÑĞ½Ğ¸Ğ² Ğ¿ÑƒÑˆĞµÑ‡Ğ½Ğ¾Ğµ Ğ¼ÑÑĞ¾ Ğ²Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ´Ğµ Ñ…ĞµĞ´ĞºÑ€Ğ°Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ² Ğ¸ Ñ…Ğ°ÑƒĞ½Ğ´Ğ°ĞµĞ². Ğ¢Ğ°ĞºĞ¶Ğµ ĞºĞ¾Ğ½Ñ†ĞµĞ½Ñ‚Ñ€Ğ°Ñ†Ğ¸Ñ Ğ²Ñ€Ğ°Ğ³Ğ¾Ğ² Ğ»ÑĞ´ĞµĞ¹ Ğ·Ğ°Ğ¼ĞµÑ‚Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ²Ñ‹ÑˆĞµ Ñ‡ĞµĞ¼ Ğ² Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ³Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ°Ğ»Ğµ. ĞŸĞ¾ ÑÑƒÑ‚Ğ¸ Ğ¸Ğ· Ğ²Ñ€Ğ°Ğ³Ğ¾Ğ² Ğ»ÑĞ´ĞµĞ¹ Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒĞºĞ¾ Ğ§Ñ‘Ñ€Ğ½Ñ‹Ğµ Ğ’Ğ»Ğ°ÑÑ‚ĞµĞ»Ğ¸Ğ½Ñ‹ ĞĞ¿ĞµÑ€Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ½Ğ¸ĞºĞ¸ Ğ¾Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ¸Ñ… Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ², ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‹Ğµ Ğ² ÑĞ¸Ğ»Ñƒ ÑĞ²Ğ¾ĞµĞ¹ Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ»ĞµĞµ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ„ĞµÑÑĞ¸Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ³Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ²ĞºĞ¸, Ğ½ĞµĞ¶ĞµĞ»Ğ¸ Ğ´ĞµÑĞ°Ğ½Ñ‚Ğ½Ğ¸ĞºĞ¸ Ğ¸Ğ· Ğ¾Ñ‚Ñ€ÑĞ´Ğ° Ğ¨ĞµĞ¿Ğ°Ñ€Ğ´Ğ°, Ğ½Ğµ Ñ€Ğ°Ğ· ÑƒÑÑ‚Ñ€Ğ¾ÑÑ‚ Ğ´Ğ¶Ğ¸Ñ…Ğ°Ğ´ Ğ½Ğ°ÑˆĞµĞ¼Ñƒ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ‚ĞµĞ¶Ğµ. Ğ’ Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ‰ĞµĞ¼ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ²ĞµÑĞµĞ»Ğ¾ Ğ¾Ñ‚ Ğ½Ğ°Ñ‡Ğ°Ğ»Ğ° Ğ¸ Ğ´Ğ¾ ĞºĞ¾Ğ½Ñ†Ğ°, Ğ³ĞµĞ¹Ğ¼Ğ¿Ğ»ĞµĞ¹ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ°ĞºÑ‚Ğ¸Ñ‡ĞµÑĞºĞ¸ Ğ½Ğµ ÑĞºĞ°Ñ‚Ñ‹Ğ²Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ÑÑ Ğ² ÑĞºÑƒĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ñƒ, Ğ° Ñ‡Ğ°ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ñ ÑĞ¼ĞµĞ½Ğ° Ğ»Ğ¾ĞºĞ°Ñ†Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ³ÑƒĞ»ĞºĞ¸ Ğ¿Ğ¾ ÑƒĞ¶Ğµ Ğ·Ğ½Ğ°ĞºĞ¾Ğ¼Ñ‹Ğ¼ Ğ¼ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ¼ Ğ´ĞµÑ€Ğ¶Ğ°Ñ‚ Ğ¸Ğ½Ñ‚ĞµÑ€ĞµÑ Ğ½Ğ° ÑƒÑ€Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ½Ğµ. Ğ Ğ°Ğ·Ğ²Ğµ Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ±Ğ»Ğ¸Ğ¶Ğµ Ğº ĞºĞ¾Ğ½Ñ†Ñƒ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ° ÑĞºĞ°Ñ‚Ñ‹Ğ²Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ÑÑ Ğ² ÑĞ¾Ğ²ÑĞµĞ¼ ÑƒĞ¶ Ğ¾Ñ‡ĞµĞ²Ğ¸Ğ´Ğ½Ğ¾Ğµ Ğ¼ÑÑĞ¾, Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ´Ğ»Ñ Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ñ Ğ² Ğ½ĞµĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¹ ÑÑ‚ĞµĞ¿ĞµĞ½Ğ¸ Ğ¼Ğ¸Ğ½ÑƒÑ, Ğ´Ğ»Ñ Ğ¼ÑÑĞ° ĞµÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ´Ñ€ÑƒĞ³Ğ¸Ğµ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ñ‹. Ğ‘Ğ¾ÑÑÑ‹ ÑĞ»Ğ¸ĞµĞ½Ñ‹ Ñ€Ğ°ÑÑÑ‡Ğ¸Ñ‚Ğ°Ğ½Ñ‹ Ğ½Ğ° ÑĞ¼ĞµĞºĞ°Ğ»ĞºÑƒ, Ñ‚Ğ°Ğº Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ¾ Ğ»Ñ‘Ğ³ĞºĞ¾Ğ¹ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ³ÑƒĞ»ĞºĞµ Ğ´Ğ°Ğ¶Ğµ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¼ĞµÑ‡Ñ‚Ğ°Ğ¹Ñ‚Ğµ, Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ğ·Ğ°Ğ±Ñ€Ğ¾ÑĞ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ³Ñ€Ğ°Ğ½Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ°Ğ¼Ğ¸ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ¹Ğ´ĞµÑ‚. Ğ¢Ğ°ĞºĞ¶Ğµ Ğ´Ğ»Ñ Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ñ Ğ»Ğ¸Ñ‡Ğ½Ğ¾ ÑĞ²Ğ»ÑĞµÑ‚ÑÑ Ğ¼Ğ¸Ğ½ÑƒÑĞ¾Ğ¼ Ğ½Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¸Ñ‡Ğ¸Ğµ Ñ‚Ğ°ĞºĞ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ³ĞµĞ¹Ğ¼Ğ¿Ğ»ĞµĞ¹Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ñ€ĞµÑˆĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ ĞºĞ°Ğº: Ğ±ĞµÑĞºĞ¾Ğ½ĞµÑ‡Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ñ€ĞµÑĞ¿Ğ°ÑƒĞ½ Ğ²Ñ€Ğ°Ğ³Ğ¾Ğ² Ğ¿Ğ¾ĞºĞ° Ğ½Ğµ Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½Ğ¸ÑˆÑŒ Ğ¾Ğ¿Ñ€ĞµĞ´ĞµĞ»ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ğ¾Ğµ Ğ´ĞµĞ¹ÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ¸Ğµ. Ğ’ ĞºĞ°ĞºÑƒÑ Ğ±Ñ‹ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ñƒ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ°Ğ», Ğ½Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¸Ñ‡Ğ¸Ğµ Ğ±ĞµÑĞºĞ¾Ğ½ĞµÑ‡Ğ½Ñ‹Ñ… Ñ€ĞµÑĞ¿Ğ¾Ğ² Ğ´Ğ»Ñ Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ñ Ğ°Ğ²Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¸Ñ‡ĞµÑĞºĞ¸ Ğ¼Ğ¸Ğ½ÑƒÑ.
ĞšĞ°ÑĞ°ĞµĞ¼Ğ¾ Ğ´Ğ¸Ğ·Ğ°Ğ¹Ğ½Ğ° ÑƒÑ€Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ½ĞµĞ¹ Ñ‚ÑƒÑ‚ Ğ¾Ğ½ ĞºĞ°Ğº Ğ¿Ğ¾ Ğ¼Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¿Ñ€ĞµĞ²Ğ¾ÑÑ…Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸Ñ‚ Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ³Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ°Ğ», Ñ‚Ğ°ĞºĞ¾Ğ¹ Ğ¿Ñ‘ÑÑ‚Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ¸ Ñ‡Ğ°ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¹ ÑĞ¼ĞµĞ½Ñ‹ Ğ»Ğ¾ĞºĞ°Ñ†Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ±Ñ‹Ğ»Ğ¾ Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒÑˆĞµ Ğ½Ğ¸ Ğ² Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ¸Ğ· Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€ ÑĞµÑ€Ğ¸Ğ¸ Half-life. ĞœĞ¾Ğ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ ÑĞºĞ°Ğ·Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ñ€Ğ°Ğ±Ğ¾Ñ‚Ñ‡Ğ¸ĞºĞ¸ ÑĞ´ĞµĞ»Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¸ Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ¶Ğ¸Ğ¼ĞºÑƒ Ğ¸Ğ· Ñ„Ğ°Ğ½Ñ‚Ğ°Ğ·Ğ¸Ğ¸ Ğ¸ Ğ²Ğ¿Ğ¸Ñ…Ğ½ÑƒĞ»Ğ¸ Ğ² Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ñƒ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ‰Ğµ Ğ²ÑÑ‘, Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶ĞµÑ‚ Ğ² Ñ‚ĞµĞ¾Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ¸ Ğ±Ñ‹Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ² Ğ½Ğ°ÑƒÑ‡Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¼ ĞºĞ¾Ğ¼Ğ¿Ğ»ĞµĞºÑĞµ, Ğ² Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ‰ĞµĞ¼ Ğ·Ğ° Ğ´Ğ¸Ğ·Ğ°Ğ¹Ğ½ ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ²Ğ»Ñ Ğ´ĞµÑÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ±ĞµĞ· Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ğ´ÑƒĞ¼Ğ¸Ğ¹.
Ğ˜Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾, Ğ² Ğ°Ğ´Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ½Ğµ Ğ³Ñ€Ğ°Ğ¼Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ³ĞµĞ¹Ğ¼Ğ¿Ğ»ĞµĞ¹, Ğ½Ğµ Ğ´Ğ°ÑÑ‰Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ğ·Ğ°ÑĞºÑƒÑ‡Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ, Ğ¸ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¼ĞµĞ½ĞµĞµ Ğ³Ñ€Ğ°Ğ¼Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹, Ğ¸Ğ½Ñ‚ĞµÑ€ĞµÑĞ½Ñ‹Ğ¹, Ğ½Ğµ Ğ´Ğ°ÑÑ‰Ğ¸Ğ¹ ÑĞ»Ğ¸ÑˆĞºĞ¾Ğ¼ Ğ±Ñ‹ÑÑ‚Ñ€Ğ¾ ÑƒÑÑ‚Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ¾Ñ‚ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ñ‹ Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ñ€ĞµÑ€Ğ²Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒÑÑ Ğ½Ğ° Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ´Ñ‹Ñ… Ğ´Ğ¸Ğ·Ğ°Ğ¹Ğ½. ĞšĞ°Ğ·Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¾ÑÑŒ Ğ±Ñ‹, Ğ°Ğ´Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ½ Ğ½ÑƒĞ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğµ ĞºĞ¾Ğ»ĞµĞ±Ğ»ÑÑÑŒ Ğ²Ğ¿Ğ¸ÑĞ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ²Ğ¾ Ğ²ÑĞµĞ»ĞµĞ½Ğ½ÑƒÑ Ğ¥Ğ°Ğ»Ñ„-Ğ›Ğ°Ğ¹Ñ„, ĞºĞ°Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ·Ğ¸Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ğ² ĞºĞ°Ğ¶Ğ´Ñ‹Ğ¹ ĞºĞ²Ğ°Ğ´Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ ÑĞ°Ğ½Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ¼ĞµÑ‚Ñ€ ĞºĞ°Ñ€Ñ‚, Ğ¸ ĞºĞ°Ğ¶Ğ´ÑƒÑ ÑÑ‚Ñ€Ğ¾ĞºÑƒ ÑÑ†ĞµĞ½Ğ°Ñ€Ğ¸Ñ. ĞĞ¾ Valve Ğ±Ñ‹Ğ»Ğ¸ Ğ±Ñ‹ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¸Ğ¼Ğ¸, ĞµÑĞ»Ğ¸ Ğ±Ñ‹ ÑƒĞ²Ğ¸Ğ´ĞµĞ², Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ¸Ñ… Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ñƒ Ğ¿Ñ€ĞµĞ²Ğ¾ÑÑ…Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸Ñ‚ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾ĞµĞºÑ‚ Ğ¾Ñ‚ Ğ´Ñ€ÑƒĞ³Ğ¾Ğ¹ ÑÑ‚ÑƒĞ´Ğ¸Ğ¸, Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ½ÑĞ»Ğ¸ Ğ±Ñ‹ Ñ€ĞµÑˆĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğµ, Ğ¾Ğ±ÑŠÑĞ²Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¸ÑÑ…Ğ¾Ğ´ÑÑ‰ĞµĞµ Ğ² Ğ°Ğ´Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ½Ğµ Ğ½ĞµĞºĞ°Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¼ (Ğ·Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¾ ÑƒÑ€Ğ¾Ğ´ÑĞºĞ¸Ğ¹ Ğ¸ Ñ…Ğ°Ğ»Ñ‚ÑƒÑ€Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ Blue Shift ĞºĞ°Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ½ ,Ğ°Ğ³Ğ°). Ğ’Ğ¸Ğ´Ğ¸Ğ¼Ğ¾ Ñƒ Ğ“ĞµĞ¹Ğ±Ğ° Ğ¸ ĞšĞ¾ ÑƒĞ¶Ğµ Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ´Ğ° ÑƒÑ€Ğ¾Ğ²ĞµĞ½ÑŒ Ğ§Ğ¡Ğ’ Ğ¿Ñ€ĞµĞ²Ñ‹ÑˆĞ°Ğ» ÑƒÑ€Ğ¾Ğ²ĞµĞ½ÑŒ Ğ·Ğ´Ñ€Ğ°Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ ÑĞ¼Ñ‹ÑĞ»Ğ°, Ñ‚Ğ°Ğº Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ¸Ğ¼ĞµĞµĞ¼ Ñ‚Ğ¾, Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ ĞºĞ°Ñ‡ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ²ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ°Ğ´Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ½ Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ±Ñ€Ğ¾ÑˆĞµĞ½ Ğ¸Ğ· ÑĞµÑ€Ğ¸Ğ¸ Ğ·Ğ° Ğ½ĞµĞ½Ğ°Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ±Ğ½Ğ¾ÑÑ‚ÑŒÑ, Ğ¸ ÑÑƒÑ‰ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ²ÑƒĞµÑ‚ Ğ¿Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ½Ñ†Ğ¸Ğ¿Ñƒ: Ñ…Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ¸Ñ‚Ğµ - Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ°Ğ¹Ñ‚Ğµ, Ñ…Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ¸Ñ‚Ğµ - Ğ½ĞµÑ‚. Ğ˜Ğ¼Ñ…Ğ¾ Ğ³Ğ»ÑƒĞ¿Ğ¾Ğµ Ñ€ĞµÑˆĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğµ, Ğ±Ğ¸Ğ·Ğ½ĞµÑ Ğ±Ğ¸Ğ·Ğ½ĞµÑĞ¾Ğ¼, Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ³Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ²Ñƒ Ğ²ĞºĞ»ÑÑ‡Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğµ Ğ½Ğ°Ğ´Ğ¾. Ğ”Ğ¸Ğ·Ğ°Ğ¹Ğ½ (ÑƒÑ€Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ½ĞµĞ¹, Ğ²Ñ€Ğ°Ğ³Ğ¾Ğ², Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ÑĞ¾Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¶ĞµĞ¹) - 9 Ğ¸Ğ· 10. Ğ¥Ğ²Ğ°Ğ»Ñ, Ğ´Ğ¸Ğ·Ğ°Ğ¹Ğ½ĞµÑ€Ñ‹ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ·Ñ€Ñ ÑĞ²Ğ¾Ğ¸ Ğ´ĞµĞ½ÑŒĞ³Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»ÑƒÑ‡Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¸. Ğ’ÑĞµĞ¼ ĞºĞ¾Ğ¼Ñƒ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ½Ñ€Ğ°Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ°ÑÑŒ Half-life, Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ·Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ Ñ…Ğ¾Ñ‚ĞµĞ»Ğ¾ÑÑŒ Ñ‡ĞµĞ³Ğ¾-Ñ‚Ğ¾ ĞµÑ‰Ñ‘ Ğ»ÑƒÑ‡ÑˆĞµ - Ğ°Ğ´Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ½ Ğ¾Ğ±ÑĞ·Ğ°Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ĞµĞ½ Ğº Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ…Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ´ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ. Ğ˜ Ğ½Ğµ ÑĞ¼Ğ¾Ñ‚Ñ€Ğ¸Ñ‚Ğµ, Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ¾Ğ½ ĞºĞ°Ğº-Ğ±Ñ‹ Ğ½ĞµĞºĞ°Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ½, Ñ Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ¼ĞµÑ€ Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ¿Ñ€ĞµĞºĞ¸ Ñ€ĞµÑˆĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ Valve ÑÑ‡Ğ¸Ñ‚Ğ°Ñ Opposing Force ĞºĞ°Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ‡Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¹, Ğ¸Ğ±Ğ¾ Ğ² Ğ½ĞµĞ¹ ĞºĞ°Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ‡Ğ½Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ¸ ĞµĞ´Ğ²Ğ° Ğ»Ğ¸ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ² Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ñ‹ Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒÑˆĞµ Ñ‡ĞµĞ¼ Ğ² Blue Shift.

40 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile

RecommandÃ©
8.6 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 9 novembre 2023
Half-Life: Opposing Forces, man, it's like this epic expansion pack that dives deep into the Half-Life universe. Gearbox Software dropped this gem in '99, and it's a whole new angle on the Black Mesa mess.

You step into the boots of Corporal Adrian Shephard, this soldier caught up in the chaos. His story is happening alongside the original game, giving you a fresh look at all that madness. It's like a new puzzle piece in the Half-Life saga, and it's pretty darn compelling.

The gameplay, it's got that same intense vibe as the original Half-Life, but with a twist. You're packing new weapons, dealing with fresh enemies, and exploring different places. The level design? Top-notch, man. You're in for both familiar and unknown threats, so it keeps you on your toes.

Gearbox Software really nailed it. They kept the Half-Life vibe while putting their own spin on things. You can see the love and attention to detail they poured into this expansion.

Released in '99, Opposing Forces was a real treat for gamers, giving more of that awesome Half-Life action and expanding the story. If you're a Half-Life fan, this one's a no-brainer. Dive back into Black Mesa, and get ready for a wild ride!
 
Slade Krowley -GSU-

RecommandÃ©
3.3 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 12 juin 2015
Nostalgia!

This Half Life expansion takes a different spin. Instead of playing a Black Mesa personal you are Corporal Adrian Shepard and you are task to hunt down Gordon Freeman and terminate him. You think it would be easy, instead just like the Black Mesa personal you are thrown into the chaos that is wrecking havoc all across the facility and just like everyone else. You must fight your way through the facility and survive.

This game adds a lit bit of something new to the game. Not only new alien species. But also team effort. Your AI squad mates that are dotted throughout the huge complex. Be warn however there are some instances that they MUST SURVIVE if they die then you will have to start all over again from where you last save. So keep them alive and work with them.

This game adds more puzzle and more exploration to the huge facility which is always nice. The only minor complaint is the senstivity in some cases it can get really annoying or dizzy when doing these physical puzzles (jump, crouch jump) those sort of puzzles. Unlike in the previous games where the looking senstivity and what not seems more slower. So beware of that.

If you are a Half Life fan and want a taste of of military action. Half Life style. This game is recommended
 
Indiana_Minotaur

Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 16 mars 2020
NOTE: If you aren't able to look around go to Options>Mouse and enable raw mouse input

This is one of the rare times where the DLC surpasses the base game. I never bothered finishing Half-Life cause the last part was too tiring.

The DLC contains more guns and enemies than the base game.
It's a solid 7-8 hours experience.

44 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
1 personne a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation amusante
0
RecommandÃ©
6.2 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 22 fÃ©vrier 2015
Opposing Force is the first expansion pack for the five star new standard bearer FPS Half Life 1. The bottom line is this is a great expansion pack.

You are a marine, Corporal Adrian Shepard sent into the Black Mesa facility after Half Life 1's protagonist Gordon Freeman uh accidentally created a rift in space / time and brought aliens in. Everyone talks to you in the game without cut scenes.

When you start the game, Gordon in Half Life 1 is still there and your mission goes from being sent to kill him to fighting for your own survival. You visit portions of the first game yet changed, such as you will visit some of the entry tunnel from the first segment of Half Life 1. You will visit the dam from the original game. Everything changed with new challenges in each. There are plenty of puzzles some are different than the original game and others are more complex. Such as instead of having to use a push box once, you need to use it 3x pushing it from room to room.

I'd say those old environments (destroyed with new challenges) are maybe 1/100th of the map content. The new environments feel fresh and they use a lot of lighting to make it look different. It feels fresh because the other universe is starting to be integrated into our own universe through the aliens making it and because Black Mesa had creature exhibits. There are new textures, you'll go through vine covered sewers where giant fat aliens have their nests.

There are also new gameplay elements that you will be introduced to in an optional training course. The training course is a very nice tutorial that will show you everything new such as ropes to climb and swing on. It's a very nice mechanic. The flashlight has been replaced by night vision goggles which are very nice. You also have new squad mates to find in the game that will aide you like the medic who can heal you on command, the engineer who will blow torch his way through some doors and your standard commandos. Each of these three will fight intelligently and won't just stand around getting shot. They will defend the territory if you command them to stand there.

That's another thing the enemy and friendly AI is great as always from the game. AI will run from grenades, throw their own grenades, flank you, run from your fire and other things. It's very nice.

There are a lot of new weapons. I was surprised. You start with new melee weapons, a new pistol with an optional laser sight, a new sniper rifle that can be quite useful, new alien technology (if you don't want to hear just skip to the next paragraph), such as an electrical gun, a cannon that looks like a BFG from Doom (only more awesome), an acid spitting alien, and a ceiling grabber (yes the enemy) that can be used as a hook shot!

All the old enemies are here too... but there are a lot of new enemies too (if you don't want it spoiled, skip on!), the new enemies seem to be faster and more dangerous. From waist high creatures that run to you, to taller electric shooting aliens controlled by ant like parasites, giant fat electrical discharging enemies... and their offspring, the list goes on, but you'll be surprised at some of the things the expansion comes up with.

With a 5+ hour play through the first time, I do wish it was a bit longer so they could divvy out the enemies a bit slower. But hey it's an expansion pack. The graphics are not improved and they still have bugs like getting stuck in the floor of elevators and lifts, but all of that can be overlooked. A lot has been added to make this expansion worth anyone's time. Great expansion pack!
 
sitebender

RecommandÃ©
1,134.4 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 2 dÃ©cembre 2023
Half-Life: Opposing Forces, man, it's like this epic expansion pack that dives deep into the Half-Life universe. Gearbox Software dropped this gem in '99, and it's a whole new angle on the Black Mesa mess.

You step into the boots of Corporal Adrian Shephard, this soldier caught up in the chaos. His story is happening alongside the original game, giving you a fresh look at all that madness. It's like a new puzzle piece in the Half-Life saga, and it's pretty darn compelling.

The gameplay, it's got that same intense vibe as the original Half-Life, but with a twist. You're packing new weapons, dealing with fresh enemies, and exploring different places. The level design? Top-notch, man. You're in for both familiar and unknown threats, so it keeps you on your toes.

Gearbox Software really nailed it. They kept the Half-Life vibe while putting their own spin on things. You can see the love and attention to detail they poured into this expansion.

Released in '99, Opposing Forces was a real treat for gamers, giving more of that awesome Half-Life action and expanding the story. If you're a Half-Life fan, this one's a no-brainer. Dive back into Black Mesa, and get ready for a wild ride!
 
Ralsei

Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 18 janvier 2014
An mazing expansion of Half-Life and my favourite one from the entire Half-Life 1 Anthology. For some reason i enjoyed it more even than the original Half-Life. A great opportunity to experience the military specialist's side of the story. Brand new weapons and a lot of new freaking aliens, also you get to use nightvision instead of the flashlight which is kinda cool, not even mentioning the new weapon that creates teleports to Zen, a different one for every location in the game where you use it. A great game with a captivant story. Definitely a must buy!

Ten dodatek robi z oryginalnym Half-Life'em to, co robiÄ… kontynuacje filmÃ³w akcji i sci-fi. Czyli jest wiÄ™cej, mocniej, chaotyczniej i w konsekwencji juÅ¼ nie tak dobrze. Tzn. na pewno nie Åºle. Po prostu "Half-Life" jest rewelacyjny, a "Opposing Force" zwyczajnie dobry. ZasÅ‚uguje wiÄ™c w peÅ‚ni na polecenie, jeÅ›li spodobaÅ‚a Ci siÄ™ podstawowa gra. Tym bardziej, Å¼e mamy do czynienia z wiÄ™kszÄ… iloÅ›ciÄ… przeciwnikÃ³w z pomocÄ… jeszcze wiÄ™kszego arsenaÅ‚u. Pozornie moÅ¼e to byÄ‡ zaletÄ…, ale grajÄ…c moÅ¼na dojÅ›Ä‡ do wniosku, Å¼e wiÄ™kszoÅ›Ä‡ tych broni i tak jest nie potrzebna (przez caÅ‚Ä… kampaniÄ™ niektÃ³rych w ogÃ³le nie uÅ¼ywaÅ‚em). Z przeciwnikami podobnie: jest ich wiÄ™cej rodzai i sÄ… caÅ‚kiem oryginalni, ale co z tego jeÅ›li dÅ‚ugoÅ›Ä‡ kampanii nie pozwala wykorzystaÄ‡ w peÅ‚ni ich potencjaÅ‚u. Dodam rÃ³wnieÅ¼, Å¼e zagadki, z jakimi bÄ™dziemy musieli siÄ™ zmierzyÄ‡ aby przejÅ›Ä‡ dalej sÄ… duÅ¼o trudniejsze niÅ¼ w oryginalnym HL. Na plus rÃ³wnieÅ¼ Å‚adnie zrobione niektÃ³re poziomy.

1 personne a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation amusante

RecommandÃ©
4.7 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 11 mars 2020
I always considered this Half-Life expansion to be underrated. I mean, officially authorized third-party expansions are rarely good. But what we have here? It's a pretty neat exception. Sure, Gearbox (yes, the same Gearbox, which co-founder calls Steam â€œdying storeâ€ nowadays) didn't make the Opposing Force from scratch, but they also didn't just give us more of the same. They seriously tried to create a new experience. And succeeded. A lot.

The idea to let us see the original Half-Life events from a different point of view alone was kind of brilliant. In Opposing Force we're playing as Adrian Shephard, a young US Marine Corporal, who was just assigned to the Hazardous Environment Combat Unit from the Santego Military Base. In other words, we'll control one of those guys who tried to hunt down Gordon Freeman for more than a half of the original Half-Life (that's a lot of halves for one sentence, huh?). We'll do the proper military training, we'll learn more about how things work between the marines and the Black Ops, we'll see how some orders from the original Half-Life were given (â€œForget about Freeman!â€), we'll actually see some events from the original game as different character, etc, etc, etc. Even though there won't be any choice at the end of this expansion, it's still a pretty neat stuff for all Half-Life fans.

And gameplay-wise? It's also pretty cool. Sure, level design became a little bit more dumb, but it's not nearly as dumb as in some other games Gearbox will produce after this, and it's also less rough than in the original game. Which is a good thing, since some parts in Valve's game were just... UGH! It's kind of sad that the best parts of level design here are copy / pasted from Valve's work, but still, I can't say that levels in the Opposing Force are bad. Quite the opposite, most of the time I totally enjoyed them.

The best thing about gameplay, though, is that there's heck of a lot of the new features here. Gearbox didn't just change the point of view, they gave us the proper military experience here. We've got quite a lot of new weapons (from regular ones, like sniper rifle and combat knife, to alien), we've got laser sight, we've got the ability to use ropes, we've got night vision, we've got medics and engineers to command (medics can heal both you and nearby NPCs, while engineers will help you to force open closed doors) and, the best of all, we'll be able to use Barnacle (one of those things that live on ceilings) as a tool. Remember hookshot from The Legend of Zelda games? That's pretty much what we've got here. For real. Gearbox literally added the hookshot to Half-Life. BOOM! Mind blown.

So, yes, I do recommend this expansion and I do hope it'll get more attention nowadays. I mean, come on! The original Half-Life still has a life (now it's a sentence with too much â€œlifeâ€...). It got Source remaster, it got awesome remake called Black Mesa (go check it out), etc, etc, etc. But Gerbox's expansions? Those just stayed in the past. Even though there's a lot of great and unique stuff in them. The Opposing Force is more than just the expansion. It's a whole new experience. And it doesn't deserve becoming obsolete. 21 year later, I totally enjoyed re-playing it. Hope you'll do to. Dixi.
 
Letande

Tactical Emo
0
28 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
29.6 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 20 juin 2017
Definitely the best of Half-Life expansion packs, but this game is HARD. This game on the easiest difficulty is harder than Half-Life on the hardest difficulty. Be prepared for that. But it's certinaly manageable on the easiest difficulty and worth the play because like most expansion packs from the 90's, this game is SUPER creative with the concept at hand. It introduces creative new weapons (You can use the ceiling-tenticles as kind of a grappling hook!), creative new enemies, and it even introduces a new gameplay mechanic; climbing ropes, and it was handled fairly well too. The level design is also a little different from Half-Life's. You're still in Black Mesa, but the game throws totally new areas your way that you wouldn't expect to see in Half-Life. The new monster designs aren't quite as well done as Half-Life's (a lot more cartoony in Opposing Force), but they're still neat and creative. Definitely worth a try.
 
Dr. Fronkensteen
4

CHIBI_Z_

28 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
13.4 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 13 janvier 2020
A large amount of players would probably agree that Opposing Force is, at times, better than Half-Life. The weapons are expanded, there are brand new enemies to fight, and at certain sections you can directly lead the HECU forces yourself. It's not as long as Half-Life, but is much more content-packed than Blue Shift. Each chapter feels distinct, and starting the action hours after the Black Mesa Incident begins allows for a chaotic introduction to the game in contrast to Half-Life's atmospheric march towards the resonance cascade.

It's a great game that really adds to Half-Life's strengths while incorporating its very own elements that'll keep you engrossed until the end.
 
lotsoflol

ĞŸÑ€Ğ¾Ğ»ĞµĞ¶Ğ°Ğ² Ğ½ĞµĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğµ Ğ²Ñ€ĞµĞ¼Ñ Ğ±ĞµĞ· ÑĞ¾Ğ·Ğ½Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ Ğ½Ğ°Ñ Ğ¾Ñ‚ĞºĞ°Ñ‡Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ Ğ¼ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ´Ğ¾ĞºÑ‚Ğ¾Ñ€ Ğ¸ Ğ¼Ñ‹ Ñ…Ğ²Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ°Ñ Ğ³Ğ°ĞµÑ‡Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ ĞºĞ»ÑÑ‡ Ğ±ĞµĞ¶Ğ¸Ğ¼ ÑƒĞ½Ğ¸Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ²ÑĞµÑ… ĞºÑ‚Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ°Ğ´ĞµÑ‚ÑÑ Ğ½Ğ° Ğ½Ğ°ÑˆĞµĞ¼ Ğ¿ÑƒÑ‚Ğ¸.

ĞŸĞ»ÑÑÑ‹:
Â¥ ĞŸĞ¾Ğ»Ğ½Ğ¾ÑÑ‚ÑŒÑ Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ğµ Ğ¾Ğ±ÑƒÑ‡ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğµ ÑĞ¾ Ğ²ÑĞµĞ¼Ğ¸ ÑĞ²ĞµĞ¶Ğ¸Ğ¼Ğ¸ Ñ„Ğ¸ÑˆĞºĞ°Ğ¼Ğ¸ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ñ‹.
Â¥ ĞÑ‚Ğ»Ğ¸Ñ‡Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ ÑÑĞ¶ĞµÑ‚ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½ÑÑÑ‰Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ğ½Ğ°ÑˆĞ¸ Ğ·Ğ½Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ Ğ¾ Ğ²ÑĞµĞ»ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¹ "Half-Life".
Â¥ ĞĞ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ñ Ğ²Ñ€Ğ°Ğ¶ĞµÑĞºĞ°Ñ Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ»Ğ°Ğ½ĞµÑ‚Ğ½Ğ°Ñ Ñ€Ğ°ÑĞ°, Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ğµ Ğ¾Ñ€ÑƒĞ¶Ğ¸Ğµ, Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ñ‹Ğµ Ğ±Ğ¾ÑÑÑ‹, Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ñ‹Ğµ Ğ»Ğ¾ĞºĞ°Ñ†Ğ¸Ğ¸.
Â¥ Ğ•ÑÑ‚ÑŒ ÑĞ»ĞµĞ¼ĞµĞ½Ñ‚Ñ‹ ĞºĞ¾Ğ¼Ğ°Ğ½Ğ´Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ñ‹, ĞºĞ¾Ğ³Ğ´Ğ° Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¼ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ°ÑÑ‚ Ğ½Ğ°ÑˆĞ¸ Ğ±Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒÑ Ğ¿Ğ¾ Ğ¾Ñ€ÑƒĞ¶Ğ¸Ñ.
Â¥ Ğ”Ğ¾ ÑĞ¸Ñ… Ğ¿Ğ¾Ñ€ Ğ¶Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ¼ÑƒĞ»ÑŒÑ‚Ğ¸Ğ¿Ğ»ĞµĞµÑ€. ĞšĞ°Ğ¶Ğ´Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ´ĞµĞ½ÑŒ 5-10 Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ¾ĞºĞ¾Ğ² Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸ÑÑƒÑ‚ÑÑ‚Ğ²ÑƒĞµÑ‚. Ğ•ÑÑ‚ÑŒ ĞºÑƒÑ‡Ğ° ÑĞµÑ€Ğ²ĞµÑ€Ğ¾Ğ² Ğ½Ğ° Ğ»ÑĞ±Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ²ĞºÑƒÑ. Ğ‘Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒÑˆĞµ Ğ²ÑĞµĞ³Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ½Ñ€Ğ°Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ»ÑÑ Gun Game Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ´.

ĞœĞ¸Ğ½ÑƒÑÑ‹:
Â¥ Ğ“Ğ»Ğ°Ğ²Ğ½Ğ°Ñ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ° Ğ²ÑĞµĞ³Ğ¾ ÑÑ‚Ğ¸Ğ¼Ğ°, ÑĞ¿ÑƒÑÑ‚Ñ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¸ Ğ´Ğ²Ğ°Ğ´Ñ†Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ»ĞµÑ‚ Ğ¿Ğ¾ÑĞ»Ğµ Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ¿ÑƒÑĞºĞ° Ñ‚Ğ°Ğº Ğ¸ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¾Ğ±Ğ·Ğ°Ğ²ĞµĞ»Ğ°ÑÑŒ Ğ°Ñ‡Ğ¸Ğ²ĞºĞ°Ğ¼Ğ¸, Ñ€ÑƒÑÑĞ¸Ñ„Ğ¸ĞºĞ°Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ¸ Ğ¼Ğ°ÑÑ‚ĞµÑ€ÑĞºĞ¾Ğ¹ Ğ² ÑÑ‚Ğ¸Ğ¼Ğµ.
Â¥ Ğ”Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾ Ğ¼Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¾ Ğ³Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ½Ñ‹Ñ… Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ² Ğ½Ğ° Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ¾Ñ‡Ğ½ÑƒÑ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ñƒ. ĞŸÑ€Ğ¾ÑˆÑƒÑÑ‚Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ² Ğ²ĞµÑÑŒ Ğ¸Ğ½Ñ‚ĞµÑ€Ğ½ĞµÑ‚ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾ÑˆĞµĞ» Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒĞºĞ¾ Ñ‚Ñ€Ğ¸ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ°, Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ñ‹Ğµ Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ·Ñ‹Ğ²Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¸ Ñ€Ğ²Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ½Ñ‹Ğµ Ñ‡ÑƒĞ²ÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ°. Ğ’Ğ¾Ğ·Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ ÑĞ²Ğ¾ĞµĞ²Ñ€ĞµĞ¼ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ğ¾ ÑĞ´ĞµĞ»Ğ°Ğ½Ğ½Ğ°Ñ Ğ¼Ğ°ÑÑ‚ĞµÑ€ÑĞºĞ°Ñ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ·Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ° Ğ±Ñ‹ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ğ¸ÑĞ¿Ñ€Ğ°Ğ²Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ. ĞĞ¾ Ğ³Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ½Ñ‹Ñ… Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ² Ğ´ĞµĞ¹ÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ¸Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾ Ğ¼Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¾.
Â¥ Ğ”Ğ¾ ÑĞ¸Ñ… Ğ¿Ğ¾Ñ€ ĞµÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ±Ğ°Ğ³Ğ¸. ĞœĞ¾Ğ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ·Ğ°ÑÑ‚Ñ€ÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ² Ğ½ĞµĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‹Ñ… Ñ‚ĞµĞºÑÑ‚ÑƒÑ€Ğ°Ñ…. Ğ˜Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ´Ğ° Ğ·Ğ°Ğ¿Ğ°Ñ€Ñ‹Ğ²Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ÑÑ Ñ„Ğ°Ğ¹Ğ» ÑĞ¾Ñ…Ñ€Ğ°Ğ½ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ Ñ Ğ¿Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ÑĞ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¼ Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ»ĞµÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ¸Ğ· Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ñ‹ (Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸Ñ…Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑÑ Ğ·Ğ°Ğ³Ñ€ÑƒĞ¶Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ»ĞµĞµ Ñ€Ğ°Ğ½Ğ½ĞµĞµ), Ğ¿Ğ°Ñ€Ñƒ Ñ€Ğ°Ğ· Ñ‚ĞµĞºÑÑ‚ÑƒÑ€Ñ‹ Ğ² Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ·Ğ´ÑƒÑ…Ğµ Ğ»ĞµÑ‚Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¸. Ğ˜Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ³:

Creative
8,418 produits enregistrÃ©s
3
19 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
1
RecommandÃ©
8.9 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 6 aout 2021
Half-Life: Opposing Force is the very first expansion pack for the original Half-Life. This expansion puts you into the boots of Corporal Adrian Shepherd who arrives at the Black Mesa facility after the horrid accident a bit late with his unit without knowing that their mission is to silence every personnel, while Gordon is already halfway through the facility on his way to Lambda Core.

"So, Corporal Shepherd we meet at last" - Gman

Pros:
- The training is really unique and fun to complete, so I advise you not to skip it.
- Very well integrated with the original storyline
- Some segments of the campaign are quite memorable
- Seeing the Black Mesa accident from another perspective
- The soundtrack is a banger
- Some new great characters
- The voice acting is still as great as in the original
- Same gameplay as the original Half-Life with some new features
- Unique enemies (Mutated zombies, Race X aliens etc.)
- Weapons will be the same as in the original, but with new additions (Deagle, Wrench, M249 etc.)
- All the maps are well designed

Neutral:
- Not really that long, 4-5 hours only, but for an expansion, it's pretty much okay
- There is multiplayer, which is dead, but it's most likely the same as the original with different maps and the weaponry, it's a pity really.
- For some reason when I had allies with me, they tended to shoot me for no reason at all

â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥:
- HD models changes weapon models just like in the original, from an MP5 to an M16 for example. Just turn it off, it ruins the art style a bit.
- Few bugs, like being stuck at some places
- When you hit a loading zone trigger and a music is playing, it will just cut off.

Canon or not:
I personally think that Opposing Force can very much be canon. If you think about it for a second, the appearance of Race X aliens, Gordon could've not seen them as he was already inside Xen at the time when Shepherd and his unit has just arrived at Black Mesa and only after then Race X aliens started invading Earth alongside Xen aliens and a bit later Shepherd has stopped Race X from invading Earth any longer. Shepherd has been in stasis ever since and Valve missed a huge potential for sure.

10/10 Overall this DLC, or well expansion for its time, is a must have if you are a Half-Life fan or if you just started playing the series.

My Reviews About Other Half-Life Games:
Half-Life Review
Half-Life: Blue Shift
Half-Life 2 Review
Half-Life 2: Episode One
Half-Life 2: Episode Two

One of Valve's best games in the Half-Life series from 1999, as Corporal Adrian Shephard, a US Marine, who was sent to the Black Mesa Research Facility to save survivors and to capture or kill Gordon Freeman, but the mission came by mistake and turned into a survival mission from Xen aliens,Race X and Black ops,but in some locations he receives help from soldiers,sciences and security.

Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 29 novembre 2020

Câ€™est quoi Half Life Opposing Force ?

Ce standalone de la sÃ©rie Half-Life va vous plonger une fois de plus dans le complex Black Mesa lors de lâ€™attaque extraterrestre mais du point de vue du caporal Adrian Shephard.

Borghignol
472 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
22 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
3.1 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 12 avril 2020
Quick Summary
Half-Life: Opposing Force is overall a good expansion to the original Half-Life game. Obviously it's recommended that you play Half-Life before playing this expansion. New weapons and monsters are introduced as you fight your way through Black Mesa during the incident infamously started by Gordon Freeman. Of course, the game is old and doesn't hold up graphically, but the gameplay is still pretty tight. It feels more like a corridor shoot-em-up than a continuation of any story, as it's told from a different perspective of an event we already know about.

My Full Review
I recommend this game overall to any active or soon to be Half-Life fans. If you're looking to learn something new about the story, this isn't it. This expansion is more dedicated to the gun play than anything else. The puzzles aren't too hard to figure out, and the environments aren't anything you haven't really seen in Half-Life. The encounters are quite brutal and a lot of trial and error is involved.

Gameplay
There are plenty of new weapons to use as you make your way through the game. With more weapons comes a LOT of enemies per level. You'll spend a lot of time using cover and peeking to get shots off on some of the tough enemies, as they tend to sponge a lot of damage and hit hard.

Puzzles are present, however they aren't too difficult. I suggest learning how to crouch jump if you're not familiar, because there are a lot of areas that assume you'd know how to do this. There are some sections that aren't immediately obvious as to what you should do either, so keep an eye on all of your options on how to traverse a situation.

The game is obviously old and you'll notice parts that are rough around the edges, most notably when interacting with ropes, the grapple hook, physics interactions, and the AI. My biggest issue was the boss fight. After fighting your way to the end, the boss fight is laughably easy and kind of boring.

Story / Plot
You're playing in the perspective of Adrian Shepard, a US Marine Corporal who's assigned to the Hazardous Environment Combat Unit. You don't receive the full briefing of your upcoming mission and end up running through Black Mesa during the infamous incident started by Gordon Freeman from Half-Life.

The gameplay doesn't translate to the story very well, as it's as simple as, "Adrian fights his way out of Black Mesa." You'll see plenty of easter eggs and nods to the first Half-Life to help indicate the timeline of events. Otherwise, there's not much to say about this game for the story. You'll be playing Half-Life: Opposing Force for the gameplay more than anything. If you're not interested in more Half-Life gameplay as much as more story, I suggest just looking up a synopsis on YouTube.

Graphics / Audio
For a game initially released in 1999, it's understandable that the graphics and audio aren't going to hold up to standards found in 2020. With that aside, the graphics are still quite interesting as they were in Half-Life. I did find it pretty obvious as to which assets were added in Half-Life: Opposing Force, because they had a different feel about them that didn't quite match Half-Life in some ways. The graphics overall hold a fantastic grungy sci-fi aesthetic and work perfectly for the game.

The audio is... not good. It absolutely doesn't hold up in any way. The sounds are definitely nostalgic and worked well for the time, but the voices sound strangely robotic and the guns are obnoxious. There's also a moment towards the end in a storage facility where boxes are moving on a rail, and the sound gets so loud that all other sounds distorted unpleasantly. Audio isn't the strong suit in this game, or any of the original Half-Life games.

Conclusion
Pick this game up if you really enjoyed the gameplay found in Half-Life. If you're looking for additional story material, there's not much here that warrants the playtime. Expect the old age of this game to provide some rough moments, but take time to appreciate the craft of the past. Half-Life was no easy feat, and even today, it still shows.

Please Rate This Review
I spend a lot of time breaking down game design and development from a critical consumer's perspective. If you've read all the way through, please give it a rating. The feedback helps!

RecommandÃ©
6.0 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 9 dÃ©cembre 2014
Questo titolo dovrebbero essere preso come un modello di riferimente dalle case produttrici odierne quando si apprestano a creare delle espansioni (che ora va tanto di moda chiamare DLC) per i loro giochi. Opposing Force non aggiunge solamente qualche arma o qualche nemico al primo capitolo di Half-Life, anzi, Ã¨ un titolo totalmente a se stante, anche se consiglio caldamente di completare il primo Half-Life prima di giocare a questo titolo, altrimenti vi perderete un bel po di riferimenti al capostipite della pluripremiata saga, anche se preso da solo resta comunque un gioco godibile.

PRO:
+ Trama accattivamente (del resto Ã¨ un Half-Life) che ti spinge a continuare a giocare per vederne lo sviluppo
(trama tl;dr: giochi nei panni di Sheppard un soldato dei marine che, in seguito all'incidente avvenuto a Black Mesa, ha il compito di arare tutti i superstiti e un paio di alieni di passaggio)
+ Gameplay sempre vario e mai monotono: questo titolo vi regalerÃ  azione, stealth, puzzle tenendovi immersi un'atmosfera indimenticabile tra il fantascientifico e l'horror, (vedi il capitolo 10, il nido dei voltigore nelle fogne)
+ NovitÃ  davvero grosse rispetto a HL tra cui le nuove armi aliene e nuovi nemici (i cosiddetti alieni di Razza X che imparerete ad odiare) ancora piÃ¹ cazzuti
+ Prezzo davvero accessibile (soprattutto perchÃ¨ lo trovate su TF2 Outpost a 1 o 2 key, anche se consiglio di acquistare direttamente il complete pack di HL cosi vi fate la maratona di un mese come il sottoscritto)
+ LongevitÃ  buona per essere solamente un'espansione, completato a difficoltÃ  media in 5 ore e mezza (considerate che negli FPS sono un senza-mani) tutorial escluso (che consiglio comunque di completare perchÃ¨ ricco di citazioni a full metal jacket)
+ Grafica carina per essere un gioco del 99, e per chi Ã¨ un videogiocatore un po vissuto come il sottoscritto farÃ  venire un po di nostalgia...
+ Audio sublime, poche musiche ma sempre al posto giusto, effetti sonori piacevoli, forse solo quelli ambientali possono dare fastidio se si gioca â™¥â™¥â™¥ le cuffie; doppiaggio meh
+ E' un altro Half-Life (?)

CONTRO:
- Lo scopo principale di Sheppard sarebbe quello di catturare/eliminare Freeman, peccato che lo si veda solamente per 4 secondi e manco si degna di guardarti in faccia
- Assenza di doppiaggio/sottotitoli in italiano (non che sia una grave mancanza, ma alcuni dialoghi sono difficilmente comprensibili dato che Ã¨ un gioco vecchio e le voci dei doppiatori inglesi non sono sempre chiarissime)
- Intelligenza artificiale degli alleati scadente (fa salire il rosik venire uccisi da un proprio compagno che non riesce a mirare ad un alieno oppure entrare in una nuova area accorgendosi poi di aver lasciato il tuo amichetto bot di (s)fiducia 500 metri indietro perchÃ¨ si Ã¨ impiantato in uno scalino)
- Carina l'aggiunta delle corde, peccato che siano buggate come la morte

8,5/10
 
GreySlime
2
30 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
5.6 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 2 avril 2014

-Ğ—Ğ´ĞµÑÑŒ Ğ³Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ğ´Ğ¾ Ğ²ĞµÑĞµĞ»ĞµĞµ Ñ‡ĞµĞ¼ Ğ² Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ³Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾Ğ¼ Half-Life. ĞĞ¾Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ñ€ĞµĞ¶Ğ¸Ğ¼ Multiplayer, Ğ³Ğ´Ğµ ĞµÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ñ€ĞµĞ¶Ğ¸Ğ¼ "Ğ—Ğ°Ñ…Ğ²Ğ°Ñ‚ Ğ¤Ğ»Ğ°Ğ³Ğ°".
Ğ£Ğ²ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ½ Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ·Ğ°Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ¼Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ»ÑÑ Opposing Force Ğ»ÑĞ´ÑĞ¼, Ğ¿Ğ¸ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ»ĞµÑ‚ - Ğ—Ğ°Ñ€ÑĞ¶Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ÑÑ Ğ±ĞµÑĞºĞ¾Ğ½ĞµÑ‡Ğ½Ğ¾.
Ğ‘Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒÑˆĞ¾Ğµ ĞºĞ¾Ğ»Ğ¸Ñ‡ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ¾ Ğ¾Ñ€ÑƒĞ¶Ğ¸Ñ, Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ĞµÑ€Ğ°Ğ±Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ°Ğ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ¸Ğ½Ñ‚ĞµÑ€Ñ„ĞµĞ¹Ñ. Ğ ĞµĞ¶ÑƒÑ‰Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ğ³Ğ»Ğ°Ğ·Ğ° *ĞŸÑ€Ğ¸Ğ±Ğ¾Ñ€ ĞĞ¾Ñ‡Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ’Ğ¸Ğ´ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ*

ĞšĞĞ“Ğ”Ğ Ğ’Ğ¡Ğ Ğ£Ğ–Ğ• ĞĞĞ§Ğ˜ĞĞĞ›ĞĞ¡Ğ¬ ĞĞ§Ğ•ĞĞ¬ ĞŸĞ›ĞĞ¥Ğ...


ĞĞ°Ñ‡Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ÑÑ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğµ Ğ½Ğ° Ğ±Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‚Ñƒ Ğ²ĞµÑ€Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ»Ñ‘Ñ‚Ğ°. Ğ—Ğ°Ñ€Ğ°Ğ½ĞµĞµ Ğ´Ğ°Ğ²Ğ°Ğ¹Ñ‚Ğµ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ·Ğ½Ğ°ĞºĞ¾Ğ¼Ğ¸Ğ¼ÑÑ Ñ Ğ³Ğ»Ğ°Ğ²Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¼ Ğ³ĞµÑ€Ğ¾ĞµĞ¼ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ. Ğ—Ğ¾Ğ²ÑƒÑ‚ ĞµĞ³Ğ¾ ĞĞ´Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ°Ğ½ Ğ¨ĞµĞ¿Ğ°Ñ€Ğ´, 22 Ğ³Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ°, Ñ‚Ğ°Ğº Ğ¶Ğµ ĞºĞ°Ğº Ğ¸ Ğ“Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ½ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ»Ñ‡Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¸Ğ² ĞºĞ°Ğº Ñ€Ñ‹Ğ±Ğ°, Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ğ¾ Ğ·Ğ²Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ ĞºĞ°Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ°Ğ». Ğ”Ğ° Ğ²ÑĞµ Ğ²ĞµÑ€Ğ½Ğ¾! Ğ’ Opposing Force Ğ¼Ñ‹ Ğ±ÑƒĞ´ĞµĞ¼ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ·Ğ° Ğ±Ñ‹Ğ²Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ²Ğ¾ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾, ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¼Ñƒ Ğ´Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¾ Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒĞºĞ¾ Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ½Ğ° Ñ†ĞµĞ»ÑŒ - Ğ·Ğ°Ñ‡Ğ¸ÑÑ‚Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ ĞºĞ¾Ğ¼Ğ¿Ğ»ĞµĞºÑ "Black Mes" Ğ¾Ñ‚ ÑĞ²Ğ¸Ğ´ĞµÑ‚ĞµĞ»ĞµĞ¹ Ğ¸ Ğ¾Ñ‚ Ğ½Ğ°Ğ´Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ³Ğ°ÑÑ‰ĞµĞ¹ÑÑ Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ´Ñ‹ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸ÑˆĞµĞ»ÑŒÑ†ĞµĞ². ĞŸĞ»Ğ°Ğ½ Ğ¿Ğ¾ Ğ·Ğ°Ñ‡Ğ¸ÑÑ‚ĞºĞµ ÑƒĞ¶Ğµ Ñ ÑĞ°Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğ°Ñ‡Ğ°Ğ»Ğ° Ğ¿Ğ¾ÑˆĞ»Ğ° Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¿Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ğ»Ğ°Ğ½Ñƒ. ĞĞµ ÑƒÑĞ¿ĞµĞ»Ğ¸ Ğ²Ğ¾ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ğµ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ»ĞµÑ‚ĞµÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ´Ğ¾ ĞºĞ¾Ğ¼Ğ¿Ğ»ĞµĞºÑĞ°, ĞºĞ°Ğº Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸ÑˆĞµĞ»ÑŒÑ†Ñ‹ Ğ±Ñ‹ÑÑ‚Ñ€Ğ¾ ÑĞ±Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ°ÑÑ‚ Ğ½Ğ°Ğ´Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ³Ğ°ÑÑ‰ĞµĞ¹ÑÑ Ğ²ĞµÑ€Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ»Ñ‘Ñ‚Ñ‹, Ğ¸ Ğ²ĞµÑ€Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ»Ñ‘Ñ‚ Ğ² ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¼ ÑĞ¸Ğ´ĞµĞ» Ğ¨ĞµĞ¿Ğ°Ñ€Ğ´ Ğ¸ÑĞºĞ»ÑÑ‡ĞµĞ½Ğ¸ĞµĞ¼ Ğ½Ğµ ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ».

Ğ§ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ· Ğ½ĞµĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğµ Ğ²Ñ€ĞµĞ¼Ñ Ğ¨ĞµĞ¿Ğ°Ñ€Ğ´ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸Ñ…Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸Ñ‚ Ğ² ÑĞµĞ±Ñ, Ğ¸ Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ´Ğ¸Ñ‚, ĞºĞ°Ğº ÑĞ¾ÑĞ»ÑƒĞ¶Ğ¸Ğ²Ñ†ĞµĞ² Ğ±ĞµĞ· Ğ¿Ğ¾Ñ‰Ğ°Ğ´Ñ‹ ĞºÑ€Ğ¾Ğ¼ÑĞ°ÑÑ‚ Ğ¿Ğ°Ñ‡ĞºĞ°Ğ¼Ğ¸, Ğ° ĞµĞ¼Ñƒ Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ‡ĞµĞ³Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ñ‘Ñ‚ÑÑ ĞºÑ€Ğ¾Ğ¼Ğµ ĞºĞ°Ğº ÑĞ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ° Ğ¿Ğ¾Ñ‚ĞµÑ€ÑÑ‚ÑŒ ÑĞ¾Ğ·Ğ½Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸Ğµ. ĞŸÑ€Ğ¾Ñ…Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ ĞµÑ‰Ñ‘ ĞºĞ°ĞºĞ¾Ğµ-Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ²Ñ€ĞµĞ¼Ñ, Ğ¸ Ğ¨ĞµĞ¿Ğ°Ñ€Ğ´ Ğ²Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²ÑŒ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸Ñ…Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸Ñ‚ ÑĞµĞ±Ñ, Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ½Ğ°ĞºĞ¾ ÑƒĞ¶Ğµ Ğ² ÑĞ°Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¼ ĞºĞ¾Ğ¼Ğ¿Ğ»ĞµĞºÑĞµ, Ğ¸ Ğ² Ğ¾ĞºÑ€ÑƒĞ¶ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğ¸ ÑƒÑ‡Ñ‘Ğ½Ñ‹Ñ…. ĞĞµÑ‚Ñ€ÑƒĞ´Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ·Ğ°Ğ¼ĞµÑ‚Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ, Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ ÑƒÑ‡Ñ‘Ğ½Ñ‹Ğµ, Ğ½ĞµÑĞ¼Ğ¾Ñ‚Ñ€Ñ Ğ½Ğ° Ñ‚Ğ¾, Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ¸ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¶Ğ½Ñ‹ Ğ±Ğ¾ÑÑ‚ÑŒÑÑ Ğ²Ğ¾ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ñ… Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¾Ğ±Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ‚ ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ñ€Ğ°ÑÑ‚ÑÑ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ¼Ğ¾Ñ‡ÑŒ Ğ¸Ğ¼ Ñ‚ĞµĞ¼, Ñ‡ĞµĞ¼ ÑĞ¼Ğ¾Ğ³ÑƒÑ‚. ĞĞµĞ¼Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸Ğ² Ğ¿Ğ¾ ĞºĞ¾Ğ¼Ğ½Ğ°Ñ‚Ğµ, Ğ¨ĞµĞ¿Ğ°Ñ€Ğ´ Ğ½Ğ°Ñ…Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸Ñ‚ ÑĞ²Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ±Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ½ĞµĞ¶Ğ¸Ğ»ĞµÑ‚ Ğ¸ ÑˆĞ»ĞµĞ¼ Ñ Ğ½Ğ¾Ñ‡Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¼ Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ´ĞµĞ½Ğ¸ĞµĞ¼, Ğ½Ğ°Ğ´ĞµĞ² Ğ¸Ñ…, Ğ¿Ğ¾ÑĞ²Ğ»ÑĞµÑ‚ÑÑ ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ½Ğ´Ğ°Ñ€Ñ‚Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ¸Ğ½Ñ‚ĞµÑ€Ñ„ĞµĞ¹Ñ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ñ‹.

Ğ”ĞµĞ¹ÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ¸Ñ Ğ² Opposing Force Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¸ÑÑ…Ğ¾Ğ´ÑÑ‚ Ğ³Ğ´Ğµ-Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ² ÑĞµÑ€ĞµĞ´Ğ¸Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸ĞºĞ»ÑÑ‡ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ğ“Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ° Ğ¤Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ğ°. ĞĞµĞ¼Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸Ğ² Ğ¿Ğ¾ ĞºĞ¾Ğ¼Ğ¿Ğ»ĞµĞºÑÑƒ, Ğ¨ĞµĞ¿Ğ°Ñ€Ğ´ ÑÑƒĞ¼ĞµĞ» Ğ²Ğ¾ÑÑĞ¾ĞµĞ´Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒÑÑ Ñ Ğ³Ğ»Ğ°Ğ²Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¼Ğ¸ ÑĞ¸Ğ»Ğ°Ğ¼Ğ¸ Ğ²Ğ¾ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ñ…, Ğ¸ Ñ‚Ğµ Ğ´Ğ°ÑÑ‚ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸ĞºĞ°Ğ· Ğ½ĞµĞ¼ĞµĞ´Ğ»ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ¾Ñ‚ÑÑ‚ÑƒĞ¿Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ, Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ñ€ĞµĞºÑ€Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ²ÑÑÑ‡ĞµÑĞºĞ¸Ğµ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ¿Ñ‹Ñ‚ĞºĞ¸ Ğ»Ğ¸ĞºĞ²Ğ¸Ğ´Ğ¸Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ¤Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ğ°. ĞĞ°Ğ¿Ğ¾ÑĞ»ĞµĞ´Ğ¾Ğº Ñ€Ğ°Ğ´Ğ¸ÑÑ‚ ÑĞ¾Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ‰Ğ°ĞµÑ‚, Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ ÑƒÑ†ĞµĞ»ĞµĞ²ÑˆĞ¸Ğµ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¶Ğ½Ñ‹ Ğ´Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ ĞºĞ¾Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ´Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ°Ñ‚Ñ‹ Ğ¿Ğ¾ÑĞ»ĞµĞ´Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ… Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ·Ğ´ÑƒÑˆĞ½Ñ‹Ñ… Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ°Ğº, Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ğ¾ÑĞ»Ğµ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ ÑƒÑ…Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ²Ğ¾ÑĞ²Ğ¾ÑÑĞ¸. ĞšĞ°Ğ·Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¾ÑÑŒ Ğ±Ñ‹ ÑƒÑ€Ğ°, Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ° Ğ¾ĞºĞ¾Ğ½Ñ‡ĞµĞ½Ğ°! ĞĞ³Ğ°, â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ Ñ‚Ğ°Ğ¼! ĞŸÑ€ÑĞ¼ Ğ² Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ñ‚ ÑĞ²Ğ°ĞºÑƒĞ°Ñ†Ğ¸Ğ¸, Ğ²Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ° Ğ²Ğ½ĞµĞ·Ğ°Ğ¿Ğ½Ğ¾ ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¸ Ğ·Ğ°ĞºÑ€Ñ‹Ğ²Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒÑÑ, Ğ½Ğµ Ğ´Ğ°Ğ²Ğ°Ñ Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ·Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ¸ ÑĞ²Ğ°ĞºÑƒĞ¸Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒÑÑ. Ğ’Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ½Ğ¸ĞºĞ¾Ğ¼ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ» G-man, ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ¿Ğ¾ĞºĞ°Ğ·Ğ°Ğ² ÑĞ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ° ÑĞ²Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ñ…ÑƒĞ¸ÑÑ‚Ğ¸Ñ‡Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ²Ğ·Ğ³Ğ»ÑĞ´ ÑƒÑ…Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸Ñ‚ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ‡ÑŒ. ĞŸĞ¾ÑĞ»Ğµ Ñ‚Ğ°ĞºĞ¸Ñ… Ğ¿Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¾Ğº Ğ² ĞºĞ¾Ğ»Ñ‘ÑĞ° Ğ¨ĞµĞ¿Ğ°Ñ€Ğ´Ñƒ Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ‡ĞµĞ³Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ñ‘Ñ‚ÑÑ, ĞºÑ€Ğ¾Ğ¼Ğµ ĞºĞ°Ğº ÑĞ°Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¼Ñƒ Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ±Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒÑÑ Ğ¸Ğ· ĞºĞ¾Ğ¼Ğ¿Ğ»ĞµĞºÑĞ°.

Ğ’ Ğ¿Ğ»Ğ°Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ°Ñ‡Ğ¸ ÑÑĞ¶ĞµÑ‚Ğ° Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ‡ĞµĞ³Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ¼ĞµĞ½ÑĞ»Ğ¾ÑÑŒ. Opposing Force ĞºĞ°Ğº Ğ¸ Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ³Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ°Ñ Half-Life Ñ€Ğ°ÑÑĞºĞ°Ğ·Ñ‹Ğ²Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ ÑÑĞ¶ĞµÑ‚ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ°Ñ‘Ñ‚ÑÑ Ğ² Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ´Ğµ Ğ¾ĞºÑ€ÑƒĞ¶ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ, Ñ„Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ğ°Ğ¼Ğ¸ Ğ½ĞµĞ¿Ğ¸ÑĞµĞ¹, Ğ¸ Ğ´ĞµĞ¹ÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ¸ÑĞ¼Ğ¸ Ğ¨ĞµĞ¿Ğ°Ñ€Ğ´Ğ°. Ğ•Ğ´Ğ¸Ğ½ÑÑ‚Ğ²ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ğ¾Ğµ Ñ‡ĞµĞ¼ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğµ Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ»Ğ¸Ñ‡Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ÑÑ Ğ¾Ñ‚ Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ³Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ°Ğ»Ğ° - ÑĞ¾Ğ´ĞµÑ€Ğ¶Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸Ğµ. Ğ¡ÑĞ¶ĞµÑ‚ Ğ² Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğ¸ Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ñ€ĞµĞ¼ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ğ¾ ÑĞ¾Ñ‡ĞµÑ‚Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ ÑĞ¼Ğ¾Ñ€ Ğ¸ ÑĞµÑ€ÑŒÑ‘Ğ·Ğ½Ğ¾ÑÑ‚ÑŒ. Ğ’Ğ·ÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ñ…Ğ¾Ñ‚Ñ Ğ±Ñ‹ Ñ‚Ñ€ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ñ‡Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ»Ğ°Ğ³ĞµÑ€ÑŒ Ğ² ÑƒÑ€Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ³Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ²ĞºĞ¸, Ğ³Ğ´Ğµ Ğº Ğ¨ĞµĞ¿Ğ°Ñ€Ğ´Ñƒ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾ÑÑ‚ÑŒÑ Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ½Ğ¾ÑÑÑ‚ÑÑ ĞºĞ°Ğº Ğº Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ¶ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ²Ñƒ. Ğ˜Ğ»Ğ¸ Ğ¶Ğµ Ğ´Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ‡Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ²ÑĞ¿Ğ¾Ğ¼Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ¾Ñ…Ñ€Ğ°Ğ½Ğ½Ğ¸ĞºĞ°, ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ½ĞµĞ²Ğ·Ğ½Ğ°Ñ‡Ğ°Ğ¹ ÑĞºĞ°Ğ¶ĞµÑ‚ Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ² Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ¸ Ğ¾Ğ½ Ğ±Ñ‹Ğ» Ñ…ÑƒĞ´Ñ‹Ğ¼.

Ğ¡Ğ°Ğ¼ Ğ¶Ğµ ĞĞ´Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ°Ğ½ Ğ¨ĞµĞ¿Ğ°Ñ€Ğ´ ĞºĞ°Ğº Ğ³Ğ»Ğ°Ğ²Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ³ĞµÑ€Ğ¾Ğ¹ ĞºÑƒĞ´Ğ° Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ°Ğ²Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ±ĞµĞ½ Ñ‡ĞµĞ¼ Ğ¤Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ¼ĞµĞ½. Ğ’ĞµĞ´ÑŒ ĞµÑĞ»Ğ¸ Ğ¨ĞµĞ¿Ğ°Ñ€Ğ´ Ğ² Ğ¿Ğ»Ğ°Ğ½Ğµ Ğ±Ğ¾ĞµĞ²Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ³Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ²ĞºĞ¸ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ·Ñ‹Ğ²Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ Ğ½Ğ¸ĞºĞ°ĞºĞ¸Ñ… Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾ÑĞ¾Ğ², Ñ‚Ğ¾ ĞºĞ°Ğº 27 Ğ»ĞµÑ‚Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ¹ ÑƒÑ‡Ñ‘Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹, Ğ½Ğ¸ Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ñƒ Ğ½Ğµ ÑĞ»ÑƒĞ¶Ğ¸Ğ²ÑˆĞ¸Ğ¹ Ğ² Ğ°Ñ€Ğ¼Ğ¸Ğ¸ ÑƒĞ¼ĞµĞµÑ‚ Ğ² ÑĞ¾Ğ²ĞµÑ€ÑˆĞµĞ½ÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğµ Ğ²Ğ»Ğ°Ğ´ĞµÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ²ÑĞµĞ¼Ğ¸ Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ´Ğ°Ğ¼Ğ¸ Ğ¾Ñ€ÑƒĞ¶Ğ¸Ñ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ° Ğ½Ğ¸ĞºĞ°Ğº Ğ½Ğµ Ñ€Ğ°ÑĞºÑ€Ñ‹Ğ²Ğ°Ğ»Ğ°.

Ğ“ĞĞ”Ğ« Ğ¢Ğ Ğ•ĞĞ˜Ğ ĞĞ’ĞĞš Ğ‘Ğ«Ğ›Ğ˜ ĞĞ• Ğ—Ğ Ğ¯...

Ğ’ ÑÑ€Ğ°Ğ²Ğ½ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğµ Ñ Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ³Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾Ğ¹ Half-Life, Opposing Force Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¼Ğ¸ĞºÑÑƒĞµÑ‚ Ğ½ĞµÑĞºĞ¾Ğ»ÑŒĞºĞ¾ Ğ¶Ğ°Ğ½Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ² ÑÑ€Ğ°Ğ·Ñƒ, Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ½Ğ°ĞºĞ¾ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ·Ğ½Ğ°Ñ‡Ğ¸Ñ‚, Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğµ Ğ¾Ñ‚ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ»Ğ° Ñ…ÑƒĞ¶Ğµ. Opposing Force Ğ¿Ğ¾ Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒÑˆĞµĞ¹ Ğ¼ĞµÑ€Ğµ ÑĞ²Ğ»ÑĞµÑ‚ÑÑ ÑˆÑƒÑ‚ĞµÑ€Ğ¾Ğ¼, Ğ° ĞºĞ¾Ğ»Ğ¸Ñ‡ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ¾ Ğ³Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğº ÑĞ²ĞµĞ´ĞµĞ½Ğ¾ Ğº Ğ¼Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ¼ÑƒĞ¼Ñƒ. Ğ—Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ°Ñ€ÑĞµĞ½Ğ°Ğ» Ğ¾Ñ€ÑƒĞ¶Ğ¸Ñ ÑĞµÑ€ÑŒÑ‘Ğ·Ğ½Ğ¾ Ñ€Ğ°ÑÑˆĞ¸Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ»ÑÑ. ĞŸĞ¾Ğ¼Ğ¸Ğ¼Ğ¾ ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ñ€Ñ‹Ñ… Ğ¿ÑƒÑˆĞµĞº, Ğ² Opposing Force Ğ·Ğ°Ğ²ĞµĞ·Ğ»Ğ¸ ĞµÑ‰Ñ‘ Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒÑˆĞµ Ğ¾Ñ€ÑƒĞ¶Ğ¸Ñ. Ğ¨ĞµĞ¿Ğ°Ñ€Ğ´ Ğ² Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ»Ğ¸Ñ‡Ğ¸Ğµ Ğ¾Ñ‚ Ğ¤Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ğ° Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶ĞµÑ‚ Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ¾Ñ€ÑƒĞ¶Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒÑÑ ÑĞ»ĞµĞ´ÑƒÑÑ‰Ğ¸Ğ¼Ğ¸ Ğ¾Ñ€ÑƒĞ´Ğ¸ÑĞ¼Ğ¸:
1)Ğ¡Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¹Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ÑĞºĞ¾Ğ¹ Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ½Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ²ĞºĞ¾Ğ¹, Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ·Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ»ÑÑÑ‰Ğ°Ñ Ğ´ĞµĞ»Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ñ…ĞµĞ´ÑˆĞ¾Ñ‚Ñ‹ Ğ¸Ğ·Ğ´Ğ°Ğ»ĞµĞºĞ°;
2) ĞŸÑƒĞ»ĞµĞ¼Ñ‘Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼, ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ½ĞµÑĞ¼Ğ¾Ñ‚Ñ€Ñ Ğ½Ğ° ÑĞ²Ğ¾Ñ Ğ²Ñ‹ÑĞ¾ĞºÑƒÑ Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ´Ğ°Ñ‡Ñƒ ÑĞ¿Ğ¾ÑĞ¾Ğ±ĞµĞ½ Ğ¿Ñ€ĞµĞ²Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ² Ñ„Ğ°Ñ€Ñˆ Ğ´Ğ°Ğ¶Ğµ ÑĞ°Ğ¼Ñ‹Ñ… ĞºÑ€ÑƒĞ¿Ğ½Ñ‹Ñ… ÑÑƒÑ‰ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ²;
3) Ğ˜Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ»Ğ°Ğ½ĞµÑ‚Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ¿Ğ»Ğ°Ğ·Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ½Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ²ĞºĞ¾Ğ¹, Ğ¸ÑÑ‚Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ½ÑƒÑ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ñ‰ÑŒ ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ñ Ğº ÑĞ¾Ğ¶Ğ°Ğ»ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ·Ğ½Ğ°Ğ» Ğ»Ğ¸ÑˆÑŒ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ´ ĞºĞ¾Ğ½ĞµÑ† Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ñ‹;
4) Ğ§Ñ‚Ğ¾? Ğ“Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¸Ñ‚Ğµ Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ñ‚Ğ°ĞºĞ¾Ğ¹ ÑĞµĞ±Ğµ Ğ°ÑÑĞ¾Ñ€Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ñ‚? Ğ ĞšĞĞš ĞĞĞ¡Ğ§ĞĞ¢ â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ ĞŸĞĞ Ğ¢ĞĞ›Ğ¬ĞĞĞ™ ĞŸĞ£Ğ¨ĞšĞ˜?! Ğ¯ Ğ½Ğµ ÑˆÑƒÑ‡Ñƒ! Ğ”Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ‡Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ²Ñ‹ÑÑ‚Ñ€ĞµĞ»Ğ°, Ğ¸ Ğ´Ğ°Ğ¶Ğµ ĞºÑ€ÑƒĞ¿Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ³Ğ°Ğ´ Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ğ»ĞµÑ‚Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑÑ Ğ½Ğ° ĞºÑƒÑĞ¾Ñ‡ĞºĞ¸.

Ğ’Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ‡ĞµĞ¼ Ğ² Opposing Force Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ±Ğ°Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ¸ÑÑŒ Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ñ‹Ğµ Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ¿Ñ‹ Ğ²Ñ€Ğ°Ğ³Ğ¾Ğ². ĞĞ³Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¼Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ½Ğ°Ğ²ĞµÑ€Ğ½Ğ¾Ğµ Ñ‚Ğ°Ñ€Ğ°ĞºĞ°Ğ½, ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ±ĞµĞ· ĞºĞ°ĞºĞ¸Ñ…-Ğ»Ğ¸Ğ±Ğ¾ ÑƒÑĞ¸Ğ»Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ñ€Ğ°ÑĞ¿Ğ»ÑÑ‰Ğ¸Ñ‚ Ğ¨ĞµĞ¿Ğ°Ñ€Ğ´Ğ°. ĞŸÑ€Ğ¸ÑˆĞµĞ»ĞµÑ† Ñ Ñ‚Ğ°Ñ€Ğ°ĞºĞ°Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ² Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ´Ğµ Ğ¾Ñ€ÑƒĞ¶Ğ¸Ñ, ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ¿Ğ¾ÑĞ»Ğµ ÑĞ¼ĞµÑ€Ñ‚Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ±ÑƒĞµÑ‚ Ğ·Ğ°ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ²Ñ€Ğ°ÑĞ¿Ğ»Ğ¾Ñ… ÑĞ¾Ğ±ÑÑ‚Ğ²ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¼ Ğ¶Ğµ Ğ¾Ñ€ÑƒĞ¶Ğ¸ĞµĞ¼. My favorite half life game! Insanely hard with no difficulty settings and you get stuck quite a bit but if you like punishing games this is for you. Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 18 janvier 2017
Best addon for Half - Life. Now we play for Adrian Shephard - HECU soldier. As well as Dr. Freeman, he will look for a way out of Black Mesa. The main differences from the original game - a large number of new monsters, and the availability of a new arsenal to destroy them.

8.5/10
 
Skipp3rUA

2 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation amusante
0
RecommandÃ©
21.8 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 27 mars 2018
Opposing Force is a great example why I will always prefer the expansion pack method of adding content to a game over DLC or micro transactions. This game is arguably even better than the original Half-Life in a lot of aspects and in any discussion about Half-Life you will have people who will list this as their all time favorite Half-Life game. It's for a good reason obviously considering how much the game expands upon the formula and mechanics of the first Half-Life.

The game introduces a ton of new content in all aspects. You have a new alien faction known as "race-x" that ramps up the difficulty and challenge in the game a ton and in general this game is quite a bit harder than the original Half-Life so I recommend playing it AFTER you complete the original Half-Life, while the game starts out with just normal Xen enemies once the race-x dudes start showing up you are going to realize how dangerous things have gotten when your trapped in a sewer with the big race-x dudes who shoot giant â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ death balls at you that can kill instantly if you are in the direct way of the ball. The game also expands upon the "black-ops" by making them a separate faction from HECU and adding appropriate units to replace what would be marine enemies in the original Half-Life. There is also a great number of more companians available to the player including medic's which in addition to being capable of firing back at the enemy also can heal the player and other friendly units, you have engineers who can cut through doors with their blow torch, and of course just normal grunts who dont have any special ability's per say but usually come with a pretty good weapon like a shotgun or assault rifle. You also have a new security guard in addition to your normal Barney's who's called "Otis" and he is a pretty amusing and interesting character to have and, again, spices up the content by adding more variety.

The arsenal the player is capable of carrying has been drastically expanded upon including two different melee weapons in place of half-life 1's single melee weapon and multiple alien and experimental weapons. A big stand out to me was the teleporter gun which can one hit "kill" an enemy by essentially teleporting him to a random location presumably somewhere in Xen, but the secondary fire will teleport you yourself to a random location in Xen that can only be accessed in that way and often contains many resources and a teleport on the other side which will get you back into black mesa at a fixed position that is usually later in the level, which is interesting because it essentially allows you to skip whole parts of levels as long as you have the ammo to utilize the alt-fire. There is also a barnacle weapon which the player can use to grapple across gaps and walls at points as well as latch on to enemies and pull it into its maw which the barnacle will proceed to devour, really creative and diverse weapons loadout for sure.

The story adds a lot of interesting new lore to the Half-Life story besides just a new alien race by clarifying on the relationship between the soldiers and the black-ops and a pretty disturbing plot point of what happens to the marines who fail to evacuate or are left behind after the order to pull out comes out. It also expands on the character of the G-man giving new insight into his "personality" and actions as well as expanding on the ending to half-life by showing what happens to black mesa itself after everything is said and done.

The multiplayer has also been expanded upon with many maps and game-modes that the original Half-Life simply does not have.

The only bad part of playing this thing is after playing such an awesome game your going to be tempted to recall the current state of gearbox software and feel a bit of despair at the whole thing. Its like if somebody who you like and highly respected joined a skinhead gang, became a gay prostitute and contracted aids and than went around snorting cocaine and beating up homeless people and stray dogs and puppy's before shooting up an old folks home before blowing himself up and screaming "hail Satan" as his last words. Maybe a bit dramatic but seriously dude, what a fall from grace.
 
Jo291

RecommandÃ©
6.4 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 29 juin 2019
Excellent edition to the Half Life series. It's from the golden age of expansion packs, when it wasn't about cosmetic items and planned addons. Gear Box puts you in the boots of Adrian Shepherd, one of the HECU marines sent to clean up Black Mesa. The game features new weapons, allies, and foes. The core gameplay is the same, just the story is told from a different perspective.
