ĞŸÑ€Ğ¾Ñ”ĞºÑ‚, Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ·Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ±Ğ»ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğ¹
Gearbox Software, ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ² Ğ±Ñ–Ğ»ÑŒÑˆ Ğ´Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¼Ñ–Ñ‡Ğ½Ğ¾Ñ Ñ‚Ğ° Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ–Ñ”Ğ½Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¾Ñ Ğ½Ğ° Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ĞµÑÑ‚Ñ€Ñ–Ğ»ĞºĞ¸ Ğ²ĞµÑ€ÑÑ–Ñ”Ñ Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ–Ğ½Ğ°Ğ»Ñƒ, Ğ· Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ¼Ğ¸ Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ´Ğ°Ğ¼Ğ¸ Ğ·Ğ±Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ—, Ğ²Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ³Ñ–Ğ², Ğ¼ĞµÑ…Ğ°Ğ½Ñ–ĞºĞ¸ Ñ‚Ğ° Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ»Ğ¸Ğ²Ñ–ÑÑ‚Ñ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ±Ğ°Ñ‡Ğ¸Ñ‚Ğ¸ Ñ–Ğ½ÑˆÑƒ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ½Ñƒ ĞºĞ¾Ğ½Ñ„Ğ»Ñ–ĞºÑ‚Ñƒ. Ğ”Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ°Ñ‚ĞºĞ¾Ğ²Ğ¾ Ğ·Ğ°Ğ·Ğ½Ğ°Ñ‡Ñƒ, Ñ‰Ğ¾ Ğ¾Ğ´Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ñƒ Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ±Ñ€Ğ°Ğ² Ğ¼Ğ°ĞºÑĞ¸Ğ¼Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ñ€Ñ–Ğ²ĞµĞ½ÑŒ ÑĞºĞ»Ğ°Ğ´Ğ½Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ñ–, ÑĞºÑ‰Ğ¾ Ñ†Ğµ Ğ´Ğ»Ñ ĞºĞ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ÑÑŒ Ğ²Ğ°Ğ¶Ğ»Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ¾.

Ğ“Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ğ³ĞµÑ€Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ½Ğ° Ñ–Ğ¼â€™Ñ Ğ•Ğ´Ñ€Ñ–Ğ°Ğ½ Ğ¨ĞµĞ¿Ğ°Ñ€Ğ´ â€“ ĞºĞ°Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ°Ğ» Ğ¼Ğ¾Ñ€ÑÑŒĞºĞ¾Ñ— Ğ¿Ñ–Ñ…Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ¸ Ğ¡Ğ¨Ğ ÑĞ¿ĞµÑ†Ğ¿Ñ–Ğ´Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ·Ğ´Ñ–Ğ»Ñƒ HECU, ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ· Ñ–Ğ½ÑˆĞ¸Ğ¼Ğ¸ ÑĞ¾Ğ»Ğ´Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ°Ğ¼Ğ¸ Ğ²Ñ–Ğ´Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ°Ğ²Ğ»ÑÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ·Ğ°Ñ‡Ğ¸ÑÑ‚Ğ¸Ñ‚Ğ¸ ĞºĞ¾Ğ¼Ğ¿Ğ»ĞµĞºÑ Ğ§Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ½Ğ¾Ñ— ĞœĞµĞ·Ğ¸ Ğ²Ñ–Ğ´ Ñ–Ğ½ÑˆĞ¾Ğ¿Ğ»Ğ°Ğ½ĞµÑ‚Ğ½Ğ¾Ñ— Ğ·Ğ°Ğ³Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ·Ğ¸ Ñ‚Ğ° ÑĞ²Ñ–Ğ´ĞºÑ–Ğ² Ñƒ Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ³Ğ»ÑĞ´Ñ– Ğ²ÑÑŒĞ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ÑĞ¾Ğ½Ğ°Ğ»Ñƒ. ĞŸĞ¾Ğ´Ñ–Ñ— Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ·Ğ¿Ğ¾Ñ‡Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ°ÑÑ‚ÑŒÑÑ Ğ´ĞµÑÑŒ Ğ· Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ñ‚Ñƒ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ñ‡Ğ°Ñ‚ĞºÑƒ Ñ‚Ñ€ĞµÑ‚ÑŒĞ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ·Ğ´Ñ–Ğ»Ñƒ Ğ² Half-Life, Ğ° ÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ¾Ñ€ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ñ€ĞµĞ·Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ°Ğ½ÑĞ½Ğ¸Ğ¹ ĞºĞ°ÑĞºĞ°Ğ´, Ñ‰Ğ¾ ÑƒÑ‚Ğ²Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ² Ğ¿Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‚Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¸Ğ¹ ÑˆÑ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¼, Ğ²Ğ¶Ğµ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ·Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ»ÑÑ” Ñ–ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ°Ğ¼ Ğ·Ñ– ÑĞ²Ñ–Ñ‚Ñƒ Ğ—ĞµĞ½ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ¸ĞºĞ°Ñ‚Ğ¸ Ğ² Ğ½Ğ°Ñˆ. Ğ£ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ñ‚ Ğ±Ñ€Ğ¸Ñ„Ñ–Ğ½Ğ³Ñƒ Ğ² Ğ³ĞµĞ»Ñ–ĞºĞ¾Ğ¿Ñ‚ĞµÑ€Ñ–, Ğ²Ñ–Ğ´Ğ±ÑƒĞ²Ğ°Ñ”Ñ‚ÑŒÑÑ Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ°ĞºĞ° Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ±ÑƒĞ»ÑŒÑ†Ñ–Ğ², Ğ¿Ñ–ÑĞ»Ñ Ñ‡Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ñ‚Ñ€Ğ°Ğ½ÑĞ¿Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‚ Ğ¿Ğ°Ğ´Ğ°Ñ”, Ğ° Ğ²Ğ¶Ğµ Ğ½Ğ° Ğ·ĞµĞ¼Ğ»Ñ– Ğ¹Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ²Ñ–Ğ´Ñ‚ÑĞ³ÑƒÑ” Ğ¼ĞµĞ´Ğ¸Ğº Ñƒ Ğ±ĞµĞ·Ğ¿ĞµÑ‡Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¼Ñ–ÑÑ†Ğµ. ĞĞºĞ»Ğ¸Ğ³Ğ°Ğ²ÑˆĞ¸, Ğ²Ñ–Ğ½ Ğ¾Ğ´Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ñƒ Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¼Ğ°Ğ³Ğ°Ñ”Ñ‚ÑŒÑÑ Ğ·â€™Ñ”Ğ´Ğ½Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¸ÑÑ Ğ· Ñ–Ğ½ÑˆĞ¸Ğ¼Ğ¸ ÑĞ¾ÑĞ·Ğ½Ğ¸ĞºĞ°Ğ¼Ğ¸, Ğ° Ğ·Ğ°Ğ²Ğ°Ğ¶Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¸ Ñ‚Ğ° Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ´Ñ–ÑÑ‚Ğ¸ Ğ¹Ğ¾Ğ¼Ñƒ Ğ±ÑƒĞ´Ğµ Ğ»Ğ¸ÑˆĞµ Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ·ÑˆĞ¸Ñ€ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ğ±ĞµÑÑ‚Ñ–Ğ°Ñ€Ñ–Ğ¹, Ñƒ Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ¶Ğµ Ñ‡Ğ°Ñ Ğ²Ñ‡ĞµĞ½Ñ– Ñ‚Ğ° Ğ¾Ñ…Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ½Ñ†Ñ– Black Mesa â€“ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ¼Ğ°Ğ³Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¸. Ğ”Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ°Ñ‚ĞºĞ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ñ Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ¿Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ¾Ñ ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ½ÑƒÑ‚ÑŒ Ñ‡Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ½Ñ– Ğ¾Ğ¿ĞµÑ€Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ½Ğ¸ĞºĞ¸, Ğ·Ğ°Ğ´Ğ°Ñ‡ĞµÑ ÑĞºĞ¸Ñ… Ğ±ÑƒĞ´Ğµ Ñ‚Ğ°ĞºĞ¾Ğ¶ Â«Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ±Ğ¸Ñ€Ğ°Ğ½Ğ½Ñ Ğ½Ğ°ÑĞ»Ñ–Ğ´ĞºÑ–Ğ²Â», Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ· Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ°Ğ³Ğ¾Ğ½Ñ–ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼. Ğ£ ÑĞµÑ€ĞµĞ´Ğ¸Ğ½Ñ– Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ½ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ñ Ğ²Ñ–Ğ´Ğ±ÑƒĞ´ĞµÑ‚ÑŒÑÑ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ñ‚ Ğ·ÑƒÑÑ‚Ñ€Ñ–Ñ‡Ñ– Ğ· ÒĞ¾Ñ€Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ¤Ñ€Ñ–Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ğ¾Ğ¼, ÑĞºĞ¸Ğ¹ ÑĞ°Ğ¼Ğµ ÑÑ‚Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ±Ğ°Ñ” Ñƒ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‚Ğ°Ğ», Ğ° Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒÑˆĞµ Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ·Ğ³Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‚Ğ°Ğ½Ğ½Ñ Ğ±ÑƒĞ´Ğµ Ğ´ĞµĞ¼Ğ¾Ğ½ÑÑ‚Ñ€ÑƒĞ²Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¸ Ñ‚Ğµ, Ñ‰Ğ¾ Ğ²Ñ–Ğ´Ğ±ÑƒĞ²Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¾ÑÑ Ğ´Ğ°Ğ»Ñ– Ğ½Ğ° Ğ—ĞµĞ¼Ğ»Ñ–.

Ğ†Ğ³Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ†ĞµÑ â€“ Ñ†Ğµ ĞºĞ»Ğ°ÑĞ¸Ñ‡Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ¹ 3D-ÑˆÑƒÑ‚ĞµÑ€ Ğ²Ñ–Ğ´ Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ÑˆĞ¾Ñ— Ğ¾ÑĞ¾Ğ±Ğ¸ Ğ· Ğ½Ñ–Ğ¼Ğ¸Ğ¼ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ°Ğ³Ğ¾Ğ½Ñ–ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ñ‚Ğ° Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ»Ğ¸Ğ²Ñ–ÑÑ‚Ñ Ğ½Ğ¾ÑĞ¸Ñ‚Ğ¸ Ğ°Ñ€ÑĞµĞ½Ğ°Ğ» Ğ·Ğ±Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ—. ĞŸĞ¾Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ½ÑĞ²Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¸ ĞµĞ½ĞµÑ€Ğ³Ñ–Ñ ĞºĞ¾ÑÑ‚ÑĞ¼Ğ° (Ğ¼Ñ–ÑÑ†ĞµĞ²Ğ° Ğ±Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ½Ñ) Ñ‚Ğ° Ğ·Ğ´Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ²â€™Ñ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ½Ğ° Ğ½Ğµ Ğ»Ğ¸ÑˆĞµ Ğ·Ñ– Ğ·Ğ²Ğ¸Ñ‡Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ… Ğ¿Ñ€ĞµĞ´Ğ¼ĞµÑ‚Ñ–Ğ², Ğ° Ğ¹ Ğ½Ğ° ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ½Ñ†Ñ–ÑÑ…, ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ñ€Ñ– Ğ²Ñ–Ğ´Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ»ÑÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ»Ğ¸ÑˆĞµ Ğ¿Ñ–Ğ´ Ñ‡Ğ°Ñ Ğ²Ğ·Ğ°Ñ”Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ´Ñ–Ñ— Ğ· Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ¼Ğ¸; Ğ½Ğ° Ğ·Ğ°Ğ¼Ñ–Ğ½Ñƒ HEV-ĞºĞ¾ÑÑ‚ÑĞ¼Ñƒ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ¹ÑˆĞ¾Ğ² Ğ±Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ½ĞµĞ¶Ğ¸Ğ»ĞµÑ‚ PCV, Ñ‰Ğ¾ Ğ¼Ñ–ÑÑ‚Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ²Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ½Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ¹ ĞŸĞĞ‘, Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ´Ğ°Ñ” Ğ²Ñ–Ğ·ÑƒĞ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ñ– Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ´Ğ¶ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ñ Ğ±ĞµĞ· Ğ·Ğ²ÑƒĞºĞ¾Ğ²Ğ¸Ñ… Ñ‚Ğ° ÑĞºĞ¸Ğ¹ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğµ Ğ·Ğ°Ñ€ÑĞ´Ğ¶Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¸ÑÑ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ°Ñ‚ĞºĞ¾Ğ²Ğ¾ Ğ²Ñ–Ğ´ ÑĞ¿ĞµÑ†Ñ–Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¸Ñ… Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸ÑÑ‚Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ—Ğ² HECU. Ğ¡ĞºÑ€Ğ¸Ğ¿Ñ‚Ğ¸ Ğ²Ñ–Ğ´Ñ–Ğ¹ÑˆĞ»Ğ¸ Ğ½Ğ° Ğ´Ñ€ÑƒĞ³Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ğ¿Ğ»Ğ°Ğ½: Ğ¨ĞµĞ¿Ğ°Ñ€Ğ´Ñƒ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ñ‚Ñ€Ñ–Ğ±Ğ½Ğ¾ ÑĞ°Ğ¼Ğ¾Ñ‚ÑƒĞ¶ĞºĞ¸ Ğ·Ğ½Ğ°Ñ…Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸Ñ‚Ğ¸ ÑˆĞ»ÑÑ…Ğ¸ Ğ´Ğ»Ñ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾ÑÑƒĞ²Ğ°Ğ½Ğ½Ñ, Ğ° Ğ¾Ñ…Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ½Ñ†Ñ– Ñ‚Ğ° Ğ²Ñ‡ĞµĞ½Ñ– Ğ²Ñ–Ğ´Ñ–Ğ³Ñ€Ğ°ÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ¼Ñ–Ğ½Ñ–Ğ¼Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ñƒ Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒ. Ğ“Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ¼ Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ²ĞµĞ´ĞµĞ½Ğ½ÑĞ¼ ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ² Ğ½ĞµĞ²ĞµĞ»Ğ¸Ñ‡Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ğ·Ğ°Ğ³Ñ–Ğ½, ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ¼Ğ°Ğ³Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ¼Ğµ Ğ² Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ‰ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ñ– Ğ²ÑÑŒĞ¾Ğ³Ğ¾, Ñ‰Ğ¾ Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ¸ Ğ·ÑƒÑÑ‚Ñ€Ñ–Ğ½ÑƒÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ½Ğ° ÑˆĞ»ÑÑ…Ñƒ, ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ğ¼Ğ°Ñ” Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ·Ğ´Ñ–Ğ»ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ñ Ğ¿Ğ¾ Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ»ÑĞ¼: Ğ¼ĞµĞ´Ğ¸Ğº Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğµ Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ»Ñ–ĞºÑƒĞ²Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¸ Ğ¾Ğ±Ğ¼ĞµĞ¶ĞµĞ½Ñƒ ĞºÑ–Ğ»ÑŒĞºÑ–ÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ²Ñ‚Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‡ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ… HP, Ñ–Ğ½Ğ¶ĞµĞ½ĞµÑ€ Ğ²Ñ–Ğ´ĞºÑ€Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ°Ñ” Ğ·Ğ°Ğ±Ğ»Ğ¾ĞºĞ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ğ½Ñ– Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ…Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸, Ğ° Ğ²Ğ°Ğ¶ĞºÑ– Ğ¿Ñ–Ñ…Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ½Ñ†Ñ– Ğ½Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¾ÑÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ²Ñ–Ğ´Ñ‡ÑƒÑ‚Ğ½Ñƒ ÑˆĞºĞ¾Ğ´Ñƒ Ğ²Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ³Ñƒ; Ğ½Ğ°ĞºĞ°Ğ·Ğ¸ Ñ‚Ğ°Ğº ÑĞ°Ğ¼Ğ¾ ÑĞºĞ»Ğ°Ğ´Ğ°ÑÑ‚ÑŒÑÑ Ğ· Ğ´Ğ²Ğ¾Ñ… Ğ²Ğ°Ñ€Ñ–Ğ°Ğ½Ñ‚Ñ–Ğ² â€“ ÑĞ»Ñ–Ğ´ÑƒĞ²Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¸ Ñ‡Ğ¸ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ¸. ĞœĞ°Ğ¹Ğ¶Ğµ Ğ²ÑÑ– Ğ’Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‚Ñ–Ò‘Ğ¾Ğ½Ñ‚Ğ¸ Ñ‚Ğ° ĞºĞ»Ğ°ÑĞ¸Ñ‡Ğ½Ñ– Ğ´Ğ»Ñ ÑĞµÑ€Ñ–Ñ— Ñ–ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ¸ Ğ±ÑƒĞ»Ğ¸ Ğ²Ñ–Ğ´Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ°Ğ²Ğ»ĞµĞ½Ñ– Ğ½Ğ° Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ´Ñ–Ñ ÒĞ¾Ñ€Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ½Ñƒ Ñ‚Ğ° Ğ‘Ğ°Ñ€Ğ½Ñ–, Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼Ñƒ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ½Ñƒ Ñ‡Ğ°ÑÑƒ Ğ·Ñ–Ñ‚ĞºĞ½ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ñ Ğ±ÑƒĞ´Ğµ Ğ²Ñ–Ğ´Ğ±ÑƒĞ²Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¸ÑÑ Ğ· Ñ–Ğ½ÑˆĞ¸Ğ¼Ğ¸, Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ¼Ğ¸ Ğ¹ Ğ±Ñ–Ğ»ÑŒÑˆ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ñ‚ÑƒĞ¶Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ¼Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ±ÑƒĞ»ÑŒÑ†ÑĞ¼Ğ¸. Ğ£ Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ñ Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ±Ğ¾Ñ€Ñƒ ÑĞºĞ»Ğ°Ğ´Ğ½Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ñ– Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ½Ğ° ÑƒĞ²Ñ–Ğ¼ĞºĞ½ÑƒÑ‚Ğ¸ Ğ¢Ñ€ĞµĞ½ÑƒĞ²Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ñƒ ĞºÑ–Ğ¼Ğ½Ğ°Ñ‚Ñƒ, Ğ´Ğµ Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ·Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ±Ğ½Ğ¸ĞºĞ¸ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ¼Ñ–ÑÑ‚Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ¸ Ğ¼Ğ°ĞºÑĞ¸Ğ¼Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ñƒ ĞºÑ–Ğ»ÑŒĞºÑ–ÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ»Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ¸Ñ… ÑĞ¸Ñ‚ÑƒĞ°Ñ†Ñ–Ğ¹ Ğ· Ğ´ĞµÑ‚Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¸Ğ¼ Ğ½Ğ°Ğ²Ñ‡Ğ°Ğ½Ğ½ÑĞ¼ ÑĞº Ğ´Ñ–ÑÑ‚Ğ¸ Ğ² Ñ‚Ñ–Ğ¹ Ñ‡Ğ¸ Ñ–Ğ½ÑˆÑ–Ğ¹. Ğ’Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ° Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ½Ñ–ÑÑ‚Ñ Ğ²Ñ–Ğ´Ñ€Ñ–Ğ·Ğ½ÑÑ”Ñ‚ÑŒÑÑ Ğ²Ñ–Ğ´ Ñ‚Ñ–Ñ”Ñ—, Ñ‰Ğ¾ Ğ±ÑƒĞ»Ğ° Ğ² Half-Life Ñ‡Ğ¸ Ñ‰Ğµ Ğ±ÑƒĞ´Ğµ Ñƒ Blue Shift Ñ‚Ğ° Ğ¿Ñ€ĞµĞ´ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ²Ğ»ĞµĞ½Ğ° Ñƒ Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ³Ğ»ÑĞ´Ñ– Ğ²Ñ–Ğ¹ÑÑŒĞºĞ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ñ— Ğ±Ğ°Ğ·Ğ¸ Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ· Ğ½ĞµĞ²ĞµĞ»Ğ¸Ñ‡Ğ½Ğ¾Ñ Ğ¿Ğ°Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ´Ñ–Ñ”Ñ Ğ½Ğ° ĞºĞ¾Ğ¼Ğ°Ğ½Ğ´Ğ¸Ñ€Ğ° Ğ· Ğ¤Ğ¾Ñ€ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ° ÒĞ°Ğ¼Ğ¿Ğ°.

Ğ’Ğ¸ĞºĞ¾Ñ€Ğ¸ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¾ Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ¹ ÑĞ°Ğ¼Ğ¸Ğ¹ GoldSrc, ÑĞºĞ¸Ğ¹ Valve Ñ‚Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ…Ğ¸ Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ°, Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğµ Ğ¾ÑĞ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ½Ñ– Ğ·Ğ¼Ñ–Ğ½Ğ¸ Ğ²Ñ–Ğ´Ğ½Ğ¾ÑÑÑ‚ÑŒÑÑ Ğ´Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ğ¾ĞºÑ€Ğ°Ñ‰ĞµĞ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾-ÑˆÑ‚ÑƒÑ‡Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ñ–Ğ½Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ĞµĞºÑ‚Ñƒ, ÑĞºĞ¸Ğ¹ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ·Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¸Ğ² Ğ²Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ°Ğ¼ Ñ‚Ğ° ÑĞ¾ÑĞ·Ğ½Ğ¸ĞºĞ°Ğ¼ Ğ±Ñ–Ğ»ÑŒÑˆ ÑĞºÑ–ÑĞ½Ğ¾ ÑĞ»Ñ–Ğ´ÑƒĞ²Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¸ ÑĞºÑ€Ğ¸Ğ¿Ñ‚Ğ°Ğ¼. Ğ—Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¸ÑˆĞ¸Ğ»Ğ°ÑÑ Ñ‚Ğ°ĞºĞ¾Ñ ÑĞ°Ğ¼Ğ¾Ñ Ñ– ÑĞ¸ÑÑ‚ĞµĞ¼Ğ° Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ĞµÑÑƒĞ²Ğ°Ğ½Ğ½Ñ Ñ‚Ğ° Ğ¼â€™ÑÑĞ°, Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ·Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ»ÑÑÑ‡Ğ¸ Ğ²Ğ¸ĞºĞ¾Ğ½ÑƒĞ²Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¸ bunnyhop Ñ‚Ğ° Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ·Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¸ Ğ½Ğ° ÑˆĞ¼Ğ°Ñ‚ĞºĞ¸ Ğ±ÑƒĞ´ÑŒ-ÑĞºĞµ Ñ‚Ñ–Ğ»Ğ¾ Ğ²Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ° Ñ‡Ğ¸ ÑĞ¾ÑĞ·Ğ½Ğ¸ĞºĞ°, Ğ½Ğ° Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ÑˆĞ¸Ñ… Ñ€Ñ–Ğ²Ğ½ÑÑ… Ğ³Ñ€Ğ° Â«Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ¿Ğ°Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ²ÑƒÑ”Â» Ñ‚ÑƒÑˆĞºÑƒ Ñ‚Ñ–Ğ»ÑŒĞºĞ¸-Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ²Ğ±Ğ¸Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ ÑÑƒĞ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ½Ğ¸ĞºĞ°, Ñ‡Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ½Ñ–ĞºĞ¾Ğ»Ğ¸ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ²Ñ–Ğ´Ğ±ÑƒĞ²Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¾ÑÑ Ğ´Ğ¾ Ñ†ÑŒĞ¾Ğ³Ğ¾, Ğ°Ğ»Ğµ Ğ²Ğ¶Ğµ Ğ·Ğ° ĞºÑ–Ğ»ÑŒĞºĞ° Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ·Ğ´Ñ–Ğ»Ñ–Ğ² Ñ‚Ñ€ÑƒĞ¿Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ½Ñ–ÑÑ‚Ñ Ğ²Ñ–Ğ´ĞºĞ¸Ğ´Ğ°ÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ñ†Ñ Â«Ñ„Ñ–ÑˆĞºÑƒÂ». Ğ¡Ğ°ÑƒĞ½Ğ´Ñ‚Ñ€ĞµĞº Ğ²Ñ–Ğ´Ñ‚Ğ²Ğ¾Ñ€ÑÑ”Ñ‚ÑŒÑÑ Ñƒ Ğ¿ĞµĞ²Ğ½Ñ– Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ñ‚Ğ¸ Ñ‚Ğ° Ğ½Ğ°Ğ³Ğ°Ğ´ÑƒÑ” ÑÑƒĞ¼Ñ–Ñˆ Ğ¼ÑƒĞ·Ğ¸ĞºĞ¸ ĞºÑ–Ğ½Ñ†Ñ 1990-Ñ… Ñ‚Ğ° Depeche Mode, Ğ° ÑĞ°Ğ¼Ğµ Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ±Ğ¾Ğ¼Ğ°Ğ¼Ğ¸ Some Great Reward Ñ‚Ğ° Black Celebration; Ğ¼ĞµĞ¼Ğ½Ğµ Ğ·Ğ²ÑƒĞºĞ¾Ğ²Ğµ ÑÑƒĞ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¶ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ñ Ñ‚Ğ° ÑĞºÑ–ÑĞ½Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ğ·Ğ²ÑƒĞº Ğ½Ğ° Ğ¼Ñ–ÑÑ†Ñ–. ĞŸĞ¾Ğ²Ğ½Ñ–ÑÑ‚Ñ Ğ²Ñ–Ğ´ÑÑƒÑ‚Ğ½Ñ– Ñ–Ğ³Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ²Ñ– Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¸ĞºĞ¸, Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼Ñƒ ĞºĞ¾Ğ½Ñ‚Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒ Ğ½Ğ°Ğ´ Ğ³Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ¼ Ğ³ĞµÑ€Ğ¾Ñ”Ğ¼ Ğ·Ğ°Ğ²Ğ¶Ğ´Ğ¸ Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ±ÑƒĞ²Ğ°Ñ” Ğ² Ñ€ÑƒĞºĞ°Ñ… Ğ³Ñ€Ğ°Ğ²Ñ†Ñ, ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ¹ ÑĞ¿Ğ¾ÑÑ‚ĞµÑ€Ñ–Ğ³Ğ°Ñ” Ğ·Ğ° ÑĞºÑ€Ğ¸Ğ¿Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ¼Ğ¸ ÑÑ†ĞµĞ½ĞºĞ°Ğ¼Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ñ€ÑĞ¼Ğ¾ Ğ· Ğ¾Ñ‡ĞµĞ¹, Ğ°ÑĞ¾Ñ†Ñ–ÑÑÑ‡Ğ¸ ÑĞµĞ±Ğµ Ğ· Ğ•Ğ´Ñ€Ñ–Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¼. G-man â€“ Ğ·Ğ°Ğ³Ğ°Ğ´ĞºĞ¾Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ÑĞ¾Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¶ Ñƒ Ğ´Ñ–Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ¼Ñƒ ĞºĞ¾ÑÑ‚ÑĞ¼Ñ– Ñ‚Ğ° ÑĞ°ĞºĞ²Ğ¾ÑĞ¶Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ·Ñ– Ğ·Ğ½Ğ°Ñ‡ĞºĞ¾Ğ¼ Ğ§Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ½Ğ¾Ñ— ĞœĞµĞ·Ğ¸ â€“ Ğ·â€™ÑĞ²Ğ»ÑÑ”Ñ‚ÑŒÑÑ Ğ² Ñ€Ñ–Ğ·Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ… Ğ¼Ñ–ÑÑ†ÑÑ… Ñ‚Ğ° ÑĞ»Ñ–Ğ´ĞºÑƒÑ” Ğ°Ğ±Ğ¾ Ğ·Ğ°Ğ²Ğ°Ğ¶Ğ°Ñ” Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾ÑÑƒĞ²Ğ°Ğ½Ğ½Ñ Ğ¨ĞµĞ¿Ğ°Ñ€Ğ´Ğ°, ÑĞºĞ¸Ğ¹ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğµ Ğ·Ğ°Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ´Ñ–ÑÑ‚Ğ¸ Ğ¹Ğ¾Ğ¼Ñƒ ÑˆĞºĞ¾Ğ´Ğ¸.

ĞŸĞ¾Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸ Ñ†Ğµ, Ğ°ÑĞ¾Ñ€Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ñ‚ Ğ·Ğ±Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ— Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ·ÑˆĞ¸Ñ€ĞµĞ½Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğµ Ñ‚Ñ–Ğ»ÑŒĞºĞ¸ Ğ°Ñ€ÑĞµĞ½Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ»ÑĞ´ĞµĞ¹, Ğ°Ğ»Ğµ Ğ¹ ĞºÑ€ÑƒÑ‚Ğ¸Ğ¼Ğ¸ Ñ–Ğ½ÑˆĞ¾Ğ¿Ğ»Ğ°Ğ½ĞµÑ‚Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ¼Ğ¸ Â«Ñ–ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ°Ğ¼Ğ¸Â», ÑĞºĞ¸Ñ… Ñ†Ñ–ĞºĞ°Ğ²Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğµ Ñ‚Ñ–Ğ»ÑŒĞºĞ¸ Ğ²Ğ¸ĞºĞ¾Ñ€Ğ¸ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ²ÑƒĞ²Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¸, Ğ°Ğ»Ğµ Ğ¹ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ·Ğ³Ğ»ÑĞ´Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¸. ĞĞ° ĞµĞºÑ€Ğ°Ğ½Ñ– Ğ² Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸Ğ½ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ñ‚ Ğ´Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ½ÑŒĞ¾ Ğ±ĞµÑÑ‚Ñ–Ğ°Ñ€Ñ–Ñ Ğ Ğ°ÑĞ¸ Ğ•ĞºÑ, Ñ‰Ğ¾Ğ± ÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¸Ñ‚Ğ¸ ÑĞ¿Ñ€Ğ°Ğ²Ğ¶Ğ½Ñ Ğ±Ñ–Ğ¹Ğ½Ñ, Ğ²Ğ¸ĞºĞ¾Ñ€Ğ¸ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ²ÑƒÑÑ‡Ğ¸ Ğ±ÑƒĞ´ÑŒ-ÑĞºÑ– ÑĞ¿Ğ¾ÑĞ¾Ğ±Ğ¸ Ğ·Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ‰ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ñ. ĞĞºÑ€Ñ–Ğ¼ ĞºĞµÑ€ÑƒĞ²Ğ°Ğ½Ğ½Ñ Ñ€Ñ–Ğ·Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ¼Ğ¸ Ğ·Ğ°Ğ³Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¼Ğ¸ ÑĞ¾Ğ»Ğ´Ğ°Ñ‚, Ğ²Ğ²ĞµĞ´ĞµĞ½Ğ¾ Ğ¼ĞµÑ…Ğ°Ğ½Ñ–ĞºÑƒ Ğ»Ğ°Ğ·Ñ–Ğ½Ğ½Ñ Ğ¿Ğ¾ Ñ€Ñ–Ğ·Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ¼ ĞºĞ°Ğ½Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ°Ğ¼ Ñ‡Ğ¸ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ñ‚ÑƒĞ·ĞºĞ°Ğ¼, Ñ‰Ğ¾ Ğ·ÑƒÑÑ‚Ñ€Ñ–Ğ½ĞµÑ‚ÑŒÑÑ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸Ğ½ Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·.

ĞŸĞ¾Ğ²Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ…Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¶ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ñ ÑƒĞºĞ»Ğ°Ğ´Ğ°Ñ”Ñ‚ÑŒÑÑ Ğ² 6-6.5 Ğ³Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸Ğ½, Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ²Ğ´Ğ²Ñ–Ñ‡Ñ– Ğ±Ñ–Ğ»ÑŒÑˆĞµ Ğ·Ğ° Blue Shift, Ğ° Ğ² ÑÑƒĞ¼Ñ– Ğ· Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ¼ Ğ²Ğ¸Ñ…Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ±Ğ»Ğ¸Ğ·Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ñ‡Ğ°Ñ Ğ½Ğ° Ğ·Ğ°Ğ²ĞµÑ€ÑˆĞµĞ½Ğ½Ñ Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ–Ğ½Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Half-Life. Ğ†Ğ½ÑˆĞ¾Ğ¿Ğ»Ğ°Ğ½ĞµÑ‚Ğ½Ğ° Ğ·Ğ±Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ Ñ‚Ğ° Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ»Ğ¸Ğ²Ñ–ÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ²Ğ¸ĞºĞ¾Ñ€Ğ¸ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ²ÑƒĞ²Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¸ ĞºĞ°Ğ½Ğ°Ñ‚, Ñ‰Ğ¾Ğ± Ñ€ÑƒÑ…Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¸ÑÑ Ğ²Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ· Ñ‡Ğ¸ Ğ²Ğ³Ğ¾Ñ€Ñƒ Ğ±Ñ–Ğ»ÑŒÑˆĞµ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ±ÑƒĞ´Ğµ Ğ´Ğ¾ÑÑ‚ÑƒĞ¿Ğ½Ğ°, Ğ½Ñ– Ğ² Half-Life 2, Ğ½Ñ– Ğ² ĞµĞ¿Ñ–Ğ·Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ°Ñ… Ğ´Ğ¾ Ğ½ÑŒĞ¾Ğ³Ğ¾, ÑĞº Ñ– Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ·ÑˆĞ¸Ñ€ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ğ±ĞµÑÑ‚Ñ–Ğ°Ñ€Ñ–Ğ¹ ÑĞ²Ñ–Ñ‚Ñƒ Ğ—ĞµĞ½, Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼Ñƒ Ñ†Ğµ ÑƒĞ½Ñ–ĞºĞ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¸Ğ¹ ÑˆĞ°Ğ½Ñ Ğ½Ğµ Ñ‚Ñ–Ğ»ÑŒĞºĞ¸ Ñ†Ñ–ĞºĞ°Ğ²Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ²ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ¸ Ñ‡Ğ°Ñ, Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ‰ÑƒÑÑ‡Ğ¸ Ğ²ÑĞµ Ğ¶Ğ¸Ğ²Ğµ, Ğ°Ğ»Ğµ Ğ¹ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ±Ğ°Ñ‡Ğ¸Ñ‚Ğ¸ Ğ±Ğ°Ğ³Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ñ‡Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾, Ñƒ Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼Ñƒ Ñ‡Ğ¸ÑĞ»Ñ– Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ³Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¸ Ğ·Ğ° Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ· Ğ²Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ³Ñ–Ğ² ÒĞ¾Ñ€Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ° Ğ¤Ñ€Ñ–Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ğ°. Ğ”Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ½ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ñ Ğ²ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ğ²Ğ¸ÑĞ¾ĞºĞ¸Ğ¹ ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ½Ğ´Ğ°Ñ€Ñ‚ ÑĞºĞ¾ÑÑ‚Ñ–, ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ¹, Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¶Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒ, ÑĞ°Ğ¼Ñ– Ğ¶ Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ·Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ±Ğ½Ğ¸ĞºĞ¸ Ñ–Ğ· Gearbox Software Ñƒ Ğ½Ğ°ÑÑ‚ÑƒĞ¿Ğ½Ñ–Ğ¹ Ğ³Ñ€Ñ– Ğ½Ğµ Ğ´Ğ¾ÑÑĞ³Ğ»Ğ¸.
 
Bloody Punisher
317 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
18 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
5.8 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 9 janvier 2016
Half-Life Opposing Force is a stand alone add-on developed by Gearbox for the original Half-Life 1. It's set in the same world and environment only this time from the perspective of one of the U.S. Marines of which were the enemy in the original game.

I always enjoyed these add-ons for the different perspectives that overlapping ever so slightly. The detail in these games are great and despite how old they are i still really enjoy them. For me they are quite nostalgic to play, but i imagine maybe for others who are just now coming across these games, they might look a bit crap. With that said, i'd hope that the story would be enough to keep the new audiences interested.

The game runs great for it's age. The resolution for my screen wasn't compatible but it wasn't too bad, it was still very playable. Unlike my recent playthrough of Half-Life: Source, this one actually had no bugs or anything that stopped me in my tracks. I had no problems with this game from start to finish. Although, this game was a quite a bit shorter.

I sunk about 5 hours into this game and completed it in that time, compared to the original game, which took me a lot longer, this game is fairly short. With that said it's still a great addition to the franchise. As far as mods go, this one was great.

There are interesting new additions in this game, a few of which i forgot about. New races of alien, new human enemies and new weapons. All of which kept the game interesting instead of it just feeling like the first one. Again, there is never a dull moment in these games as there is always something around the corner. Some of the puzzles in this game impressed me, as they were just as creative, if not more so, then the first game.

All in all I've definitely recommend this game if you have played the first one and can put up with the old style of the game.


TL;DR : A great add-on to the original game, it's old but classic. You play from a different perspective from the first, get new weapons, fight new enemies and it's generally just a lot of fun, although shorter then the original game.


For anyone interested, My Review for Half-Life: Source:
http://steamcommunity.com/id/Stefneh/recommended/280
 
Stefneh

RecommandÃ©
19.3 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 3 octobre 2014
Best expansion for a game : EVER!
I haven't had so much enjoyment playing an expansion pack.
Opposing Force not only expands the main game, but adds major updates to the already grand foundation laid out by Half-Life. The story starts right where Half-Life starts, but you're controlling a commando of the HECU unit (who were the army squadrons that were trying to kill you and the Black Mesa scientists in the original game) and the plot cuts off to a different direction that we never got to see before and also you get to have super cool buddies and with many additions to the game like : new weapons, different equipment, lots of new characters, better AI, squad mates, lots of new enemies etc.
And best thing is, this game is really cheap on sale with the Valve Anthology pack.

9/10
 
Vixus

ĞĞ±Ğ·Ğ¾Ñ€ Ğ½Ğ° Half Life

MY RATING:
ğŸŒŸ ğŸŒŸ ğŸŒŸ ğŸŒŸ ğŸŒŸ ğŸŒŸ ğŸŒŸ ğŸŒŸ ğŸŒŸ âœ˜
9 / 10

Well, Half-Life (Opposing Force) is like any other game. Either you like it or you hate it.

One shouldn't forget that the game is from 1998 / 1999 and is therefore one of the really old games.
Due to the age, it is of course absolutely not comparable with current games, even if they are retro games. Whether they are created from scratch and with a retro look, or are simply technically polished, a Half-Life will always play differently than "younger" games.

I'm a total Half Life fan. It's no secret and I don't make any of it.
This is probably due to my age and the fact that I played the game for hours after it was released. I even have the packaging with CD-ROM somewhere (if anyone else knows ğŸ˜‰)

As far as I know, Opposing Force is one of the first add-ons for half-Life.
The story about Black Mesa and the planet Xen is (almost) the same here, but this time you don't experience the events from Gordon Freeman's point of view, but as soldier Adrian Shephard whose job it is to hunt down scientist Gordon Freeman.

At the beginning of the story you are on your own as usual, but this changes as the game progresses.
With their different abilities, the scattered soldiers form a team that can act together from now on, as long as the AI plays along.
Unfortunately, it happens every now and then that you run into a room full of aliens alone and the AI comrades-in-arms are standing around somewhere else.
Nevertheless, the presence of the teammates pays off because you have the option, for example, to always have a medic on the team or another team member who welds open locked doors.

In terms of action, the add-on is in no way inferior to the main game.

Only for younger or new Half-Life players there may be an issue (as mentioned in my Half-Life review) that the game feels or plays "weird".

In my opinion, the add-on is a must-have for die-hard fans.

âœ… Great level design

Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 22 novembre 2022
Produit reÃ§u gratuitement

It's great! A proper expansion with its own Hazard Course (Boot Camp) level. If you're planning on playing both, play Blue Shift BEFORE this.

Buying this or Blue Shift unlocks them for play in Sven Co-op, by the way. After installing either, look for the files 'Install_OpFor_Support' and 'Install_bshift_Support' inside the 'svencoop' folder to enable them in the '-sp_campaign_portal' map. The Sven Co-op version doesn't have the end boss, though i've played it on a custom server so it has to exist for download. Used this, it works, only the host has to have it on:

https://www.reddit.com/r/svencoop/comments/870h5d/mapscript_gene_worm_boss/

The Boot Camp is missing, however.

Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 19 juillet 2014
Die erste Erweiterung zu Half Life erschien 1999 und lÃ¤sst den Spieler in die Rolle von Adrian Shephard schlÃ¼pfen, der als Soldat in die Black Mesa geschickt wird um die Anlage zu â€sÃ¤ubernâ€œ. Die Handlung entspricht der aus Half Life,jedoch aus den Augen Shephards,so findet man sich teils in bekannten Umgebungen wieder aber darf natÃ¼rlich auch neue Gegenden erkunden.Befreundete Soldaten unterstÃ¼tzen Shephard im Kampf,leisten erste Hilfe(SanitÃ¤ter) oder Ã¶ffnen den Zugang zu neuen Bereichen(Pioniere).Einige Waffen wurden ersetzt,beispielsweise bekommt Shephard statt einem Revolver eine Desert Eagle und es wurden auch vÃ¶llig neue wie ein MG und weiteres Alienarsenal hinzugefÃ¼gt.
Opposing Force erzÃ¤hlt zwar nicht die Geschichte von Half Life weiter,es ist aber dennoch lohnenswert den Vorfall in der Black Mesa Forschungsanlage einmal mit anderen Augen zu sehen. Die Neuerungen lassen keine Langeweile aufkommen und es wird ein etwas anderes Licht auf die Soldaten geworfen,die letztendlich auch um ihr Ãœberleben kÃ¤mpfen mÃ¼ssen.

Interessanterweise wurden in der Deutschen Version diesmal nicht die Soldaten durch Roboter ersetzt wie im Hauptspiel. Blut- und Splattereffekte sind jedoch entfernt worden.
GlÃ¼cklicherweise gibt es eine MÃ¶glichkeit,diese Ã„nderungen rÃ¼ckgÃ¤ngig zu machen. Wer die â€unmodifizierteâ€œ Version spielen mÃ¶chte, der sollte sich diesen Guide mal nÃ¤her anschauen. Hat einwandfrei funktioniert!

RecommandÃ©
10.7 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 17 fÃ©vrier 2019
Produit reÃ§u gratuitement

Easily the most underrated game in the Half life series. You play as Corporal (not Commander) Adrian Shepherd, one of the marines sent to eliminate Gordon Freeman and clean up the mess from the Black Mesa Resonance Cascade...only to find out there's much more to this story than just an accidental alien invasion.
Here's teh Good/Bad Summary:

Good
- New weapons and monsters, all of which are awesome and change the gameplay in interesting ways.
- Superb (and terrifying) level design which takes full advantage of all these additions (and often in very creative ways).
- Different soldier variants actually give your teammates some purpose other than just dudes that cover you (Medics heal you, Engineers cut through sealed doors, etc.)
- New creepy soundtrack adds to the atmosphere well.
- A couple neat deja-vu moments.
- 7-hour Expansion Pack (Remember when those were a thing?)
- The downright hilarious (and entirely optional) tutorial alone is worth picking this up...trust me!
- Didn't see that ending coming!

Bad
- Night Vision can get obstructive and has lousy range compared to the original flashlight.
- The irritating as hell final level.
- Final Boss is a bit of a pushover.

9.5 Shock Troopers/10 Just buy it!

Product received for free because this game - along with Doom, Starcraft, Diablo 2, Quake, Unreal Tournament 1999, and the original Half-Life of course - was my childhood; And they haven't aged a day since!
 
sLaYtA
238 produits enregistrÃ©s
0

0

44.1 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 27 mars 2016

Ğ’Ğ¾Ñ‚ Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒĞºĞ¾ Ğ²Ğ¼ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ğ´ĞµÑĞ°Ğ½Ñ‚Ğ¸Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ Ñƒ Ğ½Ğ°Ñ Ğ¿Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ğ»Ğ°Ğ½Ñƒ Ğ¿Ğ°Ğ´ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğµ Ñ Ğ´Ğ¸ĞºĞ¸Ğ¼ Ğ³Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ…Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ¿Ñ€ÑĞ¼Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ğ¾ÑÑ€ĞµĞ´Ğ¸ Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ğ´Ğ¸Ñ€Ğ°ĞµĞ¼Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ¹Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ¼ĞµĞ¶Ğ´Ñƒ Ğ·ĞµĞ¼Ğ»ÑĞ½Ğ°Ğ¼Ğ¸ Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸ÑˆĞµĞ»ÑŒÑ†Ğ°Ğ¼Ğ¸ Black Mesa. ĞÑ‡Ğ½ÑƒĞ²ÑˆĞ¸ÑÑŒ, Ğ¼Ñ‹ Ğ¾Ğ±Ğ½Ğ°Ñ€ÑƒĞ¶Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ°ĞµĞ¼ Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ¾Ñ‚Ñ€ĞµĞ·Ğ°Ğ½Ñ‹ Ğ¾Ñ‚ Ğ¾ÑĞ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ½Ñ‹Ñ… Ğ¾Ñ‚Ñ€ÑĞ´Ğ¾Ğ², ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‹Ğµ Ğ²ĞµĞ´ÑƒÑ‚ Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ°ĞºÑ‚Ğ¸Ñ‡ĞµÑĞºĞ¸ Ğ¿Ğ¾ Ğ²ÑĞµĞ¼Ñƒ ĞºĞ¾Ğ¼Ğ¿Ğ»ĞµĞºÑÑƒ. Ğ˜Ğ¼ĞµÑ Ğ½Ğ° Ñ€ÑƒĞºĞ°Ñ… Ğ»Ğ¸ÑˆÑŒ Ñ‚ÑĞ¶ĞµĞ»ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¹ ĞºĞ»ÑÑ‡, Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¼ Ğ¿Ñ€ĞµĞ´ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¸Ñ‚ Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ½Ğ¾ â€“ Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ¶Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ.

- Ğ¢Ğ°Ğº ĞºĞ°Ğº Ğ¼Ñ‹ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ°ĞµĞ¼ Ğ·Ğ° Ğ¼Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¿ĞµÑ…Ğ°, Ğ² Ğ½Ğ°ÑˆĞµ Ñ€Ğ°ÑĞ¿Ğ¾Ñ€ÑĞ¶ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğµ Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ´Ğ°ÑÑ‚ ĞºĞ°Ğº Ğ¸ Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ¿Ğ¸Ñ‡Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ°Ñ€Ğ¼ĞµĞ¹ÑĞºĞ¸Ğµ Ğ¾Ñ€ÑƒĞ´Ğ¸Ñ ÑƒĞ±Ğ¸Ğ¹ÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ° Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ¿Ğ° Ğ¿ÑƒĞ»ĞµĞ¼ĞµÑ‚Ğ° Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ¸ ÑĞ½Ğ°Ğ¹Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ÑĞºĞ¾Ğ¹ Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ½Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ²ĞºĞ¸, Ñ‚Ğ°Ğº Ğ¸ ÑĞºĞ·Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ¸ĞºÑƒ Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ¿Ğ° ĞÑ€ÑƒĞ¶Ğ¸Ñ ĞŸĞµÑ€ĞµĞ¼ĞµÑ‰ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ, ÑĞ¾Ğ·Ğ´Ğ°Ğ½Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ² ĞºÑƒĞ»ÑƒĞ°Ñ€Ğ°Ñ… Black Mesa.
- Ğ Ğ°Ğ·Ñ€Ğ°Ğ±Ğ¾Ñ‚Ñ‡Ğ¸ĞºĞ¸ Ğ½Ğµ ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¸ Ñ…Ğ°Ğ»Ñ‚ÑƒÑ€Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ¸ Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ´Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¸ Ğ³ĞµĞ¹Ğ¼Ğ¿Ğ»ĞµĞ¹, Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¶Ğ¸Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾ÑÑ‚ÑŒÑ Ğ½ĞµĞ¼Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¸Ğ¼ Ğ¼ĞµĞ½ĞµĞµ Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ³Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ñ‹, Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ñ€ĞµĞ²Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‰Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ Opposing Force Ğ² Ğ¿Ğ¾Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¸ ÑĞ°Ğ¼Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ÑÑ‚ĞµĞ»ÑŒĞ½ÑƒÑ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ñƒ.

Â«ĞŸĞ ĞĞ¢Ğ˜Ğ’Â»
- ĞÑĞ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ½Ğ°Ñ Ğ¿Ñ€ĞµÑ‚ĞµĞ½Ğ·Ğ¸Ñ ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€ÑƒÑ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ²Ñ‹ÑĞºĞ°Ğ·Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ² Ñ†ĞµĞ»Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ¾Ñ‡ĞµĞ½ÑŒ Ğ´Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¹Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğµ â€“ Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ°Ñ Ğ¸Ğ½Ñ‚ĞµÑ€Ğ¿Ñ€ĞµÑ‚Ğ°Ñ†Ğ¸Ñ ĞºĞ°Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ² Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ³Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ°Ğ»Ğ°. Ğ’ Ñ‡Ğ°ÑÑ‚Ğ½Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ñ€ĞµÑĞ»Ğ¾Ğ²ÑƒÑ‚Ğ°Ñ Ğ Ğ°ÑĞ° Â«Ğ¥Â», ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ°Ñ Ğ² ĞºĞ°ĞºĞ¾Ğ¼ â€“ Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ½Ğ¾ÑˆĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğ¸ Ğ´Ğ°Ğ¶Ğµ Ğ¿Ñ€ĞµĞ²Ğ¾ÑÑ…Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸Ñ‚ Ğ¾Ğ±Ğ¸Ñ‚Ğ°Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ĞµĞ¹ Ğ¼Ğ¸Ñ€Ğ° Ğ—ĞµĞ½, Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ¸ ĞºĞ°Ğº Ğ¼Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ¼ÑƒĞ¼ Ğ½Ğµ ÑƒÑÑ‚ÑƒĞ¿Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ Ğ¸Ğ¼, Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ‰Ğµ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ·Ğ°Ğ´ÑƒĞ¼Ñ‹Ğ²Ğ°Ğ»Ğ°ÑÑŒ! - ĞĞµĞ²Ğ·Ğ¸Ñ€Ğ°Ñ Ğ½Ğ° Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ²ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸Ğµ Ğ¸Ğ´ĞµÑ‚ Ğ¾Ñ‚ Ğ»Ğ¸Ñ†Ğ° Ğ¼Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¿ĞµÑ…Ğ° â€“ Ñ‡ĞµĞ»Ğ¾Ğ²ĞµĞºĞ° Ğ²Ğ¾ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾, Ğ° Ğ¿Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼Ñƒ â€“ ÑĞµÑ€ÑŒĞµĞ·Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾, Ğ² Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğµ Ğ² Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ñ‹ Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒÑˆĞµ Ğ±Ğ°Ğ»Ğ°Ğ³Ğ°Ğ½Ğ° Ñ‡ĞµĞ¼ Ğ² Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ³Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ°Ğ»Ğµ â€“ Ğ¼Ñ‹ Ğ¸ÑĞ¿Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒĞ·ÑƒĞµĞ¼ Ğ² ĞºĞ°Ñ‡ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğµ Ğ¾Ñ€ÑƒĞ¶Ğ¸Ñ Ñ€Ñ‹Ğ³Ğ°ÑÑ‰ÑƒÑ ÑÑ‰ĞµÑ€Ğ¸Ñ†Ñƒ (Ğ² Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ĞµÑ€Ñ‹Ğ²Ğ°Ñ… Ğ¼ĞµĞ¶Ğ´Ñƒ ÑÑ‚Ñ€ĞµĞ»ÑŒĞ±Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ½ĞµĞ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ»Ğ°Ğ¶Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ°Ñ ĞµĞµ Ğ¿Ğ¾ ÑĞ¿Ğ¸Ğ½ĞºĞµ!) ĞŸĞ¾ĞºĞ° Ğ² ĞºĞ¾Ğ¼Ğ¿Ğ»ĞµĞºÑĞµ Ğ¸Ğ´ĞµÑ‚ Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ¹Ğ½Ñ, ÑƒÑ‡ĞµĞ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ¸ Ğ¾Ñ…Ñ€Ğ°Ğ½Ğ½Ğ¸Ğº Ğ¾Ğ±ÑÑƒĞ¶Ğ´Ğ°ÑÑ‚ Ğ´Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¸Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ² Ğ¸Ğ· Â«Ğ—Ğ²ĞµĞ·Ğ´Ğ½Ñ‹Ñ… Ğ’Ğ¾Ğ¹Ğ½Â» (!!!), Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ ÑƒĞ²Ğ¸Ğ´ĞµÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ¤Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ğ° ÑĞ¾ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ½Ñ‹ (Ğ²Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ‡ĞµĞ¼ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ğ±Ñ‹Ğ»Ğ¾ Ğ¸ Ğ² Â«Ğ¾Ñ„Ğ¸Ñ†Ğ¸Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾Ğ¼Â» Blue Shift), Ğ½Ğ¾ ÑƒĞ²Ğ¸Ğ´ĞµÑ‚ÑŒ Ñ Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¾ÑĞ°Ğ¼Ğ¸, Ğ·Ğ°Ğ¿Ğ»ĞµÑ‚ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¼Ğ¸ Ğ² ĞºĞ¾Ğ½ÑĞºĞ¸Ğ¹ Ñ…Ğ²Ğ¾ÑÑ‚, Ğ½Ñƒ Ğ¸ Ñ‚.Ğ¿. ĞŸÑƒĞ½ĞºÑ‚Ñ‹:
Ğ¡ÑĞ¶ĞµÑ‚ - Ğ”ĞµĞ¹ÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ¸Ğµ Ğ°Ğ´Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ° Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¸ÑÑ…Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸Ñ‚ Ğ¿Ğ°Ñ€Ğ°Ğ»Ğ»ĞµĞ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾ ÑĞ¾Ğ±Ñ‹Ñ‚Ğ¸ÑĞ¼ HL1 Ğ½Ğ¾ Ñ‡ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ· Ğ½ĞµÑĞºĞ¾Ğ»ÑŒĞºĞ¾ Ñ‡Ğ°ÑĞ¾Ğ² Ğ¿Ğ¾ÑĞ»Ğµ ĞºĞ°ÑĞºĞ°Ğ´Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ñ€ĞµĞ·Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ°Ğ½ÑĞ°, Ğ° Ğ¼Ñ‹ ĞĞ´Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ°Ğ½ Ğ¨ĞµĞ¿Ğ°Ñ€Ğ´, ĞºĞ°Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ°Ğ» HECU Ğ¿Ğ¾ÑĞ»Ğ°Ğ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ² Ğ§ĞµÑ€Ğ½ÑƒÑ ĞœĞµĞ·Ñƒ Ğ½Ğ° Ğ»Ğ¸ĞºĞ²Ğ¸Ğ´Ğ°Ñ†Ğ¸Ñ Ğ¿Ğ¾ÑĞ»ĞµĞ´ÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ğ¸ ÑĞ²Ğ¸Ğ´ĞµÑ‚ĞµĞ»ĞµĞ¹, Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ²Ğ¾ Ğ²Ñ€ĞµĞ¼Ñ Ğ·Ğ°Ñ‡Ğ¸Ñ‚ĞºĞ¸ Ğ¾Ğ½ Ğ¾ĞºĞ°Ğ·Ñ‹Ğ²Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ÑÑ Ğ¾Ñ‚Ñ€ĞµĞ·Ğ°Ğ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¼ Ğ¾Ñ‚ Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ñ‹Ñ… Ğ¸ Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¼ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ´ĞµÑ‚ÑÑ Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ±Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒÑÑ ÑŒ Ğ¸Ğ· Ğ§ĞµÑ€Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¹ ĞœĞµĞ·Ñ‹.
Ğ¡ÑĞ¶ĞµÑ‚ Ğ´Ğ»Ñ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ Ğ¸ ÑĞ¿Ğ¸Ğ½-Ğ¾Ñ„Ñ„Ğ° Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸ Ğ²ÑĞµĞ¹ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğµ Ğ¸Ğ½Ñ‚ĞµÑ€ĞµÑĞµĞ½ Ğ¸ Ñ‚ĞµÑĞ½Ğ¾ Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ¿Ğ»ĞµÑ‚Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ÑÑ Ñ Ğ¸ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¸ĞµĞ¹ Ğ¾ÑĞ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ñ‹, Ğ¿Ğ¾ĞºĞ°Ğ·Ñ‹Ğ²Ğ°Ñ ÑĞ¾Ğ±Ñ‹Ñ‚Ğ¸ÑÑ Ğ´Ñ€ÑƒĞ³Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ‡ĞºĞ¸ Ğ·Ñ€ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ, Ğ° Ñ‚Ğ°ĞºĞ¶Ğµ Ğ¼Ñ‹ Ğ²Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²ÑŒ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ²ÑÑ‚Ñ€ĞµÑ‡Ğ°ĞµĞ¼ Ñ‡ĞµĞ»Ğ¾Ğ²ĞµĞºĞ°-Ğ·Ğ°Ğ³Ğ°Ğ´ĞºÑƒ G-Man'Ğ° ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ¼ĞµÑ‚ Ğ½ĞµĞ¿Ğ¾ÑĞ»ĞµĞ´Ğ½ĞµĞµ ÑƒÑ‡Ğ°ÑÑ‚Ğ¸Ğµ Ğ² ÑÑƒĞ´ÑŒĞ±Ğµ Ğ“Ğ“ Ğ°Ğ´Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ°. ĞŸÑ€Ğ¸Ğ¼ĞµÑ‡Ğ°Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾ Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ ĞµÑĞ»Ğ¸ Ğ¼Ñ‹ Ğ¿Ğ¾ÑĞ»ĞµĞ´ÑƒĞµĞ¼ Ñ Ğ¤Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ² Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ¸Ğ· Ğ³Ğ»Ğ°Ğ², Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ğ¾ÑĞ»Ğµ Ğ¿Ñ€Ñ‹Ğ¶ĞºĞ° Ğ² Ğ¿Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‚Ğ°Ğ» ÑĞ»ĞµĞ´Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ²Ñ‹ ÑƒĞ¿Ğ°Ğ´ĞµÑ‚Ğµ, Ğ° Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ° Ğ·Ğ°ĞºĞ¾Ğ½Ñ‡Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒÑÑ Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ñ€ÑƒĞ³Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ Ğ²Ğ°Ñ, Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ²Ñ‹ Ğ¿Ğ¾ÑĞ¼ĞµĞ»Ğ¸ ÑƒÑÑ‚Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ²Ñ€ĞµĞ¼ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ¿Ğ°Ñ€Ğ°Ğ´Ğ¾ĞºÑ.

Ğ“ĞµĞ¹Ğ¼Ğ¿Ğ»ĞµĞ¹ - ĞÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ»ÑÑ Ñ‚Ğ°ĞºĞ¸Ğ¼ ĞºĞ°Ğº Ğ² Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ³Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ°Ğ»Ğµ, Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒĞºĞ¾ Ğ¾Ğ½ Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ¼ ĞºĞ¾Ğ½Ñ‚ĞµĞ½Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ½ Ğ¸ Ğ·Ğ°Ğ¼ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ğ“Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ° Ğ¼Ñ‹ Ğ¨ĞµĞ¿Ğ°Ñ€Ğ´ Ğ¾Ğ´ĞµÑ‚Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ² PCV-Ğ±Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ½ĞµĞ¶Ğ¸Ğ»ĞµÑ‚, Ğ°Ğ½Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¸Ñ‡Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ HEV Ğ¸ Ñ‚Ğ°ĞºĞ¶Ğµ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶ĞµÑ‚ Ğ·Ğ°Ñ€ÑĞ¶Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒÑÑ Ğ¾Ñ‚ Ğ¿Ğ°Ğ½ĞµĞ»ĞµĞ¹ Ğ§ĞµÑ€Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¹ ĞœĞµĞ·Ñ‹, Ğ¸ Ğ²Ğ¼ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ñ„Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ°Ñ€Ğ¸ĞºĞ° Ñƒ Ğ½Ğ°Ñ Ğ½Ğ¾Ñ‡Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ·Ğ¾Ñ€. Ğ”Ğ° Ğ¸ Ğ°Ğ´Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ½ Ğ¿Ğ¾ Ğ¾Ñ‰ÑƒÑ‰ĞµĞ½Ğ¸ÑĞ¼ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ÑÑ Ğ·Ğ°Ğ¼ĞµÑ‚Ğ½Ğ¾ ÑĞ»Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ½ĞµĞµ, Ñ‚Ğ°Ğº ĞºĞ°Ğº Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ñ‹Ğµ Ğ²Ñ€Ğ°Ğ³Ğ¸ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾ Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ°ÑĞ½Ñ‹ Ğ¸ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ³ÑƒÑ‚ Ğ±Ñ‹ÑÑ‚Ñ€Ğ¾ ÑƒĞ±Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ´Ğ°Ğ¶Ğµ Ğ½Ğ° ÑÑ€ĞµĞ´Ğ½ĞµĞ¹.
ĞÑ€ÑĞµĞ½Ğ°Ğ» Ñ‚ÑƒÑ‚ Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ»Ğ¸Ñ‡Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ÑÑ Ğ¸ Ğ²Ğ¼ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ½Ñ‚Ğ¸Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ²ĞºĞ¸ Ñƒ Ğ½Ğ°Ñ Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¹ ĞºĞ»ÑÑ‡ (Ğ•Ñ‰Ğµ Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ¸Ğº) Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ¼Ğ¸Ğ¼Ğ¾ Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ‹Ñ‡Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ½ĞµÑÑ‚Ñ€ĞµĞ»Ğ° Ğ²Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ´Ğµ Ğ¿Ğ¸ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ»ĞµÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ², Ğ´Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¸ĞºĞ¾Ğ² Ğ¸ Ğ°Ğ²Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ², Ñƒ Ğ½Ğ°Ñ ĞµÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ĞµĞ¿Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‚-Ğ¿ÑƒÑˆĞºĞ° ÑĞ¿Ğ¾ÑĞ¾Ğ±Ğ½Ğ°Ñ Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ½ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ¸ Ğ½Ğ°Ñ Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ¸ Ğ²Ñ€Ğ°Ğ³Ğ¾Ğ² Ğ² Ğ—ĞµĞ½ Ğ¸ Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ½Ğ¾, Ğ° Ğ¸Ğ· Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ»Ğ°Ğ½ĞµÑ‚Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ ĞµÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ñ€ÑƒÑ‡Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ±Ğ°Ñ€Ğ½Ğ°ĞºĞ» Ğ´Ğ»Ñ Ğ·Ğ°Ğ±Ğ¸Ñ€Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ Ğ½Ğ° Ğ²Ñ‹ÑĞ¾ĞºĞ¸Ğµ Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ‡ĞºĞ¸ Ğ¸ ÑĞ¿Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¼Ñ‘Ñ‚ ÑÑ‚Ñ€ĞµĞ»ÑÑÑ‰Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ğ²Ğ·Ñ€Ñ‹Ğ²Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¼Ğ¸ Ñ„Ñ€ÑƒĞºÑ‚Ğ°Ğ¼Ğ¸.
Ğ‘ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ¸Ğ°Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ¼Ğ¸Ğ¼Ğ¾ ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ñ€Ñ‹Ñ… Ğ·Ğ½Ğ°ĞºĞ¾Ğ¼Ñ‹Ñ… Ğ²Ñ€Ğ°Ğ³Ğ¾Ğ² Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ»ÑÑ ĞµÑ‰Ğµ Ğ´Ğ²ÑƒĞ¼Ñ Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ´Ğ°Ğ¼Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ½Ğ¸ĞºĞ¾Ğ², Ğ° Ğ¸Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ Ğ°ÑĞ° Ğ˜ĞºÑ Ğ¿Ğ¾ÑĞ²Ğ»ÑÑ‰Ğ¸ĞµÑÑ Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒĞºĞ¾ Ğ² ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ°Ğ´Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¸ Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ¸ Ğ²Ñ€Ğ°Ğ¶Ğ´ĞµĞ±Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğ°ÑÑ‚Ñ€Ğ¾ĞµĞ½Ñ‹, ĞºĞ°Ğº Ğº Ğ»ÑĞ´ÑĞ¼, Ñ‚Ğ°Ğº Ğº Ñ‚Ğ²Ğ°Ñ€ÑĞ¼ Ğ¸Ğ· Ğ—ĞµĞ½Ğ° Ğ¿Ğ¾ Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ¿Ñƒ ÑˆĞ¾ĞºĞ¾Ğ²Ñ‹Ñ… ÑĞ¾Ğ»Ğ´Ğ°Ñ‚, Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ»Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ³Ğ¾Ñ€, Ğ¿ĞµÑ‰ĞµÑ€Ğ½Ñ‹Ñ… Ñ‚Ñ€ÑƒÑ‚Ğ½ĞµĞ¹ Ğ¸ Ñ‚.Ğ¿. Ğ˜ Ñ‡Ñ‘Ñ€Ğ½Ñ‹Ğµ Ğ¾Ğ¿ĞµÑ€Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ½Ğ¸ĞºĞ¸, Ğ»Ğ¸ĞºĞ²Ğ¸Ğ´Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‹ Ğ² ĞºĞ²Ğ°Ğ´Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‚Ğµ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ±Ñ‹Ğ²ÑˆĞ¸Ğµ ÑƒĞ¶Ğµ ÑƒĞ±Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ñ‚ĞºĞ¸ HECU Ğ¸ ÑƒĞ½Ğ¸Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ ÑĞ°Ğ¼Ñƒ ĞœĞµĞ·Ñƒ. Ğ¢Ğ°ĞºĞ¶Ğµ Ñƒ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ ĞµÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ¼ÑƒĞ»ÑŒÑ‚Ğ¸Ğ¿Ğ»ĞµĞµÑ€, Ğ¾Ğ½ Ñ‚Ğ°ĞºĞ¾Ğ¹ Ğ¶Ğµ ĞºĞ°Ğº Ğ² Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ³Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ°Ğ»Ğµ, Ğ½Ğ¾ Ñ Ğ°Ñ€ÑĞµĞ½Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ¸ Ğ¼ĞµÑ…Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸ĞºĞ°Ğ¼Ğ¸ Ğ¸Ğ· Opposing Force. furLaNâ­’
109 produits enregistrÃ©s

13 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
8.9 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 5 mars 2016
You know that this contribution to the Half-Life legacy isn't gonna be TOO serious when your opening cut scene features a military dude doing an R. Lee Ermey impersonation, right before he gets unceremoniously sucked out of an airplane. It IS official Valve product, though, so while it's one of the "lighter" - and arguably less "essential" - forays into the Half-Life universe, it's still a very high-quality product by the standards of not only first-person shooters, but indeed video games as a whole. Sure it's dated more than a tad - especially graphics and sound-wise - but the gameplay is still very much there, and the story ain't half-bad neither. The word "solid" definitely comes to mind...and then some.

Maybe not the best place to start your FPS training - that'd be more like Half-Life itself, dare I say! - but obviously highly recommended to fans of the original who crave more. It delivers, plain-and-simple, in a way which a far more recent "mod" like Wilson Chronicles - look it up (no, wait, don't bother) - does not. Clever mapping, light-yet-interesting puzzles, crazy weaponry and gadgets, satisfying combat...it's all here. An absolute steal at five dollars, really...

Verdict: 9.5/10.
 
rjmacready

ĞŸĞµÑ€Ğ²Ğ¾Ğµ ÑĞ°Ğ¼Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ÑÑ‚ĞµĞ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾Ğµ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğµ Ğ´Ğ»Ñ Ğ¿ĞµÑ€Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ¹ Half-Life. Ğ£Ğ¶Ğµ Ğ² Ğ¾Ğ±ÑƒÑ‡ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğ¸ (ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğµ ĞºÑÑ‚Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¸ ÑĞ¾Ğ²ĞµÑ€ÑˆĞµĞ½Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ğµ) Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ·Ğ°Ğ¼ĞµÑ‚Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ½ĞµĞ¿Ğ»Ğ¾Ñ…Ğ¸Ğµ Ñ„Ğ¸Ğ·Ğ¸Ñ‡ĞµÑĞºĞ¸Ğµ ĞºĞ°Ğ½Ğ°Ñ‚Ñ‹, Ğ¿Ğ¾ ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‹Ğ¼ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ»ĞµĞ·Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ²Ğ²ĞµÑ€Ñ… Ğ¸ Ğ²Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ·, Ğ° Ñ‚Ğ°Ğº Ğ¶Ğµ Ğ¿Ñ€Ñ‹Ğ³Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ¿Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ¼ ĞºĞ°Ğº Ğ¾Ğ±ĞµĞ·ÑŒÑĞ½. Ğ ĞµĞ°Ğ»Ğ¸Ğ·Ğ°Ñ†Ğ¸Ñ Ñ€Ğ°ÑĞºĞ°Ñ‡ĞºĞ¸ Ğ½Ğ° ĞºĞ°Ğ½Ğ°Ñ‚Ğµ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¾Ñ‡ĞµĞ½ÑŒ Ñ…Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾ÑˆĞ°, Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğº ÑÑ‡Ğ°ÑÑ‚ÑŒÑ Ğ² ÑĞ°Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğµ Ğ¸Ñ… Ğ¿Ğ¾Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¸ Ğ¸ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ´ĞµÑ‚ÑÑ Ğ¸ÑĞ¿Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒĞ·Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ. Ğ—Ğ°Ğ²ĞµĞ·Ğ»Ğ¸ Ğ¸ Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ñ‹Ğµ Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ¿Ñ‹ Ğ²Ğ¾ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ñ…, Ğ¼ĞµĞ´Ğ¸ĞºĞ° Ğ¸ ÑĞ²Ğ°Ñ€Ñ‰Ğ¸ĞºĞ°. ĞœĞµĞ´Ğ¸Ğº Ğ»ĞµÑ‡Ğ¸Ñ‚ ÑĞ²Ğ°Ñ€Ñ‰Ğ¸ĞºĞ°, Ğ° Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ‚ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ Ğ´Ğ²ĞµÑ€ÑŒ. ĞŸĞ¾Ğ»ÑƒÑ‡Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ°ÑÑŒ ÑÑ‚Ğ°ĞºĞ°Ñ Ğ·Ğ°Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ğ° ÑƒÑ‡ĞµĞ½Ñ‹Ñ…/Ğ¾Ñ…Ñ€Ğ°Ğ½Ğ½Ğ¸ĞºĞ¾Ğ².
Ğ Ğ°Ğ· ÑƒĞ¶ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ° Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾ Ğ²Ğ¾ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾, Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ¸ Ğ²ÑÑĞºĞ¾Ğ¹ Ñ„Ğ¸Ğ³Ğ½Ğ¸ Ğ²Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ´Ğµ Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ´Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ¶ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ ÑÑ‰Ğ¸ĞºĞ¾Ğ² Ñ‚ÑƒÑ‚ Ğ¿Ğ¾ Ğ¼Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ¼ÑƒĞ¼Ñƒ. Ğ—Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¾, Ğ¿Ğ¾ Ğ¼Ğ°ĞºÑĞ¸Ğ¼ÑƒĞ¼Ñƒ Ñ‚ÑƒÑ‚ ÑÑ‚Ñ€ĞµĞ»ÑŒĞ±Ğ°. ĞœĞ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ñ‹Ñ… Ğ²Ñ€Ğ°Ğ³Ğ¾Ğ², Ğ¼Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ¾Ñ€ÑƒĞ¶Ğ¸Ñ. Ğ”Ğ°Ğ¶Ğµ ĞºĞ¾Ğ»-Ğ²Ğ¾ Ğ²Ñ€Ğ°Ğ³Ğ¾Ğ² Ğ¸ ÑĞ»Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ÑÑ‚ÑŒ ÑƒĞ²ĞµĞ»Ğ¸Ñ‡Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ¸ÑÑŒ. Ğ˜ Ğ»Ğ¾ĞºĞ°Ñ†Ğ¸Ğ¸ Ğ·Ğ´ĞµÑÑŒ ĞºÑƒĞ´Ğ° Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ°Ñ‡Ğµ ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¸. ĞœĞ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¸Ğµ Ğ½Ğµ ÑÑ‡Ğ¸Ñ‚Ğ°ÑÑ‚ OpFor ĞºĞ°Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¼, Ñ…Ğ¾Ñ‚Ñ Blue Shift Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ‹Ñ‡Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ² ĞºĞ°Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ½Ğµ, ĞºĞ°Ğº Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ°Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ¾ (Ğ½Ñƒ Ñ‚Ğ°Ğ¼ Ğ¶Ğµ ĞšĞ°Ğ»Ñ…ÑƒĞ½, Ğ·Ğ½Ğ°Ñ‡Ğ¸Ñ‚ ĞºĞ°Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ½ Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ¿Ğ°, Ğ° OpFor Ğ²Ğ¾Ñ‚ Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸ÑˆĞµĞ»ĞµĞ½Ñ†ĞµĞ² Ğ·Ğ°Ğ²ĞµĞ·, ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‹Ñ… Ğ½Ğµ Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ´ĞµĞ» Ğ¤Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ¼ĞµĞ½. Ğ‘Ğ£Ğ›Ğ©Ğ˜Ğ¢ ĞĞ• ĞšĞ ĞšĞ ĞĞĞ!). ĞĞ¾ Ğ²ĞµĞ´ÑŒ OpFor Ñ…Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾ÑˆĞ¾ Ğ´ĞµĞ¼Ğ¾Ğ½ÑÑ‚Ñ€Ğ¸Ñ€ÑƒĞµÑ‚, Ğ² ĞºĞ°ĞºĞ¾Ğ¼ Ğ¾Ñ‚Ñ€ĞµĞ·ĞºĞµ Ğ²Ñ€ĞµĞ¼ĞµĞ½Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ…Ğ¾Ğ´ÑÑ‚ Ñ‚ĞµĞºÑƒÑ‰Ğ¸Ğµ ÑĞ¾Ğ±Ñ‹Ñ‚Ğ¸Ñ, Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ½Ğ¾ÑĞ¸Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾ ÑĞ¾Ğ±Ñ‹Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ³Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ HL. Ğ Ğ°ÑÑƒ Ğ¥ Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğµ Ğ¸ÑÑĞ»ĞµĞ´Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¸, ĞºĞ°Ğº Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ñ€ĞµĞ´ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ²Ğ¸Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ĞµĞ¹ Ğ—ĞµĞ½Ğ° ĞµÑ‰Ğµ Ğ´Ğ¾ ĞºĞ°ÑĞºĞ°Ğ´Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ñ€ĞµĞ·Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ°Ğ½ÑĞ°. Ğ”Ğ¾ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğµ Ñ‚Ñ€ÑƒĞ´Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ°Ğ´Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ÑÑ Ğ² Ğ»Ğ°Ğ±Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ¸ ÑĞ¾ ÑĞ¿Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¼ĞµÑ‚Ğ°Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ÑĞ¼Ğ¸, Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ´Ğ° ĞºÑÑ‚Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¸ Ğ³Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ³Ñ€Ğ°Ğ¼Ğ¼Ğ° Ñ€Ğ°ÑÑĞºĞ°Ğ·Ñ‹Ğ²Ğ°ĞµÑ‚, Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ ÑĞ¿Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¼ĞµÑ‚Ğ°Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ÑŒ (Ğ¾Ñ€ÑƒĞ¶Ğ¸Ğµ) ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ñ€Ğ°Ğ½Ğ½ÑÑ Ğ²ĞµÑ€ÑĞ¸Ñ Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ğ²Ğ¸Ñ‚Ğ¸Ñ ÑˆĞ¾ĞºĞ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ ÑĞ¾Ğ»Ğ´Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ°. + VocÃª tem novas armas, sendo elas, Chave inglesa, Faca de Combate, Barnacle, Desert Eagle, M249(uma metralhadora), Displacer Cannon(CanhÃ£o de deslocamento), M40A1(Rifle de Sniper), LanÃ§ador de Esporos(Spore Launcher), e a Barata de choque (Chock Roach)

+ VocÃª tem novos inimigos, sendo eles, Black Ops Masculino(no original vocÃª sÃ³ enfrenta a feminina), Gonome("Consegue imiginar como Ã© o prÃ³ximo estado de MutaÃ§Ã£o?" - Cientista), Pit Drone, Shock Trooper, e o Voltigore(Quase um boss)

- A campanha Ã© menor em comparaÃ§Ã£o ao Half-Life

Bubble Daryl
0
24 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
13 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation amusante
0
RecommandÃ©
7.5 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 11 fÃ©vrier 2015
This was almost as engrossing as Half-Life actually was. Of course, you can't beat God (Half-Life, in this case) if you're an angel (OF), God is God for a reason! And that's the stupidest analogy I've ever made up, but bear with me, games like Opposing Force are never easy to make justice in words. But what I mean is, even though this game can't beat Half-Life, it was incredible. I'm not going to lie; I found certain things a tiny, tiny tiny tiny bit more "WOOOAAHHH" than Half-Life, but y'know... HALF-LIFE, MAN.

Something that amazed me from the game is the fact I was actually busting my ass to save every grunt I encountered. I loathed these bastards in Half-Life and Blue Shift; I mean, they killed the poor scientists/security guards and actually enjoyed it! It was so sad! And I'm so used to killing them that every time I encountered a group of HECU marines, I'd panic and start shooting them. Then I'd be like "Oh. Right", and pressed the F9 key (my reload last save). At first I didn't mind and let them die, but dammit, they grew on me, to the point I'd truly be attempting to save them. I just felt fond of them. Except for the grunt that pushes the scientist when he's asking for Freeman when you're about to board the Osprey in which you're supposed to escape. That grunt I killed. ALSO, TWO GRUNTS ABANDONED ME IN CHAPTER 11 (The Package). I WENT TO EXPLORE A ROOM AND WHEN I GOT OUT THEY JUST DISAPPEARED. â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥.

Getting more serious now, something that really impressed me from Opposing Force besides the guns, the Race X and the new "puzzles", was the large-scale battles you can have at times. If you take care of your squad, you can have a group of at least four grunts with you. So when you encounter a lot of enemies, the fights are phenomenal! Sadly, this only happened once to me, I was barely able to get three grunts to follow me most of the time because some grunts were just too stubborn and stupid to follow me. This is the strongest flaw I encountered in the game; the grunts' AI is really stupid in the vast majority of the time. And they were also generally pretty useless in battle, and I'm not even counting the times I died because of friendly fire. However, there was one time in which I was able to have an epic Black Ops-Shock Troopers-HECU battle. Replayed it about four times just to repeat the breathtaking sequence. Unfortunately, it was hard to achieve and generally I spent too much time in the game trying to get everyone to follow me, which is simply precious game-time wasted. This is quite disappointing, in my opinion, since the rest of the game is of such extreme quality.

Being someone who's mostly played modern games, I have to say Opposing Force (as well as HL and BS) looks really good and its graphics are not bad at all for being a nearly twenty year old game. And even if the graphics were terrible (they're decent, in my opinion), the game would make up for it with its fantastic atmosphere, gameplay, battles, bosses, guns, ambiance and so forth. I also adored Gordon's direct and indirect appearances; his "employee of the month" photograph (was that his office?), his constant mention by the grunts and finally his Chapter 6 ("We Are Not Alone") direct appearance: where you actually see him. I seriously replayed that sequence seven times. I LOVE WHEN GAMES CONNECT WITH EACH OTHER SO DIRECTLY. Thinking that while you're still fighting your way through Black Mesa, Gordon is beating the crap out of Gonarch and everyone (or everything?) else. Opposing Force is, quite simply, a passionate application of creative design. I seriously cannot wait for Tripmine Studios' remake.

Definitely recommend the game. But as I also said on my BS review; only play it if you have played Half-Life. Otherwise, the game might feel dull to you and you won't understand the storyline, and won't be able to fan-girl over Gordon's appearances/mentions... well... if you're a crazy fan. Like me.
 
Terpsichora
1

21 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation amusante

-otis
-he likes donuts and candies
-hes funny
-otis
-hes actually big boned, not fat
-oh he found the quarter
-was actually a wuss at school, yeah its hard to believe
-doent like machines (they dont work >:( )
-donuts
-always wanted to say medic
-would love to hang out over his fireplace, yknow, if he had one
-mmm, candy
-OTIS

Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 22 juillet 2020
Honestly, I like Half-Life: Opposing Force better than the original Half-Life.
Pros:
- the pacing is better
- the weapons are better (even if the alien weapons were introduced in a lazy - albeit realistic - way)
- ropes and military teammates are a great addition, even if the rope physics is atrocious and the AI of the teammates is sub-par
- the story expanded on the lore of the original Half-Life pretty well
- Otis is a better NPC than Barney.
- There were some nice touches - I love that when you use the Xen gun while on Xen (when you first get it) it send you to the tutorial room from the original Half-Life.
- The boot-camp tutorial level is awesome! If you play it definitely do the tutorial.
â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥:
- the previously mentioned rope physics and teammate AI
- you have to go into the settings to fix the mouse, it's a bit buggy at first
- G-man looks different I think; he looks like Quentin Tarantino tbh

Definitely play this nice expansion if you enjoyed the original Half-Life.

Era para ser sÃ³ mais uma missÃ£o militar

Opposing Force Ã© a primeira expansÃ£o do Half Life 1. Nele, vocÃª volta Ã  Black Mesa, mas nÃ£o em acontecimentos posteriores, a estÃ³ria se passa paralelamente aos acontecimentos do Half Life 1, ou seja, os acontecimentos passam-se ao mesmo tempo dos acontecimentos do Half Life 1. VocÃª atÃ© vÃª o Freeman fazendo coisas que vocÃª fez no Half Life 1, isso Ã© muito divertido e nostÃ¡lgico.

Essa expansÃ£o, ao contrÃ¡rio de Blue Shift, possui o modo Multiplayer.


VocÃª serÃ¡ o antigo inimigo

A diferenÃ§a estÃ¡ no tipo de personagem que o jogador vai encarnar. No Half 1, vocÃª lutava contra muitos inimigos, entre eles estavam os soldados do ExÃ©rcito. Agora, vocÃª serÃ¡ um desses soldados (Adrian Shepard) que perseguem Gordon Freeman. A sua missÃ£o serÃ¡ exterminar Freeman, mas haverÃ¡ muitos inimigos no meio caminho, como os alienÃ­genas.

Enredo

Sabemos (para quem jogou Half 1) que um grupo militar foi mandado Ã  Black Mesa com a missÃ£o, dentre outras, de matar Freeman e os cientistas. Em Opposing Force, vocÃª serÃ¡ Adrian Shepard, um dos soldados Hecu, que deverÃ¡ eliminar Freeman e os cientistas.

Contudo, o helicÃ³ptero em que vocÃª e seus colegas estavam Ã© atingido, separando e desorganizando o grupo militar em meio ao complexo da Black Mesa. DaÃ­ por diante, vocÃª passarÃ¡ por muitos problemas e enfrentarÃ¡ diversos inimigos. Para mim, um momento marcante Ã© quando aparece um grupo de soldados vestidos de preto com intuito de eliminar os cientistas e a primeira equipe enviada.

"Sacanagem. Contrataram meu grupo de extermÃ­nio para acabar com os cientistas e depois contrataram outro grupo de extermÃ­nio para matar o meu grupo. AÃ­ nÃ£o pÃ´."


Velhas caracterÃ­sticas

No bom estilo Half Life, vocÃª vai encontrar diversos personagens que irÃ£o ajudÃ¡-lo a passar por alguns obstÃ¡culos durante o caminho.
VocÃª passarÃ¡ novamente pela Black Mesa, mas principalmente em Ã¡reas antes nÃ£o exploradas.


Novidades

Apesar de voltar para Black Mesa e reviver os acontecimentos na mesma linha paralela de Half Life 1, em Opposing Force, hÃ¡ algumas novidades, como novos monstros -mais fortes-, armas e uma visÃ£o noturna (Night vision googles) substituindo a tradicional lanterna.


Night vision googles

Quando aperta-se F, o personagem usa o Ã³culos de visÃ£o noturna, o Night vision googles, que substitui a tradicional lanterna. Esse possui uma bateria com muita carga, pois demora muito para esgotar a energia e demora pouco para carregar. O legal Ã© que esse Ã³culos Ã© extremamente Ãºtil, atÃ© mais que a lanterna, pois com ele vocÃª visualiza todo o ambiente, e nÃ£o apenas parte dele como ocorre com a lanterna.

Veja a diferenÃ§a do ambiente normal e com o uso da visÃ£o noturna:

No Opposing Force, hÃ¡ inimigos que nem com 3 disparos de shotgun morrem, e olha que nÃ£o estou falando de chefes hein.
Para piorar, hÃ¡ um grupo de mercenÃ¡rios com roupas negras, que sÃ£o rÃ¡pidos e trabalham muito bem em equipe. Aquele mesmo grupo que aparecia no Half 1, mas no Opposing Force eles aparecem em maior nÃºmero.

Modo online

Half Life possui um modo online, que Ã© o deathmatch, o qual consiste em mata-mata apenas. Foi divertido, principalmente na Ã©poca. PorÃ©m, com Team Fortress e Counter, esse estilo fica um pouco ultrapassado. ReconheÃ§o isso apesar de gostar do modo deathmatch.

Cheguei a jogar esse modo online aqui na Steam, mas infelizmente hÃ¡ servidores com no mÃ¡ximo 6 pessoas :(

Pontos marcantes
  • Retorno ao laboratÃ³rio em Black Mesa, mas dessa vez como um soldado.
  • Um novo arsenal de armas, algumas com mecanismos alienÃ­genas.
  • Encontros com Freeman e G-man (Filho da p...)

Ao meu ver. vale muito a pena vocÃª jogar esse Opposing Force. Se vocÃª jogou o Half Life 1 e gostou, tem que jogar esse.

Half-Life: Opposing Force Ğ¿Ñ€ĞµĞ´ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ²Ğ»ÑĞµÑ‚ ÑĞ¾Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ»Ğ¸Ñ‡Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ°Ğ´Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ½ Ğº HL, ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ·Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ»ÑĞµÑ‚ Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¼ Ğ¾Ñ‡ÑƒÑ‚Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒÑÑ Ğ¿Ğ¾ Ğ´Ñ€ÑƒĞ³ÑƒÑ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ½Ñƒ Ğ±Ğ°Ñ€Ñ€Ğ¸ĞºĞ°Ğ´ Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ·Ğ° ÑĞ¿ĞµÑ†Ğ½Ğ°Ğ·Ğ¾Ğ²Ñ†Ğ° Ğ¨ĞµĞ¿Ğ°Ñ€Ğ´Ğ°, Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ±Ñ‹Ğ²ÑˆĞµĞ³Ğ¾ Ğ´Ğ»Ñ ÑƒÑÑ‚Ñ€Ğ°Ğ½ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ Ğ¤Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ğ°.

ĞĞ¾ Ğ²ÑĞµ, ĞºĞ°Ğº Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ‹Ñ‡Ğ½Ğ¾, Ğ¸Ğ´ĞµÑ‚ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¿Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ğ»Ğ°Ğ½Ñƒ, Ğ¸ Ğ¼Ñ‹ Ğ·Ğ°Ğ±Ğ¸Ğ² Ğ½Ğ° Ğ¾ÑĞ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ½Ğ¾Ğµ Ğ·Ğ°Ğ´Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸Ğµ Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ½ÑƒĞ¶Ğ´ĞµĞ½Ñ‹ ÑĞ¿Ğ°ÑĞ°Ñ‚ÑŒ ÑĞ²Ğ¾Ñ Ğ·Ğ°Ğ´Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ†Ñƒ Ğ¾Ñ‚ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸ÑˆĞµĞ»ÑŒÑ†ĞµĞ² Ğ¸ Ğ¾Ğ¿ĞµÑ€Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ½Ğ¸ĞºĞ¾Ğ². ĞÑ‚Ğ´ĞµĞ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¸Ñ‚ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ±Ğ»Ğ°Ğ³Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ°Ñ€Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ³ĞµĞ¹Ğ¼-Ğ´Ğ¸Ğ·Ğ°Ğ¹Ğ½ĞµÑ€Ğ¾Ğ², ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‹Ğµ Ğ¿Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ñ€Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¸ÑÑŒ Ğ½Ğ° ÑĞ»Ğ°Ğ²Ñƒ. Ğ£Ğ´Ğ°Ñ‡Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ°Ğ±Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ°Ğ½Ñ‹ ÑĞºÑ€Ğ¸Ğ¿Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ²Ñ‹Ğµ ÑÑ†ĞµĞ½Ñ‹, Ğ¼Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ¾Ñ€ÑƒĞ¶Ğ¸Ñ (Ñ‡ĞµĞ³Ğ¾ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¸Ñ‚ Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒĞºĞ¾ Ğ¡Ğ¿Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¼ĞµÑ‚Ğ°Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ÑŒ:)) Ğ¸ Ğ²Ñ€Ğ°Ğ³Ğ¾Ğ², Ğ° Ñ‚Ğ°ĞºĞ¶Ğµ Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¿Ğ°Ñ€Ğ½Ğ¸ĞºĞ¸, ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‹Ğµ Ğ²Ğ¼ĞµÑÑ‚Ğµ Ñ Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¼Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ñ‹Ñ‚Ğ°ÑÑ‚ÑÑ Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ¶Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ² ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ°Ğ´Ñƒ.

Ğ’ Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ‰ĞµĞ¼ Ğ¸ Ñ†ĞµĞ»Ğ¾Ğ¼, ĞµÑĞ»Ğ¸ Ğ²Ğ°Ğ¼ Ğ¿Ğ¾ Ğ´ÑƒÑˆĞµ HL, Ñ‚Ğ¾ HL:OF Ğ·Ğ°Ñ†ĞµĞ¿Ğ¸Ñ‚ Ğ²Ğ°Ñ Ğ¾Ğ±ÑĞ·Ğ°Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾.

9 Ğ¸Ğ½ÑÑ‚Ñ€ÑƒĞºÑ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ² Ğ‘Ğ°Ñ€Ğ½ÑĞ¾Ğ² Ğ¸Ğ· 10.
 
johanpo

12 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile

RecommandÃ©
3.8 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 27 mai 2016
Half-Life: Opposing Force is an awesome expansion pack to the original Half-Life, but this time from the point of view of a Marine named Cpl. Adrian Shepard. The events in this game run parallel to the original so it's great to see how the other storylines unfold from a different perspective. There are a load of new weapons added and also a few new enemies to encounter. At times you will also have a squad to help you out which really gives gives the feel for some epic battles when it's your squad versus a horde of monsters. If you're itching for more Half-Life then this is a must play and is an awesome addition to Half-Life series.
 
BrutolMotent
0

Renka
1,750 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
16 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
4.2 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 9 mars 2014
Honestly, it IS incredible.
Now I remember HL1 when it has only come out and it was splendid. It looked so detailed back there, so long, filled with puzzles and crazy stuff.
As far as I remember, when HL Opposing Force came out, it was also praised as an awesome and one hell of an Add-on (yeah no freaking DLCs back there). I remember, I was using cheats since HL was hard (and it still is) and I simply couldn't pass through it otherwise.

Now I've finished it honestly with only my skill alone, or should I say.. Survived it. With a constant save/load, trying to stuck as much of the little HP given as possible, using up ALL of the weapons, tools and explosives given, and Honestly, after years of modern shooters with, you know Health Regen, Dumb AI that's standing still and shooting after a huge pause, linear gaming and a hell lot of ammo on round I'm voting for that era of FPS games to be back here.

Forget the graphics I was SO concentrated on the action, simply sucked into game, I really couldn't stop. For the first time in YEARS I have finally had challenge, and if you, my friend is still willing to have challenge in the one genre that puts your reflexes and aim to the test, you HAVE to fight through this game. You can either realize what it trully means an old-school way of making FPS games, or you might remind yourself of that wonderful era, when we were really proud of ourselves to get to the title in the end where you sit there relaxed and realizing it's over. No wonder modern FPS can't possibly make you feel the thrill, they don't have the guts for this.
 
Operator Sandwich

RecommandÃ©
13.3 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 26 juin 2020
Adrian Shepard is a real badass and why you may ask? Find it out for yourself in this little expansion pack for Half Life 1. You take control of an H.E.C.U marine in the middle of an mission (Bootcamp exists but yeah) but something goes horribly wrong and you are stranded in an Alien infested Black Mesa trying to escape. But since you crashed too early, you don't know what your mission here is so...Will you cooperate with The Black Mesa personnel or will you cold heartedly murder them all? It's your time to choose....

145 produits enregistrÃ©s

15 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
2 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation amusante
0
RecommandÃ©
6.5 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 16 mai 2020
A vastly more interesting side-adventure than Blue Shift. Whereas that was largely just "more HL1", Opposing Force attempts new things: new weapons, new game mechanics, new environments, and new enemies all within the framework of the Black Mesa incident.

Unfortunately neither of these expansions are considered canon as far as Half-Life 2 is concerned (and beyond). Don't let that stop you, though. It's definitely worth a go.

But do follow the advice given to me: play Blue Shift first. Because if you go from OpFor to Blue Shift, you'll be severely disappointed. Let Blue Shift stand on it's own before you get the real deal of OpFor.
 
Dr. Fortyseven

Ğ’ Ñ†ĞµĞ»Ğ¾Ğ¼, Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»ÑƒÑ‡Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ¾ÑÑŒ Ğ²ÑÑ‘ Ğ¸Ğ½Ñ‚ĞµÑ€ĞµÑĞ½Ğ¾, Ğ¿Ğ¾ÑĞ²Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ¸ÑÑŒ Ğ½ĞµĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‹Ğµ Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ñ‹Ğµ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ²Ñ‹Ğµ Ğ¼ĞµÑ…Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸ĞºĞ¸, Ğ° Ñ‚Ğ°ĞºĞ¶Ğµ Ğ¼Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¶ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ñ‹Ñ… Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ² Ğ¾Ñ€ÑƒĞ¶Ğ¸Ñ Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ½Ğ¸ĞºĞ¾Ğ².

Half-Life Opposing Force:AnÃ¡lisis
Opposing Force es un juego oficial creado por Valve y Gearbox Software.
Se estrenÃ³ a finales de (1999) y es una expansiÃ³n del inolvidable videojuego de (1998) Half-Life aunque tambiÃ©n se puede considerar un Spin-Off. En esta expansiÃ³n por asÃ­ decirlo seremos el malo, esta vez en el cuerpo enemigo de Gordon Freeman, las fuerzas HECU, en la expansiÃ³n tenemos como personaje principal al cabo Adrian Shepard en donde la historia sucede al mismo tiempo que â™¥â™¥â™¥ Half-Life mientras Gordon vive su aventura en Black Mesa nosotros llegamos a las instalaciones â™¥â™¥â™¥ el objeto principal como todos los Militares de HECU, limpiar Black Mesa, matar a todos los alienÃ­genas de Xen posibles y al mismo tiempo acabar â™¥â™¥â™¥ la vida de los sobrevivientes de las instalaciones para que no haya ningÃºn testigo y dejando Black-Mesa como algo desconocido... TambiÃ©n mencionÃ³ que intentan detener a Gordon Freeman de una vez por todas pero siendo todo inÃºtil obviamente, sin embargo al llegar a Black-Mesa seremos atacados por los alienÃ­genas de Xen donde seremos el Ãºnico sobreviviente de la tripulaciÃ³n, nuestra aventura comienza justo en ese accidente donde nos adentraremos mÃ¡s a fondo en las instalaciones de Black-Mesa....

Lo bueno:
Historia:El juego no tiene una gran historia o arco argumental como el primer juego de Valve, tiene una trama sencilla y que ya la habÃ­amos visto en Half-Life (1998) pero no vamos a â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ que el desarrollo de la trama simple es buena. El desarrollo argumental de Opposing Force sin duda es excelente y la cual funciona de una muy buena forma, me encantan esos personajes y momentos inesperados y giros que da un poco la historia en varios momentos. âœ”

GrÃ¡ficos:Hasta el dÃ­a de hoy se sigue disfrutando los grÃ¡ficos, como ya dije eran excelente y tenÃ­an la mejor calidad posible para esa Ã©poca, la cual es 1998 y 1999 seÃ±ores, estamos hablando de esos aÃ±os, esa Ã©poca donde no existÃ­an las PC potentes de hoy en dÃ­a, donde la tecnologÃ­a no era tan sorprendente y famosa como lo es ahora, a pesar de que Opposing Force se estrenÃ³ en (1999) no muestra muchos cambios y mejoras en los grÃ¡ficos cosa que se entiende porque es una expansiÃ³n, asÃ­ que disfrutemos de ese motor grÃ¡fico que fue utilizado por Valve hasta el (2003), disfruta de los grÃ¡ficos porque para la Ã©poca era simplemente moderno y muy reconocido, Valve ya sea este o Blue Shift supo tener creatividad y aproveche al mÃ¡ximo este motor antes de la llegada de Source. âœ”

Jugabilidad:La jugabilidad es la misma solo que se sigue disfrutando y sigue siendo excelente. La jugabilidad es rÃ¡pida â™¥â™¥â™¥ muchos Puzzles, enemigos en cada esquina, deberÃ¡s hacer una estrategÃ­a al atacar si quieres salir vivo. Varias veces en el juego te quedaras â™¥â™¥â™¥ poca vida y mucha tensiÃ³n, acÃ¡ ocurre lo mismo pero mucho mÃ¡s que digamos, eso si, es un punto el tema de que ahora tengas visiÃ³n nocturna para usarla en ciertas ocasiones como tambiÃ©n una soga para algunos Puzzles, recomiendo probar el modo entrenamiento primero, como en el juego original la jugabilidad se trata de resolver Puzzles, matar y disparar, recoger municiÃ³n buscar vida y protecciÃ³n, tener una buena estrategÃ­a, continuar y etc...Como dije, es una jugabilidad excelente que no decepciona. âœ”

Sonido:El sonido es muy bueno y merece la pena escucharlo â™¥â™¥â™¥ cascos, ya que aquÃ­ sÃ­ que estÃ¡ logrado el ambiente. Las voces tanto en InglÃ©s y en EspaÃ±ol son muy buenas pero â™¥â™¥â™¥ el problema de que hablan todos a la vez y encima â™¥â™¥â™¥ el ruido de fondo como en el inicio se hace un poco complicado escucharlos a la perfecciÃ³n pero bueno. No esperes grandes cambios o mejoras en este juego comparÃ¡ndolo al Half-Life que conocemos todos. âœ”

Soundtrack:Hablando de su banda sonora, no es una maravilla o algo inolvidable que en el juego original pero funciona muy bien â™¥â™¥â™¥ lo que representa e intenta transmitir estÃ¡ expansiÃ³n, ademÃ¡s funciona bastante bien en este juego y hay canciones que mÃ¡s de una son bien logradas â™¥â™¥â™¥ ese toque militar que le queda genial. âœ”

Escenarios y lugares:QuÃ© puedo decir, hay nuevos escenarios muy buenos y bien ambientados, otros ya vistos en Half-Life, etc. Los escenarios hacen que el juego se haga mÃ¡s realista. âœ”

DuraciÃ³n:No lo veo muy corto como muchos dicen aunque eso depende de cuanto tardes en el videojuego pero para mÃ­ tiene una duraciÃ³n aceptable, ademÃ¡s de tener gran dificultad. âœ”

Lo nuevo o innovaciÃ³n:En esta expansiÃ³n se incluyen nuevas armas, algunas de los alienÃ­genas de la raza X esa, otra que sera de los Barnacle, otras de los militares que luego aparecen en el Counter Strike, etc. TambiÃ©n se encuentra nuestro cuchillo y la pistola â™¥â™¥â™¥ laser, aunque son reemplazos de las armas del juego original, se ven muy Cools, ademÃ¡s de tener cambios en sus sonidos, etc. TambiÃ©n tenemos algunos nuevos enemigos entre los cuales serÃ¡n alienÃ­genas de la Raza X y los soldados oscuros que fueron un misterio en la aventura de Freeman, acÃ¡ tienen mÃ¡s relevancia a punto de rompernos las bolas en muchas ocasiones, vale la pena mencionar a nuestros aliados los cuales nos ayudaran bastante en el juego, ya sean como parte de la trama o a veces Ãºtiles aunque â™¥â™¥â™¥ una puntera mÃ¡s mala que los niÃ±os Brazucas del CSGO pero en fin de nuevo hay varias cosas en esta expansiÃ³n y se aprecia bastante. âœ”

Referencias:Para finalizar, el Ãºltimo punto bueno son las referencias, puesto que si jugaste Half-Life, se te harÃ¡ familiar varÃ­as cosas y eso sirve para saber cronolÃ³gicamente en donde ocurre Opposing Force. Me ha gustado las referencias que se hace y ademÃ¡s tenemos un cameo de Gordon Freeman, mientras que tenemos de regreso al G-man, me gusta porque da a entender al jugador en que parte de la historia estÃ¡ en donde se siente mÃ¡s para ver que ocurre en la aventura. âœ”

Lo malo:
Multiplayer:El modo Online como extra que le puso Valve para Half-Life y sus expansiones, cagarse a tiros, todos contra todos y obtener el mejor puntaje posible antes de que el tiempo se acabe, es entretenido pero hoy en dÃ­a, Valve no le da ni cinco de pelotas al online de Opposing Force y lo mÃ¡s lamentable es que el Online estÃ¡ mÃ¡s que muerto por mucho, si has encontrado gente en los servidores, tienes suerte... âœ–

EspaÃ±ol y Bugs.El juego contiene bugs y entre los mÃ¡s molesto se encuentran que tenes que mover a los putos militares o aliados tuyos para que avancen y el problema es que tanto Opposing Force como Blue Shift no estÃ¡n en EspaÃ±ol a diferencia de Half-Life por lo que tienes que buscar un tutorial o algo de como ponerle el EspaÃ±ol, algo pÃ©simo que nosotros tengamos que hacer esto... âœ–

ConclusiÃ³n:
Opposing Force, una excelente expansiÃ³n de parte de Gearbox Software.
Muy disfrutable y el cual mÃ¡s de uno les va a encantar, â™¥â™¥â™¥ grandes innovaciones, es una expansiÃ³n mÃ¡s de acciÃ³n y suspenso en mi punto de vista, vivimos lo ocurrido en Black-Mesa en otro personaje, el final entre bueno y malo que deja mucha intriga y muchas preguntas, sin duda aceptemoslo, todos queremos de regreso a Adrian Shepard, imaginen lo que podrÃ­a hacer en Half-Life 3 o si hubiera aparecido como sorpresa en el inocente Episodio 3, si es que algÃºn dÃ­a sale.
Esta es una expansiÃ³n la cual vale la pena comprar a casi 4 DÃ³lares o casi 70 pesos, vivirÃ¡s una buena experiencia y aventura muy buena como el Half-Life original. Lastima que Blue Shift solo se hizo para exprimir mÃ¡s la fama de Half-Life en esa Ã©poca, Opposing Force es un gran trabajo de parte de Gearbox y como ya dije, por 3,74 DÃ³lares o 68 pesos Argentinos estÃ¡ mÃ¡s que bien.

Puntaje final:
9/10

Una historia desde otra perspectiva.

Bueno quiero empezar esta reseÃ±a diciendo algo que le quita MUCHOS puntos a opposing force y blue shift Y ES...
EL ERROR DEL MOUSE.Me refiero ala vista que se traba pero si no saben como resolver esto yo les explico rapido pero les voy a contar una muy breve historia:cuando yo compre el Half Life Opposing Force me salio este bug y yo queria un reembolso pero al final me jugue todo el juego asi y menos mal que no reseÃ±aba pero HOY 05/10/2020 encontre la manera de arreglarlo y fue un alivio lo mismo â™¥â™¥â™¥ blue shift...Bueno despues de esto explico como arreglarlo si les paso.

SOLUCION:
van a opciones y tocan la opcion de raton, tienen que cambiar la sensibilidad del mouse (Yo les recomiendo que lo pongan a 8.0) luego tienen que dejar en tic de bueno en estas opciones:
VISTA DEL RATON
RAW MOUSE INPUT
El resto de las opciones simplemente dejelas sin el tic (Osea no las activen).AH no ser que jueges en joystick

LA RESEÃ‘A EN SI.
El juego es muy entretenido, tiene la misma jugabilidad que el half life 1, antes de continuar les dijo que no supera al half life original.
La historia es curiosa y entretenida debido a que eres un militar y cambias de perspectiva talvez lo MAS interesante del juego son las nuevas armas y los nuevos monstruos.Tal vez el momento mas random del juego es el final boss que no se ustedes pero salio de la nada.Me gusta el cameo de Gordon Freeman saltando a Xen y que nos deja saber cuando pasa tal cosa y cuando la otra.Otra cosa que le resta muchos puntos a opposing force es la falta de suministros,me refiero al que juego no te ayuda tanto cuando tenes poca vida o balas (sobre todo vida en mi caso).La verdad esto -no me gusto para nada ya que el juego no ayuda al jugador en eso ademas que el juego NUNCA te da un respiro uno sale de un lugar y ya le estan esperando monstruos y otras cosas.Creo que los de Gearbox la hicieron muy mal ahy,ya que Valve era justo â™¥â™¥â™¥ las vidas y las balas y te daba respiros, aca Gearbox no.
EN FIN
Mis reseÃ±as son cortas y no tan bien explicadas pero creo que se entiende lo que quiero decir, es un juego entretenido este talvez sea la mejor expansion de las 3 (osea esta, Blue Shift y Decay), tiene como cualquier juego errores y es injusto en varias ocasiones.Es a grandes rasgos un juego nuevo y â™¥â™¥â™¥ una historia y jugabilidad exquisita y te la recomiendo plenamente si te gusto el half life
CALIFICACION

Calificacion:
Half Life Opposing Force: 8.5

Creo y considero una gran expasion que han hecho y se nota en el labor, Debido a su trama que sucede en el mismo entorno de Black Mesa, pero en distinta perspectiva. Esta vez como un soldado que le designa una mision, la cual termina siendo otra totalmente diferente. Ten en cuenta que para jugar esta version, tendras que haber ganado el Half Life 1.

Si hablamos de jugabilidad es la misma, â™¥â™¥â™¥ algunos cambios, agregan armas y tambien enemigos. Retomo lo que dije en el otro analisis, habilidad y astucia son los principales caracteres que deberas tener muy en cuenta. Muchas sorpresas te llevaras y algunos sustos tambien.

Lo recomiendo al 100 %.
â™¥â™¥: Te ayudara a comprender un poco mas la historia.

Opposing Force, ĞºĞ°Ğº Ğ¸ Ğ´Ñ€ÑƒĞ³Ğ¾Ğµ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğµ Ğº Half Life, Blue Shift, Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ·Ñ‹Ğ²Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ Ñƒ Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ñ ÑĞ¼ĞµÑˆĞ°Ğ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ğµ Ñ‡ÑƒĞ²ÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ°. Ğ’ Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ»Ğ¸Ñ‡Ğ¸Ğ¸ Ğ¾Ñ‚ BS, ÑÑ‚Ğ¸ Ñ‡ÑƒĞ²ÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ° Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒÑˆĞµ ÑĞ¼ĞµÑˆĞ°Ğ½Ñ‹ Ğ² Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ¸Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ÑŒĞ½ÑƒÑ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ½Ñƒ.

Ğ”Ğ¾Ğ±Ğ°Ğ²Ğ»ĞµĞ½Ğ¾ Ğ¼Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¶ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ñ‹Ñ… Ğ¿ÑƒÑˆĞµĞº Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ½Ğ¸ĞºĞ¾Ğ², Ğ½Ğµ Ğ²ÑĞµĞ³Ğ´Ğ° Ğ²ÑÑ‘ ÑĞ´ĞµĞ»Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¾ ÑƒĞ´Ğ°Ñ‡Ğ½Ğ¾, Ğ½Ğ¾ Ñ‚ĞµĞ¼ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¼ĞµĞ½ĞµĞµ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾-Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ğµ, Ğ¿Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼Ñƒ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğµ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¾Ñ‰ÑƒÑ‰Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ÑÑ ÑĞ¾Ğ²ÑĞµĞ¼ Ğ²Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¸Ñ‡Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¼ Ğ² Ğ¿Ğ»Ğ°Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¼ĞµÑ…Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸Ğº, Ğ° Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ´Ğ° Ğ´Ğ°Ğ¶Ğµ Ğ¿Ñ€ĞµĞ¿Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ½Ğ¾ÑĞ¸Ñ‚ Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸ÑÑ‚Ğ½Ñ‹Ğµ ÑÑÑ€Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ·Ñ‹.

Un capitolo della trama davvero stupendo!!
Half-Life: Opposing Force Ã¨ uno spin-off (add-on, chiamatelo come vi pare) dove, come in Blue Shift, si ha lâ€™opportunitÃ  di venere un altro punto di vista della trama di Half-Life giocata in precedenza â™¥â™¥â™¥ Freeman.
Il gameplay non Ã¨ epico come il capitolo Half-Life, ma rispetto a Blue Shift Ã¨ di GRAN LUNGA MIGLIORE! Blue Shift rimane simile a ad Half Life, non porta nessun cambiamento, sia come armi che nel gioco (anzi ha molto di meno di HF). Opposing Force invece puÃ² essere un vero e proprio Half Life!! Numerose armi di combattmento, armi aliene, durata maggiore.

Certo! Usare i saldati che vogliono uccidere Freeman (e che Freeman ha tanto ucciso) sembra un poâ€™ strano, ma in questo capitolo si nota anche lâ€™altro punto di vista. Non per altro anche i soldati hanno fermato una minaccia aliena (vedi finale). Del resto il Gman ha determinato sia le sorti di Freeman che del soldato.

+ Un gameplay vario e bello.
+ NovitÃ  in armi, tra cui il tanto atteso cecchino (anche se si sblocca molto in lÃ  nella campagna :-( ), il mitragliatore pesante e il coltello. Ma voglio anche citare la famosa arma aliena usata come rampino!! :-D
+ Nuove modalitÃ , no bhe, solo la corda, ma rendolo il gameplay un po' piÃ¹ vario.
+ Un arma corpo a corpo diversa dal solito piede di porco di Freeman, â™¥â™¥â™¥ lâ€™aggiunta del coltello.
+ La modalitÃ  di addestramento Ã¨ simpatica! :-) (Ã¨ obbligatorio farla per capire le cose â€œnuoveâ€)
+ Un poâ€™ di tattica â™¥â™¥â™¥ i soldati.
+ Il Gman compare molto spesso e si vede come lui cambia ha cambiato destino dei personaggi.
+ Raggi X per vedere nel buio.
- Completamente in inglese, non ho capito molto della trama.
- Freeman si vede una sola volta! -.-! E meno male che dovevamo ucciderlo!! -.-!!


Un consiglio, non â€œrisparmiateâ€ ad usarle le armi forti per il finale! Il big boss di fine gioco non ha bisogno di tutto questo armamento per sconfiggerlo.
Giocato senza problemi â™¥â™¥â™¥ Win7, durato 7 ore.

RecommandÃ©
9.9 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 15 dÃ©cembre 2019
The adventures of a certain HECU Corporal!

Half Life: Opposing Force is a expansion of the original game made by Gearbox, that takes place during the original Half Life. The game features the character Adrian Shepherd, a HECU Corporal, trapped in the Facilty and has to fight his way through the Facility and also defeat the mysterious Race X with a whole bunch of new weapons!

The gameplay is just as solid as the original with the exception of new levels, creatures, and more imporantly new weapons and oh boy the weapons are pretty solid. Each new weapon provides a new way to shoot down the imposing foes as well as some new ways to complete puzzles such as a barnacle to latch on to other surfaces and much much more! If there is a few gripe I could make it would the Nightvision feature that isn't really helpful from its ugly green glow and the annoying difficultly curve near the end where you pretty much have to use the new weapons to defeat them quickly before the defeat you.

Overall, Opposing Force gave us of what the original Half Life did but with brand new features that make the game a new experience all together! But again the only bad things is the late game difficulty and of course the game's age as a FPS, however, I still enjoyed my time playing at a HECU.

And then Adrian Shepherd was never heard from again.
 
Kyezoar

RecommandÃ©
14.4 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 26 juillet 2020
I have something of a love-hate relationship with Opposing Force.

Widely considered to be the best of Gearboxâ€™s expansions, itâ€™s notable for having spawned a fan-following (which apparently goes right up the chain to Gabe Newell himself) for its main character, Corporal Adrian Shephard. I find that kind of remarkable, because where thereâ€™s a certain level of black humour and irony around the character of Gordon Freeman, Adrian Shephard is truly a blank slate with no real characteristics to speak of. He even looks like the standard grunt!

Itâ€™s interesting that heâ€™s gathered such a loyal following, and I sincerely hope those fans get to see him again one day. It came pretty close to being a reality[combineoverwiki.net] many years ago, so itâ€™s not impossible heâ€™ll re-emerge eventually.

Anyway. Opposing Force. Typical of the first-person expansion packs of the era, it takes us back to a familiar environment and equips us with new weapons with which to fight a host of fresh monsters. At the time, that was the criteria for such spin-off, and it seems unfair to pick it apart on those grounds â€“ itâ€™s what players wanted.

And yet Gearbox take such a scattershot approach to these new additions itâ€™s almost inevitable some work and some fail, and itâ€™s this lack of discipline that brings the game down. The amount of new weapons is silly, and few enhance the gameplay in any meaningful way save one or two. For instance, thereâ€™s a sniper rifle, which is actually really useful and fun to use, but then thereâ€™s the so-called â€˜barnacle gunâ€™, which slots onto Shephardâ€™s hand and allows him to latch on to goo and carry himself across chasms.

The barnacle gun is dumb. Itâ€™s not fun, and given how little opportunity the game gives players to use it, the developers probably knew it, too. Itâ€™s just another item thrown in to beef things up and fulfil that criteria, when the focus ought to have been on developing those aspects of Half-Life that made it the genre-defining hit it was, such as scripted sequences, a purposeful narrative, and focused set-pieces.

Opposing Force clearly gets thatâ€™s what it ought to be doing, but it seldom bothers to try.

We return to the Black Mesa Research Facility as HECU soldier Adrian Shephard, who has been sent in as part of a clean-up crew to put a lid on a scientific experiment gone very wrong. Itâ€™s a successful framing device that allows us to witness Half-Life's events from a different perspective, and thereâ€™s great appeal there. You can tell Gearbox are having a blast tucking into this science complex gone hellishly awry, and who can blame them?

For the most part, it works. Shephard travels through sewers, laboratories, warehouses, and underwater research bases. Theyâ€™re the usual FPS fare, but theyâ€™re consistently fun, and by the end of the game you get the opportunity to really engage in some nail-biting, and pretty challenging, combat.

The problems begin somewhere around the middle, when it becomes clear the game lacks a driving narrative force. Itâ€™s hard to shake the notion that youâ€™re just wandering through the facility shooting bad guys with no particular goal in mind. And thatâ€™s odd, because Gearbox add some additional wrinkles to the plot that could have served as Shephardâ€™s motivation, but itâ€™s flimsily constructed: he mostly just wanders into things. You could say the same is true of Freeman, but thereâ€™s always a clearly conveyed goal in mind during the scientistâ€™s adventures, even if it doesnâ€™t always go to plan.

Here, itâ€™s just Shephard, stranded in the facility, vaguely aware thereâ€™s a second alien invasion underway (the uninspired, risible Race-X) and that the Black Ops from the first game have betrayed the HECU (a cool twist that goes approximately nowhere). Yeah, thereâ€™s plenty of solid gameplay set-pieces to keep things entertaining, but I can never shake the feeling that Opposing Force ultimately has no real purpose beyond fulfilling that expansion pack criteria and offering a series of hollow replicas of scenarios Half-Life did far better (the Pit Wormâ€™s Nest springs to mind).

On the up side, Opposing Force's overriding theme is one of profound isolation, and it does a good job of conveying it. The game begins with Shephardâ€™s Osprey being shot out of the sky, and he awakens some time later, having missed the most substantial battles between the scientists, the invading Xenians, and his HECU comrades â€“ split from the very purpose of the mission he was dispatched to execute. Consequently his orders at this point are to simply evacuate, but a certain brief-case toting official has other ideas, denying Shephard escape and sending him back â€“ back into the dark of the collapsing facility.

You might justly ask whether this serves as an explanation for the gameâ€™s lack of focus, but it doesnâ€™t, not really. Itâ€™s not the absence of direction and tangible motive that heightens Opposing Force's sense of isolation, but the detachment from anything resembling friends or allies. Youâ€™ll occasionally meet up with fellow soldiers, but theyâ€™re just as in the dark as you are.

In Opposing Force, Black Mesa is a lonely, desolate place, and itâ€™s its best quality. But itâ€™s also a place without purpose, burdened with too many bells and whistles that add far less than the designers imagined. Less, in this case, really wouldâ€™ve been more.

It probably sounds like I donâ€™t much care for Opposing Force, but thatâ€™s not true. Like I said, itâ€™s a love-hate thing, and as unstructured as the game is, itâ€™s often extremely fun, especially if youâ€™re just looking for more Half-Life. I certainly recommend it, but its flaws, as evident as they were back in â€˜98, are even more prominent now.

And maybe Gearbox knew it, back in â€˜98. Blue Shift, largely considered to be the inferior game, possesses a stronger structure, a more focused narrative and features better scripted sequences - taking it, by my estimation, a few notches above Opposing Force.
 
Ross

Ğ˜ÑĞ¿Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒĞ·ÑƒÑÑ‚ÑÑ Ğ»Ğ¾ĞºĞ°Ñ†Ğ¸Ğ¸, Ğ¿Ğ¾ĞºĞ°Ğ·Ğ°Ğ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ğµ Ğ² Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ³Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ°Ğ»Ğµ, Ğ½Ğ¾ ĞºĞ°Ğº Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ°Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ·Ğ°Ğ´ĞµĞ¹ÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ğ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ğµ Ğ½ĞµĞ¿Ğ¾ÑÑ€ĞµĞ´ÑÑ‚Ğ²ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ² Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ†ĞµÑÑĞµ, Ğº Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ¼ĞµÑ€Ñƒ Ñ‚ĞµÑ€Ñ€Ğ¸Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ¸ ĞºĞ¾Ğ¼Ğ¿Ğ»ĞµĞºÑĞ° Ğ²Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ¾Ñ€ĞµĞ»ÑŒÑĞ°, ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‹Ğµ Ğ±Ğ»Ğ°Ğ³Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ°Ñ€Ñ ĞµĞ¼Ñƒ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¿ÑƒÑĞºĞ°ÑÑ‚ÑÑ Ğ² Half-Life, Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ¸ Ğ´Ğ°Ğ¼Ğ±Ğ°, ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ°Ñ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸ÑÑƒÑ‚ÑÑ‚Ğ²ÑƒĞµÑ‚ Ğ² Ğ¾Ğ±ĞµĞ¸Ñ… Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ°Ñ….

ĞœÑƒĞ»ÑŒÑ‚Ğ¸Ğ¿Ğ»ĞµĞµÑ€ ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ» Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ»ĞµĞµ ÑĞ±Ğ°Ğ»Ğ°Ğ½ÑĞ¸Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ğ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¼ Ğ¸ Ğ¸ÑĞ¿Ñ€Ğ°Ğ²Ğ»ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¼. Ğ’ Half-Life Ğ±Ñ‹Ğ»Ğ¸ Ğ»Ğ°Ğ³Ğ°ÑÑ‰Ğ¸Ğµ Ñ…Ğ¸Ñ‚Ğ±Ğ¾ĞºÑÑ‹ Ğ¸ ÑĞ»ĞµĞ³ĞºĞ° Ğ´Ğ¸ÑĞ±Ğ°Ğ»Ğ°Ğ½ÑĞ½Ñ‹Ğµ ĞºĞ°Ñ€Ñ‚Ñ‹ Ğ¸Ğ·-Ğ·Ğ° ĞšĞ²Ğ°Ğ½Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ´ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ±Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ¸Ğ·Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ° - Ğ·Ğ´ĞµÑÑŒ Ğ¶Ğµ Ñ‚Ğ°ĞºĞ¾Ğµ ĞµÑĞ»Ğ¸ Ğ¸ ĞµÑÑ‚ÑŒ, Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğµ Ñ‚Ğ°Ğº Ñ‡Ğ°ÑÑ‚Ğ¾.

Ğ˜Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ³: ÑĞ¿Ğ¸Ğ½-Ğ¾Ñ„Ñ„, ĞºĞ°Ğº Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ°Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ¾ Ğ»Ğ¸Ğ±Ğ¾ ÑĞ»Ğ°Ğ±Ñ‹Ğ¹, Ğ»Ğ¸Ğ±Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğ¸ Ğ¾ Ñ‡ĞµĞ¼, Ğ½Ğ¾ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ñ‚ - Ğ¸ÑĞºĞ»ÑÑ‡ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğµ. Ğ’Ñ‹ÑˆĞµĞ» Ğ²Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½Ğµ Ğ³Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¼ Ğ´Ğ»Ñ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ñ‹ Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ğ°Ñ€Ñ‹ Ğ° Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ¸ Ğ´ĞµÑÑÑ‚ĞºĞ¾Ğ² Ñ‡Ğ°ÑĞ¾Ğ² Ğ´Ğ»Ñ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ñ‹.

ĞÑ†ĞµĞ½ĞºĞ°: 9/10.
 
Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ°ÑĞ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ ÑĞ½Ğ°Ğ¸Ğ¿ĞµÑ€
194 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
11 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
6.6 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 13 juillet 2016
Opposing Force is the first expansion pack of the two that were released for Half-Life on PC. Both expansions were developed by Gearbox and got support from Valve. When I first found out that the expansion packs for Half-Life were developed by Gearbox I was quite amazed. Around that time, there was a lot of drama surrounding Duke Nukem Forever and Aliens: Colonial Marines, so I was amazed that in the past Gearbox had the honor to make expansions for a game classic like Half-Life.

In this expansion you experience the story of Half-Life from the perspective of a soldier. You are going to Black Mesa, and your aircraft crashes. You wake up and don't know what is really going on and what the mission is.

The game itself is pretty hard for me to curate, because it all just feels and plays the same as the original game. (With the expansion having half the length of the original game.) The new features are some different weapons and enemies, both of which are creatively implemented. The only new feature that I didn't think was all that well executed was the nightvision goggles. They looked cool at first, but they sadly only really work in short distance.

This expansion takes place in Black Mesa for the most part, not much time is spent in alien dimensions. At the beginning, I had the feeling that the weapons were a little bit more balanced than in the original game. Because I found myself using the shotgun more often. Still there are some new weapons that I almost never used.

What I found special about Opposing Force is that I could see that Gearbox added some more humor in the expansion than what there was in the original Half-Life itself. I still have to say that the story in my opinion didn't really add too much to what we already knew from Half-Life, but it is still fun to see it from their perspective.

The nitpick I have though is that the thing I loved about Half-Life is that there never really was a moment of standing still where you are forced to listen to someone. Opposing Force had that happen twice, sadly. This was pretty annoying when I died a few times at one of those points. (I recommend quick saving directly after you are done waiting)

Throughout the expansions there were some nice references and they shared the same moments with the original Half-Life timeline.

The gameplay is the same mixture of shooting and exploration, just like in the original. The beginning first felt a little dull but then the game started to pick up. I especially liked the shooting at some parts, even though I hated one of the new alien enemies who in my opinion was just really annoying, an enemy which requires too much ammo to take down and does too much damage.

Opposing Force might not be as good as Half-Life, but in my opinion it is still worth to play it if you want to have more of the same Half-Life gameplay.

Reviews of the other Half-Life games:
Half-Life
Half-Life: Blue Shift
Half-Life 2
 
Harry 2K5G

Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 14 mai 2015
Una sorprendente expansiÃ³n.

Si bien cuando era chico juguÃ© Half-Life 1 y la "sosa" expansiÃ³n Blue Shift creÃ­a haberlo visto todo. Pero Opposing Force me deslumbrÃ³ en todos sus aspectos.

Por un lado, es super interesante conocer desde cero la historia desde el punto de vista del grupo HECU de marines, y cÃ³mo subvierte el pensamiento que tenemos de "asesinos despiadados", para brindarles mÃ¡s humanidad.

Segundo, no se queda atrÃ¡s e innova muchÃ­simo mÃ¡s que Blue Shift. Aparecen enemigos nuevos, y ademÃ¡s de esto tenemos nuevas armas que son muy interesantes de manejar. A eso sumale los excelentes puzzles y bosses. Nada es accesorio, todo contribuye a disfrutar mÃ¡s del juego. De mÃ¡s estÃ¡ decir que tendremos varios combates memorables, que no son nada fÃ¡ciles.

La presencia de los Black Ops es genial, ya que eleva al juego a un mayor nivel de dificultad. Encontramos algo mÃ¡s despiadado que los marines, y les debemos hacer frente.

Gracias a estos nuevos enemigos, nos veremos obligados casi a guardar la partida cada vez que matamos un enemigo, porque un disparo que nos acierten nos complica mucho en el desarrollo del juego.

Creo que todo esto que mencionÃ© antes dialoga perfectamente para generar un juego entretenido,largo y a la vez muy dificultoso.

En fin, 10/10, si no supera al juego original, pega en el palo!

18 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile

RecommandÃ©
0.2 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 26 juin 2021
It's been a really long time since I've played this game, but this is the game that started it all -- my love for the Half Life series. I started to play the demo of this game back when game demos CD came included in gaming magazines (think paper, pre-internet) Booted up the demo and was instantly hooked, I've never played a game like it before. It was so immersive and intense. Immediately begged my parents to go out and buy me Half Life Orange box, and played through the entire Half Life 1 series.

This specific Game - Opposing Force is where you play as the bad guys. I love that you can play the series as part of all the different perspectives, bad guys, the good guys, and the main character of course. If you like this one, reccomend playing Blue Shift as well. Don't forget to play the main storyline as well. If you've never played a Half Life game before, you don't necessarily have to start in any one order, each game is stand alone for the most part.

Don't be put off by the graphics, playing this today, the graphics haven't aged the best but this game is a true gem all about the gameplay. If the graphics really put you off, I highly recommend playing through Black Mesa, it's Half Life 1 in the Half Life 2 engine, made completely by fans.

Such a great game, a must buy if you already don't have it. Highly recommended!
 
Jaiden

Ğ¥Ğ¾Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ´Ğ°Ğ½Ğ½Ğ¾Ğµ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğµ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½Ğ¾ÑÑ‚ÑŒÑ Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ¿Ğ»ÑĞ½ÑƒĞ»Ğ¾ Half-Life: Blue Shift, Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ²ÑÑ‘ Ğ¶Ğµ Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ¸Ğ¼ĞµĞµÑ‚ ĞºĞ°Ğº Ğ¿Ñ€ĞµĞ¸Ğ¼ÑƒÑ‰ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ°, Ñ‚Ğ°Ğº Ğ¸ Ğ½ĞµĞ´Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ñ‚ĞºĞ¸. Ğ”Ğ¾ Ğ¸Ğ´ĞµĞ°Ğ»Ğ° Ñ‚Ğ°Ğº Ğ¸ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ´Ğ¾Ñ‚ÑĞ½ÑƒĞ»Ğ¸. Ğ’ Ğ¿Ğ»ÑÑĞ°Ñ… Ğ¸ Ğ¼Ğ¸Ğ½ÑƒÑĞ°Ñ… Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ»ĞµĞµ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ´Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ±Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ñ‡ĞµĞ¼Ñƒ.

ĞŸĞ»ÑÑÑ‹:
1. Ğ›Ğ¾ĞºĞ°Ñ†Ğ¸Ğ¸. Ğ˜Ğ³Ñ€Ğ° Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½ĞµĞ½Ğ° Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒÑˆĞ¸Ğ¼ ĞºĞ¾Ğ»Ğ¸Ñ‡ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ğ»Ğ¸Ñ‡Ğ½Ñ‹Ñ… Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ¼ĞµÑ‰ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ğ¸ Ğ´Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ‡Ğ½Ğ¾ ÑĞ²ĞµĞ¶Ğ¸Ñ… Ğ¸Ğ´ĞµĞ¹. Ğ•ÑĞ»Ğ¸ Ğ¿ĞµĞ¹Ğ·Ğ°Ğ¶ĞµĞ¼ Ğ±ĞµÑĞºÑ€Ğ°Ğ¹Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ… ĞºĞ°Ğ½ÑŒĞ¾Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ² ÑƒĞ¶Ğµ Ğ½Ğ¸ĞºĞ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğµ ÑƒĞ´Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ¸ÑˆÑŒ, Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ²Ğ¾Ñ‚ Ñ‚ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ²Ñ‹Ğµ ĞºĞ°Ğ¼ĞµÑ€Ñ‹ Ñ Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ñ†Ğ°Ğ¼Ğ¸ Ğ—ĞµĞ½, ÑĞºĞ»Ğ°Ğ´ÑĞºĞ¸Ğµ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ¼ĞµÑ‰ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ, Ğ²Ğ¾ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ğµ Ğ±Ğ°Ğ·Ñ‹ (Ğ² Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ñ‡Ğ¸ÑĞ»Ğµ Ñ‚Ñ€ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ñ‡Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ»Ğ°Ğ³ĞµÑ€ÑŒ) - ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ğ²Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½Ğµ ÑĞµĞ±Ğµ Ğ¸Ğ½Ñ‚ĞµÑ€ĞµÑĞ½Ñ‹Ğµ Ğ·Ğ°Ğ´ÑƒĞ¼ĞºĞ¸. ĞÑĞ¾Ğ±ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ğ¾ ĞºÑ€ÑƒÑ‚Ğ¾ Ğ¸ÑÑĞ»ĞµĞ´Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ ÑƒĞ¶Ğµ Ğ¸Ğ·Ğ²ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ½Ñ‹Ğµ Ğ»Ğ¾ĞºĞ°Ñ†Ğ¸Ğ¸, Ğ³Ğ´Ğµ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ‹Ğ²Ğ°Ğ» Ğ¤Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ¼ĞµĞ½, Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ´ Ğ´Ñ€ÑƒĞ³Ğ¸Ğ¼ ÑƒĞ³Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ¼. Opposing Force Ğ¸Ğ·Ğ²ĞµÑÑ‚ĞµĞ½ ÑĞ²Ğ¾Ğ¸Ğ¼ ÑƒĞ½Ğ¸ĞºĞ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ñ‹Ğ¼ Ñ‚Ñ€ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ñ‡Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¼ Ğ»Ğ°Ğ³ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ¼. Ğ’Ğ¼ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ¾ ĞºĞ»Ğ°ÑÑĞ¸Ñ‡ĞµÑĞºĞ¾Ğ¹ Ğ³Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ³Ñ€Ğ°Ğ¼Ğ¼Ñ‹, Ğ·Ğ´ĞµÑÑŒ Ğ½Ğ°Ñ Ğ²ÑÑ‚Ñ€ĞµÑ‡Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ ÑĞ°Ğ¼Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ½Ğ°ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ÑÑ‰Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ğ²Ğ¾ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ»Ğ°Ğ³ĞµÑ€ÑŒ, Ğ³Ğ´Ğµ Ğ¿Ñ€ĞµĞ´ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¸Ñ‚ Ğ±Ñ‹ÑÑ‚Ñ€Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¹Ñ‚Ğ¸ ĞºÑ€Ğ°Ñ‚ĞºĞ¸Ğ¹ Ñ‚Ñ€ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ñ‡Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ ĞºÑƒÑ€Ñ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ¹Ñ†Ğ°.

2. ĞĞ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ñ Ğ¼ĞµÑ…Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸ĞºĞ°. ĞĞµ ÑĞ¼Ğ¾Ñ‚Ñ€Ñ Ğ½Ğ° Ğ½ĞµĞ±Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒÑˆÑƒÑ ĞºÑ€Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ¾ÑÑ‚ÑŒ, Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ñ Ğ¼ĞµÑ…Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸ĞºĞ° Ğ´ĞµĞ¹ÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ¸Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾ Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ»Ğ¸Ñ‡Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ²Ğ¿Ğ¸ÑÑ‹Ğ²Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ÑÑ Ğ² Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ñƒ. Ğ’ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ²ĞºĞ° Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ·Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ»ÑĞµÑ‚ ĞºĞ°Ñ€Ğ°Ğ±ĞºĞ°Ñ‚ÑŒÑÑ Ğ½Ğ° Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ·Ğ²Ñ‹ÑˆĞµĞ½Ğ½Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ¸. Ğ¡ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ¼Ğ¾Ñ‰ÑŒÑ Ñ‚ĞµÑ…Ğ½Ğ¸ĞºĞ° Ğ² Ğ¾Ñ‚Ñ€ÑĞ´Ğµ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ğ²Ğ°Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ´Ğ²ĞµÑ€Ğ¸. ĞĞ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ğµ Ğ¾Ñ€ÑƒĞ¶Ğ¸Ğµ "Ğ±Ğ°Ñ€Ğ½Ğ°ĞºĞ»" Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ·Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ»ÑĞµÑ‚ Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ¼ĞµÑ‰Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒÑÑ Ğ½Ğ° Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ğ»Ğ¸Ñ‡Ğ½ÑƒÑ Ğ²Ñ‹ÑĞ¾Ñ‚Ñƒ. ĞŸĞ°ÑÑ…Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ°Ñ Ğ¿ÑƒÑˆĞºĞ° Ğ´Ğ»Ñ Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ĞµĞ¿Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‚Ğ°Ñ†Ğ¸Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ·Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ»ÑĞµÑ‚ Ğ²Ğ°Ğ¼ Ğ²Ñ€ĞµĞ¼ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ°Ğ´Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ½Ğ° Ğ¸Ğ·Ğ²ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ½Ñ‹Ğµ Ğ»Ğ¾ĞºĞ°Ñ†Ğ¸Ğ¸ Ğ¸Ğ· Half-Life 1, Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶ĞµÑ‚ Ğ½Ğµ Ñ€Ğ°Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ñ„Ğ°Ğ½Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ² ĞºĞ»Ğ°ÑÑĞ¸Ñ‡ĞµÑĞºĞ¾Ğ¹ Ñ…Ğ°Ğ»Ğ²Ñ‹.

3. ĞĞ¾Ğ²Ñ‹Ğµ Ğ²Ñ€Ğ°Ğ³Ğ¸. Ğ˜Ğ³Ñ€Ğ° Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒÑˆĞµ Ğ²Ğ´Ğ°Ğ»Ğ°ÑÑŒ Ğ² Ğ¸ÑÑĞ»ĞµĞ´Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ ÑƒÑ‡ĞµĞ½Ñ‹Ñ… Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ğ¾ĞºĞ°Ğ·Ğ°Ğ»Ğ° Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ñ‹Ğµ Ğ¾Ğ±ÑŠĞµĞºÑ‚Ñ‹ Ğ¸ÑÑĞ»ĞµĞ´Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ. ĞŸĞ¾ÑĞ²Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ¸ÑÑŒ 2 Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ñ‹Ñ… Ğ±Ğ¾ÑÑĞ°, 5 Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ñ‹Ñ… Ğ²Ñ€Ğ°Ğ³Ğ¾Ğ². ĞœĞ°Ğ»Ğ¾ Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾, Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸ÑˆĞµĞ»ÑŒÑ†Ñ‹ Ñ Ğ—ĞµĞ½Ğ° Ğ½Ğ°Ñ‡Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¸ Ğ²Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¶ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğµ Ğ½Ğ° Ğ—ĞµĞ¼Ğ»Ñ, Ñ‚Ğ°Ğº Ğº Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ¼ ĞµÑ‰Ñ‘ Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ´ĞºĞ»ÑÑ‡Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ°ÑÑŒ Ğ´Ñ€ÑƒĞ³Ğ°Ñ Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ»Ğ°Ğ½ĞµÑ‚Ğ½Ğ°Ñ Ñ€Ğ°ÑĞ° X. ĞŸÑ€Ğ°Ğ²Ğ¸Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ÑŒÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ğ¾ÑĞ»Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¾ Ğ²Ğ¾ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ñ…, Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ‹ Ğ»Ğ¸ĞºĞ²Ğ¸Ğ´Ğ¸Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ¤Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ğ°, Ñ‚Ğ°Ğº ĞµÑ‰Ñ‘ Ğ¸ ÑĞ²ĞµÑ€Ñ…Ñƒ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ·Ğ°ĞºĞ¸Ğ½ÑƒĞ»Ğ¸ ÑĞ¿ĞµÑ†Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ´Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ğ´ĞµĞ»ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğµ, ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğµ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ·Ğ°Ñ‡Ğ¸ÑÑ‚Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ²Ğ¾ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ñ… Ğ¸ Ğ²Ğ·Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ²Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğº Ñ‡ĞµÑ€Ñ‚ÑĞ¼ ĞœĞµĞ·Ñƒ, Ğ¿Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼Ñƒ Ñƒ Ğ½Ğ°Ñ Ñ‚ĞµĞ¿ĞµÑ€ÑŒ Ğ³Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ğ´Ğ¾ Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒÑˆĞµ Ğ²Ñ€Ğ°Ğ³Ğ¾Ğ² Ğ¸ Ğ³Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ğ´Ğ¾ Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒÑˆĞµ Ğ·Ğ°Ğ´Ğ°Ñ‡. ĞŸĞ¾ĞºĞ° Ğ¤Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ¼ĞµĞ½ Ğ¿Ñ‹Ñ‚Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ÑÑ ÑƒĞ½Ğ¸Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ»Ğ°Ğ½ĞµÑ‚Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ³Ğ»Ğ°Ğ²Ğ°Ñ€Ñ Ğ² Ğ—ĞµĞ½Ğµ, Ğ½Ğ°Ñˆ Ğ²Ğ¾ÑĞºĞ° ĞĞ´Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ°Ğ½ Ğ¨ĞµĞ¿Ğ°Ñ€Ğ´ Ñ€Ğ°ÑÑ…Ğ»ĞµĞ±Ñ‹Ğ²Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ Ğ´ĞµÑ€ÑŒĞ±Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğ° Ğ—ĞµĞ¼Ğ»Ğµ, Ñ‡ĞµĞ¼ Ğ¸ Ğ·Ğ°Ğ¸Ğ½Ñ‚ĞµÑ€ĞµÑĞ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ğ» Ğ½ĞµĞ±ĞµĞ·Ñ‹Ğ·Ğ²ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ G-man' a.

4. ĞĞ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ğµ Ğ¾Ñ€ÑƒĞ¶Ğ¸Ğµ. ĞĞ°ĞºĞ¾Ğ½ĞµÑ†-Ñ‚Ğ¾ Half-Life Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ°Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ¸ Ñ…Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾ÑˆĞ¸Ğ¼ Ğ³Ñ€Ğ°Ğ½Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼ĞµÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼ (ÑĞ¿Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¼ĞµÑ‚Ğ°Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ÑŒ), Ğ¿ÑƒĞ»ĞµĞ¼ĞµÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼ (Ğ¼249) Ğ¸ ÑĞ½Ğ°Ğ¹Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ÑĞºĞ¾Ğ¹ Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ½Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ²ĞºĞ¾Ğ¹ (Ğ¼40Ğ°1). Ğ”Ğ°, Ğº ÑĞ¾Ğ¶Ğ°Ğ»ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ, Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒÑˆĞ¸Ğ½ÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ¸Ğ· Ğ´Ğ°Ğ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ñ… Ğ¾Ñ€ÑƒĞ¶Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ²ÑĞµĞ³Ğ´Ğ° Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»ÑƒÑ‡Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑÑ Ğ²Ğ¾ÑĞ¿Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒĞ·Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒÑÑ, Ñ‚Ğ°Ğº ĞºĞ°Ğº Ğ¿Ğ°Ñ‚Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ½Ñ‹ Ğº Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ¼ Ğ²Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½Ğµ Ñ‡ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¼ Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ±Ñ‹Ğ»Ğ¸ ÑĞ¿Ñ€ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ½Ñ‹ Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ¸ Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ´Ğ°ÑÑ‚ÑÑ Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ´ Ğ·Ğ°Ğ¼ĞµÑĞ°Ğ¼Ğ¸, Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ½Ğ°ĞºĞ¾ Ğ¸Ñ… Ğ¼Ğ¾Ñ‰ÑŒ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ Ğ±ĞµĞ· Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ±Ğ»ĞµĞ¼ Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ»ĞµÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ½Ğ¸ĞºĞ¾Ğ² Ñ Ğ²Ñ‹ÑĞ¾ĞºĞ¸Ğ¼ Ğ¿Ğ¾ĞºĞ°Ğ·Ğ°Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ĞµĞ¼ Ğ·Ğ´Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ²ÑŒÑ (Ğ’Ğ¾Ğ»Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ³Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ°). Ğ­Ñ‚Ğ¸Ñ… Ğ¾Ñ€ÑƒĞ¶Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ğ´ĞµĞ¹ÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ¸Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾ ÑĞ¸Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğµ Ñ…Ğ²Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¾ Ğ² Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ³Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğµ, Ñ‚Ğ°Ğº ĞºĞ°Ğº Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ¸ Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ»Ğ¸Ñ‡Ğ½Ğ¾ ÑĞ±Ğ°Ğ»Ğ°Ğ½ÑĞ¸Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ğ½Ñ‹ Ğ¸ Ñ…Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾ÑˆĞ¾ Ğ²Ğ¿Ğ¸ÑÑ‹Ğ²Ğ°ÑÑ‚ÑÑ Ğ² Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ñƒ.

ĞœĞ¸Ğ½ÑƒÑ Ğ±ÑƒĞ´ĞµÑ‚ Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸Ğ½, Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ´Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ‡Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ¶Ğ¸Ñ€Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹.

ĞœĞ¸Ğ½ÑƒÑÑ‹:
1. ĞÑ‡ĞµĞ½ÑŒ Ğ¿Ğ»Ğ¾Ñ…Ğ°Ñ Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ğ¾ÑÑ‚ÑŒ ÑƒÑ€Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ½ĞµĞ¹. Ğš ÑĞ¾Ğ¶Ğ°Ğ»ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ, Ñ Ñ€ĞµÑˆĞ¸Ğ» Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ…Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ñƒ Ğ½Ğ° Ğ²Ñ‹ÑĞ¾ĞºĞ¾Ğ¹ ÑĞ»Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ¸, Ğ·Ğ° Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ»Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ»ÑÑ Ğ¼Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ»Ğ¸Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ½ĞµÑ€Ğ²Ğ½Ñ‹Ñ… ĞºĞ»ĞµÑ‚Ğ¾Ğº. Ğ˜Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ´Ğ° Ğ·Ğ° Ğ²ĞµÑÑŒ ÑƒÑ€Ğ¾Ğ²ĞµĞ½ÑŒ Ğ²Ğ°Ğ¼ Ğ±ÑƒĞ´ĞµÑ‚ Ğ²ÑÑ‚Ñ€ĞµÑ‡Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒÑÑ Ğ²ÑĞµĞ³Ğ¾ Ğ»Ğ¸ÑˆÑŒ 1-2 Ğ°Ğ¿Ñ‚ĞµÑ‡ĞºĞ¸, ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ ĞµÑ‰Ñ‘ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸ ÑƒÑ‡ĞµÑ‚Ğµ, Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ²Ñ‹ Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ¼Ğ°ĞµÑ‚Ğµ Ğ²ÑĞµ ÑÑ‰Ğ¸ĞºĞ¸ Ğ½Ğ° ÑƒÑ€Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¸ Ğ¸Ñ‰ĞµÑ‚Ğµ Ğ²ÑĞµ Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ·Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ½Ñ‹Ğµ Ğ½Ñ‹Ñ‡ĞºĞ¸. Ğ˜Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ´Ğ° Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ° Ğ½Ğ°ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒĞºĞ¾ Ğ¿ÑƒÑÑ‚Ğ°, Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ½Ğ°Ğ´ĞµĞ»ÑĞµÑ‚ Ğ²Ğ°Ñ Ğ½Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ğ°Ñ‚Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¼Ğ¸, Ğ½Ğ¸ Ğ°Ğ¿Ñ‚ĞµÑ‡ĞºĞ°Ğ¼Ğ¸. ĞŸÑ€Ğ¸Ñ…Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑÑ ÑĞ¾Ñ…Ñ€Ğ°Ğ½ÑÑ‚ÑŒÑÑ ĞºĞ°Ğ¶Ğ´ÑƒÑ Ğ¼Ğ¸Ğ½ÑƒÑ‚Ñƒ, Ğ¸Ğ·-Ğ·Ğ° Ñ‡ĞµĞ³Ğ¾ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ñ Ğ¿Ğ°Ğ¿ĞºĞ° ÑĞ¾Ñ…Ñ€Ğ°Ğ½ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ğ½Ğ°ĞºĞ¾Ğ¿Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ° Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ»ĞµĞµ 100 ÑĞµĞ¹Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ². ĞšÑ€ÑƒÑ‚Ğ¾ Ğ±Ñ‹Ğ»Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ…Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ ÑƒÑ€Ğ¾Ğ²ĞµĞ½ÑŒ Ñ 20Ñ…Ğ¿, ĞºĞ¾Ğ³Ğ´Ğ° Ğ¿Ğ¾Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¸ Ğ½Ğ° ĞºĞ°Ğ¶Ğ´Ñ‹Ğµ Ğ¿Ğ°Ñ€Ñƒ Ğ¼ĞµÑ‚Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ² ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ²ÑÑ‚ ĞºÑƒÑ‡Ñƒ Ğ°ÑÑĞ°ÑĞ¸Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ² Ğ¸ Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ¹Ñ†Ğ¾Ğ² ÑĞ¿ĞµÑ†Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ´Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ğ´ĞµĞ»ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğ¹. ĞĞ½Ğ¸ Ğ³Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ğ´Ğ¾ Ğ±Ñ‹ÑÑ‚Ñ€ĞµĞµ Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ„ĞµÑÑĞ¸Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½ĞµĞµ Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ‹Ñ‡Ğ½Ñ‹Ñ… Ğ²Ğ¾ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ñ…, Ğ¿Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼Ñƒ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ° Ğ¿Ñ€ĞµĞ²Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‰Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ÑÑ Ğ² Ğ¿Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ÑĞ½Ğ½ÑƒÑ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ¿Ñ‹Ñ‚ĞºÑƒ ÑƒĞ±Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ½Ğ¸ĞºĞ° Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»ÑƒÑ‡Ğ¸Ğ² ÑƒÑ€Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ°. Ğ˜ Ñ…Ğ¾Ñ‚ĞµĞ» Ğ±Ñ‹ Ñ ÑĞºĞ°Ğ·Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ, Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ğ±Ñ‹Ğ»Ğ° Ğ³ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ°Ñ Ğ¸Ğ´ĞµÑ ÑĞ¾Ğ·Ğ´Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ ĞºĞ°ĞºĞ¾Ğ¹-Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ½ĞµĞ¿Ğ¾Ğ½ÑÑ‚Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ñ…Ğ°Ñ€Ğ´ĞºĞ¾Ñ€ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ¾ĞºÑƒ, Ğ½Ğ¾ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾, ÑĞºĞ¾Ñ€ĞµĞµ, Ğ½ĞµĞ´Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ°Ğ±Ğ¾Ñ‚ĞºĞ° Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ, Ñ‡ĞµĞ¼ ĞµĞ³Ğ¾ Ñ„Ğ¸Ñ‡Ğ°. ĞŸĞ¾Ğ´ ĞºĞ¾Ğ½ĞµÑ† Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ° Ğ´Ğ¾ÑˆĞ»Ğ° Ğ´Ğ¾ Ñ‚Ğ°ĞºĞ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ¼Ğ°ĞºÑĞ¸Ğ¼Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ¼Ğ°Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ğ¼Ğ°, Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ½ÑƒĞ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ±Ñ‹Ğ»Ğ¾ Ğ²ÑĞµĞ³Ğ¾ Ğ»Ğ¸ÑˆÑŒ Ñ Ğ¿Ğ°Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ‡ĞºĞ¾Ğ¹ Ğ´ĞµÑÑÑ‚ĞºĞ¾Ğ² Ñ…Ğ¿ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ±ĞµĞ¶Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ñ‡ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ·, Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ°ÑÑ‰Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ğ³Ñ€Ğ°Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ¿ÑƒĞ»ÑŒ, Ğ²ĞµÑ€Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ»ĞµÑ‚ Ñ Ğ¿ÑƒĞ»ĞµĞ¼ĞµÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼, Ğ° Ğ·Ğ°Ñ‚ĞµĞ¼ ĞµÑ‰Ñ‘ Ğ¸ Ñ‡ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ· Ğ½ĞµÑĞºĞ¾Ğ»ÑŒĞºĞ¾ Ğ´ĞµÑÑÑ‚ĞºĞ¾Ğ² ÑˆĞ¾ĞºĞ¾Ğ²Ñ‹Ñ… ÑĞ¾Ğ»Ğ´Ğ°Ñ‚. P.S. ÑˆĞ¾ĞºĞ¾Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ¹ ÑĞ¾Ğ»Ğ´Ğ°Ñ‚ - ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ñ‚Ğ°ĞºĞ¾Ğ¹ Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ»Ğ°Ğ½ĞµÑ‚Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ ÑƒÑ€Ğ¾Ğ´, ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ°Ğ´Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ Ğ² Ğ²Ğ°Ñ 50% Ğ²Ñ‹ÑÑ‚Ñ€ĞµĞ»Ğ¾Ğ², ĞºĞ°Ğº Ğ±Ñ‹ Ğ²Ñ‹ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ±ĞµĞ³Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¸ Ğ²Ğ»ĞµĞ²Ğ¾ Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ¸ Ğ²Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ°Ğ²Ğ¾, Ğ° ĞµĞ³Ğ¾ Ğ»ÑĞ±Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ²Ñ‹ÑÑ‚Ñ€ĞµĞ» Ğ½Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¾ÑĞ¸Ñ‚ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ¼ĞµÑ€Ğ½Ğ¾ 10-15Ñ…Ğ¿. Ğ¢ĞµĞ¿ĞµÑ€ÑŒ Ğ¿Ñ€ĞµĞ´ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ²ÑŒÑ‚Ğµ ĞºĞ°ĞºĞ¾Ğµ Ğ½ÑƒĞ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ¸Ğ¼ĞµÑ‚ÑŒ ĞºĞ°Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ğ¾Ğµ Ñ‚ĞµÑ€Ğ¿ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğµ Ğ¸ ĞºĞ°ĞºĞ¸Ğµ Ğ½ÑƒĞ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ Ñ‚Ğ¸Ñ‚Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ‡ĞµÑĞºĞ¸Ğµ Ñ‚Ñ€ÑƒĞ´Ñ‹, Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ‹ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¹Ñ‚Ğ¸ ÑÑ‚Ñƒ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ñƒ Ğ½Ğ° Ğ¿Ğ¾ÑĞ»ĞµĞ´Ğ½ĞµĞ¹ ÑĞ»Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ¸. ĞšĞ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ‡Ğµ, Ğ³Ğ´Ğµ-Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ² Ğ¾Ğ±Ğ»Ğ°ÑÑ‚Ğ¸ Ğ±Ğ°Ğ»Ğ°Ğ½ÑĞ° Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ñ€Ğ°Ğ±Ñ‹ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ Ñ€ĞµÑˆĞ¸Ğ»Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ·Ğ°Ğ±Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ.

Ğ˜Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ³:
Ğ¯ Ñ€ĞµĞºĞ¾Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ğ´ÑƒÑ Ğ´Ğ°Ğ½Ğ½Ğ¾Ğµ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğµ Ğº Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ…Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ´ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ ĞºĞ°Ğ¶Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ¼Ñƒ Ñ„Ğ°Ğ½Ğ°Ñ‚Ñƒ Ñ…Ğ°Ğ»Ğ²Ñ‹. Ğ“Ğ»Ğ°Ğ²Ğ½Ğ¾Ğµ - Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ²Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€ÑĞ¹Ñ‚Ğµ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ñ Ğ¾ÑˆĞ¸Ğ±ĞºÑƒ Ğ¸ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ…Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸Ñ‚Ğµ ĞµÑ‘ Ğ½Ğ° Ğ¿Ğ¾ÑĞ»ĞµĞ´Ğ½ĞµĞ¹ ÑĞ»Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ¸ (Ñ Ğ²Ğ°Ñ ÑƒĞ²ĞµÑ€ÑÑ, Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ¸Ğ· ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ¹Ğ´ĞµÑ‚ Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ‡ĞµĞ³Ğ¾ Ñ…Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾ÑˆĞµĞ³Ğ¾). Ğ’ Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ° Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½ĞµĞ½Ğ° Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ñ€ĞµĞ²Ğ¾ÑÑ…Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ½Ğ¾. ĞĞ±ÑĞ¾Ğ»ÑÑ‚Ğ½Ğ¾ Ñ‡ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ·Ğ°ÑĞ»ÑƒĞ¶ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ğ°Ñ Ñ…Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾ÑˆĞ°Ñ Ğ¾Ñ†ĞµĞ½ĞºĞ° Ğ¸ Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ»Ğ¸Ñ‡Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ´ĞµĞ»Ğ°Ğ½Ğ½Ğ°Ñ Ñ€Ğ°Ğ±Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ° Ğ±ĞµĞ· Ğ¿Ğ¾Ñ‚Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‡ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ²Ñ€ĞµĞ¼ĞµĞ½Ğ¸ Ğ² Ğ¿ÑƒÑÑ‚ÑƒÑ.
