ĞŸĞ¾ Ğ´Ñ€ÑƒĞ³ÑƒÑ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ½Ñƒ Ğ±Ğ°Ñ€Ñ€Ğ¸ĞºĞ°Ğ´
Half-Life: Opposing Force Ğ¿Ñ€ĞµĞ´Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ²Ğ»ÑĞµÑ‚ ÑƒĞ½Ğ¸ĞºĞ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½ÑƒÑ Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ·Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ·Ğ° Ğ¿Ñ€ÑĞ¼Ñ‹Ñ… Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ½Ğ¸ĞºĞ¾Ğ² Ğ¤Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ğ° Ğ¸Ğ· Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ³Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ñ‹ - ÑĞ¾Ğ»Ğ´Ğ°Ñ‚. ĞŸÑ€Ğ¸ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼, ÑĞ¾Ğ±Ñ‹Ñ‚Ğ¸Ñ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¸ÑÑ…Ğ¾Ğ´ÑÑ‚ Ğ¿Ğ°Ñ€Ğ°Ğ»Ğ»ĞµĞ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾, Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ´Ğ° ĞºĞ¾ÑĞ²ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ĞµÑĞµĞºĞ°ÑÑÑŒ Ğ¸ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½ÑÑ Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ‰Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ğ¿Ğ°Ğ·Ğ» Ğ¸ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ¸, Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¸ÑÑ…Ğ¾Ğ´ÑÑ‰ĞµĞ¹ Ğ² Ğ§Ñ‘Ñ€Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¹ ĞœĞµĞ·Ğµ.

[ĞŸĞ»ÑÑÑ‹]
+ Ğ’ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ñƒ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ±Ğ°Ğ²Ğ»ĞµĞ½Ğ¾ Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒÑˆĞ¾Ğµ ĞºĞ¾Ğ»Ğ¸Ñ‡ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ñ‹Ñ… Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ½Ğ¸ĞºĞ¾Ğ², Ğ½ĞµĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‹Ğµ Ğ¸Ğ· ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‹Ñ… ÑĞ¿Ğ¾ÑĞ¾Ğ±Ğ½Ñ‹ Ñ€ĞµĞ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ñ‚Ñ€ĞµĞ¿Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ½ĞµÑ€Ğ²Ñ‹ Ğ² Ğ±Ğ¸Ñ‚Ğ²Ğ°Ñ… Ñ Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ¼Ğ¸;
+ ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ñ€Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ€Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ³ĞµĞ¹Ğ¼Ğ¿Ğ»ĞµĞ¹ Ñ Ğ½ĞµĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‹Ğ¼Ğ¸ Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ¼Ğ¸ Ğ¼ĞµÑ…Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸ĞºĞ°Ğ¼Ğ¸ Ğ¸ Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ·Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ÑÑ‚ÑĞ¼Ğ¸;
+ Ğ½ĞµĞ¿Ğ»Ğ¾Ñ…Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½ÑÑÑ‰Ğ¸Ğ¹ Half-Life ÑÑĞ¶ĞµÑ‚, Ğ¼ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ¼Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸ÑÑ‚Ğ½Ğ¾ ÑƒĞ´Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ»ÑÑÑ‰Ğ¸Ğ¹, Ğ° Ğ¼ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ¼Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¸ Ğ±ĞµÑÑÑ‚Ñ‹Ğ´Ğ½Ğ¾ ĞºĞ¾Ğ¿Ğ¸Ñ€ÑƒÑÑ‰Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ³Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½ÑƒÑ Ğ¸ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¸Ñ (Ğ¶Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒ, Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğµ ÑÑ‡Ğ¸Ñ‚Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ÑÑ ĞºĞ°Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ² Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¶ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğ¸ ÑĞµÑ€Ğ¸Ğ¸).

[ĞœĞ¸Ğ½ÑƒÑÑ‹]
- ĞĞµĞ¸Ğ½Ñ‚ĞµÑ€ĞµÑĞ½Ğ°Ñ Ñ„Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ°Ñ Ğ±Ğ¸Ñ‚Ğ²Ğ° Ñ Ğ±Ğ¾ÑÑĞ¾Ğ¼ (ÑĞ°Ğ¼ Ğ±Ğ¾ÑÑ Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğµ "Ñ‚ÑƒÑ…Ğ»Ñ‹Ğ¹"), Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¸ÑÑ…Ğ¾Ğ´ÑÑ‰Ğ°Ñ Ğ² ĞºĞ°ĞºĞ¾Ğ¼-Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ·Ğ°Ğ¶Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ·Ğ°Ğ¼ĞºĞ½ÑƒÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ñ€Ğ°Ğ½ÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğµ Ğ¸ Ğ·Ğ°ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ²Ğ»ÑÑÑ‰Ğ°Ñ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ²Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€ÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ½Ğ¸ Ğ¸ Ñ‚Ğµ Ğ¶Ğµ Ğ´ĞµĞ¹ÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ¸Ñ Ğ¸Ğ· Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ğ° Ğ² Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·;
- Ğ² Ñ†ĞµĞ»Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ·Ğ½Ğ°ĞºĞ¾Ğ¼Ñ‹Ğµ Ğ»Ğ¾ĞºĞ°Ñ†Ğ¸Ğ¸ Ğ¸ Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ´Ñ‹, ÑƒÑĞ¿ĞµĞ²Ğ°ÑÑ‰Ğ¸Ğµ Ğ½Ğ°ÑĞºÑƒÑ‡Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğº ĞºĞ¾Ğ½Ñ†Ñƒ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ñ‹.

[Ğ˜Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ³]
Ğ¥Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾ÑˆĞµĞµ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğµ, Ñ€Ğ°ÑÑˆĞ¸Ñ€ÑÑÑ‰ĞµĞµ ÑĞ¿ĞµĞºÑ‚Ñ€ Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ·Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ÑÑ‚ĞµĞ¹, Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ¾Ñ€ÑƒĞ¶ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ, Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ½Ğ¸ĞºĞ¾Ğ² Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ‡ĞµĞ³Ğ¾ Ğ¸Ğ· Half-Life.

[8 Ğ²Ñ‹ÑÑ‚Ñ€ĞµĞ»Ğ¾Ğ² Ğ¸Ğ· Ğ±Ğ°Ñ€Ğ½Ğ°ĞºĞ»Ğ° Ğ¸Ğ· 10]
 
ScribbleZz
281 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
10 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
61.9 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 13 novembre 2012
Opposing Force was the good expansion for Half-Life. It updated the graphics nicely, added many new weapons and provided an interesting perspective on the whole Black Mesa incident.

In Opposing Force you play the role of Adrian Shepard, a soldier sent to clean up the Black Mesa incident and ensure that nothing gets out. However, as with all things related to the Black Mesa facility, everything that can go wrong does go wrong and you'll soon find yourself on the losing side of a battle against increasingly powerful aliens hellbent on conquering earth and government elite troops sent to clean up you.

In terms of gameplay you will explore many new places in the Black Mesa facility however you will also often find yourself treading familiar paths and will even catch a glimpse of the Freeman himself on occasion.

All in all Opposing Force provides an interesting view of the Black Mesa incident through the eyes of one of Gordon Freeman's enemies and helps explain a lot of things they didn't fully cover in the original. Definitely worth a play for any fans of the original.
 
c00lizz

RecommandÃ©
10.8 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 1 avril 2022
Mais divertido e um pouco mais longo que Half-Life: Blue Shift, Half-Life: Opposing Force tambÃ©m Ã© uma campanha mostrando os eventos do jogo pelo ponto de vista de outra pessoa, dessa vez um soldado. Nada muito inovador comparado ao jogo original, mas Ã© um jogo querido por muitos fÃ£s da franquia.
------------------------------------------
More fun and slightly longer than Half-Life: Blue Shift, Half-Life: Opposing Force is also a campaign showing the game's events from the point of view of another person, this time a soldier. Nothing very groundbreaking compared to the original game, but it is a game dear to many fans of the franchise.

Non recommandÃ©
11.2 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 5 aout 2022
It's just not good.
The Black Ops aren't nearly as interesting to fight as the HECU. The new aliens feel the same to fight as the Black Ops. The game is buggy in ways that while rarely game breaking are annoying. The arsenal is bloated and it makes switching to your desired weapon a pain, it also makes keeping track of which weapons you've got ammo for a lot harder. The game takes just a bit too long between health resupplies meaning you're very likely to get stuck at an annoying part with not enough health.

REVIEW SOBRE HALF-LIFE NO GERAL

Joguei Half-Life pela primeira vez em 2020, entÃ£o essa review nÃ£o tem muito bias com relaÃ§Ã£o a nostalgia de jogo, mas devo deixar claro que joguei muito Counter-Strike 1.5/1.6 na infÃ¢ncia, que eram inicialmente mods de Half-Life e foram depois desenvolvidos na mesma engine, entÃ£o os grÃ¡ficos e a jogabilidade nÃ£o me eram estranhos ao jogar Half-Life.

Devemos deixar claro tambÃ©m um fato: Half-Life Ã© relativamente feio e datado hoje em dia, mas foi um inovador na Ã¡rea de FPS no tempo de seu lanÃ§amento, criando mecÃ¢nicas e elementos de experiÃªncia do usuÃ¡rio que sÃ£o usados atÃ© hoje, como a movimentaÃ§Ã£o em W, A, S, D, botÃ£o esquerdo pra atirar, etc. AtÃ© mesmo no level design o jogo impressiona pra Ã©poca, com salas secretas que sÃ³ quem prestar atenÃ§Ã£o consegue realmente encontrar e tambÃ©m com puzzles pra avanÃ§ar na histÃ³ria, que nÃ£o eram comuns em jogos de FPS da Ã©poca.

Para quem se importa com a histÃ³ria dos jogos e quer jogar esse jogo pelo valor histÃ³rico, ele definitivamente vale a pena. Ã‰ um jogo difÃ­cil sem necessariamente ser frustrante. Entretanto, se os grÃ¡ficos ou a jogabilidade mais antiga nÃ£o te agradam, hoje em dia existe uma opÃ§Ã£o extra se quiser experimentar a essÃªncia de Half-Life: o jogo chamado Black Mesa, uma reimaginaÃ§Ã£o de Half-Life com permissÃ£o de desenvolvimento da prÃ³pria Valve. Ã‰ preciso informar, entretanto, que Black Mesa nÃ£o possui nem a DLC Blue Shift, nem a Opposing Forces.

REVIEW SOBRE A DLC OPPOSING FORCE

Half-Life: Opposing Force Ã© diferente do original e da DLC Blue Shift. Nela vocÃª assume o papel dos "vilÃµes" do original, com a tarefa de eliminar Gordon Freeman. Esse jogo Ã© incrÃ­vel, porque faz toda a sua perspectiva nos dois outros jogos virar de ponta cabeÃ§a, comeÃ§ando a questionar sua prÃ³pria moral e a moral dos que eram considerados mocinhos. Esse jogo, assim como Blue Shift, se passa no mesmo espaÃ§o de tempo que o jogo original, mas com uma perspectiva diferente. Enquanto o original se passa em, aproximadamente, dois dias completos (16 de maio de 200x e 17 de maio de 200x), Opposing Force se passa apenas em um dos dias (17 de maio de 200x, mas tambÃ©m tem cenas bem curtas em marÃ§o de 200x com o personagem treinando pro combate e cenas no dia 18 de maio de 20xx, mostrando uma pequena repercussÃ£o do que acontece apÃ³s o final do jogo original).

Ã‰ interessante jogar se vocÃª jogou o original porque coloca em dimensÃ£o os lados diferentes da histÃ³ria e tambÃ©m o quÃ£o absurdo era o protagonista Gordon Freeman em comparaÃ§Ã£o aos outros nesse mesmo universo. AlÃ©m disso, algumas coisas que acontecem no original sÃ£o explicadas em Opposing Force. Mas de novo, Ã© mais do mesmo, se vocÃª nÃ£o gostou do primeiro, evite as DLCs Blue Shift e Opposing Force.

Half-Life: Opposing Force 8/10 - MUITO BOM

I have spent the last week playing the original Half Life and it's DLCs. I was extremely impressed by these games - not only was the game-play and gun-play brilliant but so was the story. RecommandÃ©
4.4 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 10 janvier 2019
As the first expansion pack for Half-Life 1, you trade in your HEV suit and step into the boots of Cpl. Adrian Shephard as you experience Black Mesa from a different perspective, being that of the military.

Being an expansion pack, Opposing Force introduces new weapons and enemies that you'll encounter along the way as you work towards your goal of eliminating Gordon Freeman.

A definite must have for fans of Half-Life 1.

Al ser como una pequeÃ±a expansiÃ³n de Half-Life, solo comentarÃ© los 2 puntos mÃ¡s destacables.

Jugabilidad

En cuanto a jugabilidad, como es obvio, es igual que el primer Half-Life. O lo que es lo mismo, un shooter que pese a tener mÃ¡s de 10 aÃ±os, se hace super disfrutable.
De hecho, para tener un pequeÃ±o cambio de aires, en este juego te encuentras â™¥â™¥â™¥ algunas armas distintas de las del primer Half-Life. Algunas muy divertidas de usar, otras un poco tostÃ³n, pero mola el cambio igualmente.

Historia

El ver la trama desde otro punto de vista, te desvela varias cosas que se quedaron un poco en el limbo en el primer Half-Life. Como por quÃ© llegaron soldados, su opiniÃ³n al respecto, o que ocurriÃ³ â™¥â™¥â™¥ ellos al final de todo el lÃ­o.

En general recomiendo jugar este jueguito una vez os pasÃ©is el Half-Life. Es cortito (5-6 horas), descubrÃ­s cosas nuevas del conflicto, y estÃ¡ tan bien hecho como cualquier otro Half-Life.

Excellent expension pack pour Half-Life en 1999.

Il offre le point de vue d'un militaire, Adrian Shepard, parti "normalement" nettoyer Black Mesa au moment oÃ¹ Gordon a foirÃ© l'expÃ©rience. Ã‰videmment, il faut avoir jouer au premier pour comprendre. Il dure environ 4-5h.

J'ai trouvÃ© l'histoire assez sympa, dans le thÃ¨me, sachant que Ã§a n'avait pas Ã©tÃ© dÃ©veloppÃ© par Valve Ã  l'Ã©poque, mais par GearBox, une entreprise de jeu fidÃ¨le Ã  sa rÃ©putation de l'Ã©poque ( je crois que de nos jours, ce n'est plus la mÃªme chose... ).

Vous avez le choix entre tuer tout le monde ou pas, Ã§a n'a pas d'influance sur l'histoire, Ã©vitez quand mÃªme de zigouiller vos potes militaires, car eux sont tous autant trÃ¨s utiles les uns que les autres, vous avez des mÃ©decins, des ingÃ©nieurs ( capitaux pour ouvrir les portes pour progresser dans l'histoire ) et des mitrailleurs, sans compter des shotgunners et des riflers. C'est une IA trÃ¨s basique, elle est un peu dure d'oreille pour suivre, mais Ã§a va, pas trop de difficultÃ©, le pathfinder est correct.

La variÃ©tÃ© d'armes est identique au premier, avec l'addition d'un grappin/variante de l'arme abeille alien, et une variante du revolver. Les ennemis aussi ont quelques variantes, et le pack HD pour armes offre une toute autre alternative pour toutes les armes, ce qui est vachement bien pour un DLC de 1999.

Certains puzzles sont en revanche mal expliquÃ©s, il faut bien rÃ©flÃ©chir avant d'agir, sinon on fonce droit dans le mur, il y a de la crÃ©ativitÃ© pour vaincre certains ennemis, et le grappin donne un peu de platforming.

Au niveau de la difficultÃ©, ouaip, les ennemis sont deux fois plus forts, il y en a des nouveaux beaucoup plus difficiles, la vie et l'armure descendent trÃ¨s rapidement si vous ne faites pas gaffe, sachant que c'est assez logique ; vous n'Ãªtes pas Gordon, vous n'avez pas sa prÃ©cieuse armure.

Autrement, un trÃ¨s bon Ã©lÃ©ment dans la collection Half-Life, la soundtrack n'est pas le point fort du jeu, mais il y a quelques instants oÃ¹ le jeu vous indique certains moments clÃ©s via les musiques, mais Ã§a s'arrÃªte Ã  Ã§a.

Si un jour, un remake se fait de ce jeu, Ã§a serait que du bonheur, c'est un jeu que je recommande Ã  100% pour tout les fans de la sÃ©rie.

LORAZ
928 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
26 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
11.3 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 21 dÃ©cembre 2015
This game is buggy and it crashes. I think this has more to do with the Steampipe version as I don't recall having any issue when I first played this game 10+ years ago. The game crashes when you sometimes load or go back a map meaning that you have to go back to the last autosave at times. There are numerus bugs throughout the game, you often get stuck in lifts and you can get stuck in walls during map translation (although that is also present in HL), furthermore there is a section where the roof of a lift goes through the bottom acting as separate lifts if one part gets blocked. There is one section where a scripted NPC is talking and mid-sentence he says one of the random idle lines and doesnâ€™t finish the scripted line. But more importantly there is a major sound issue right at the end, the volume level of a section of a map is really really high, if you were playing the games moderately loud with headphones this could literally cause pain before you were able to turn the volume down.

As for the game itself, the map design doesnâ€™t match that of Half-Lifeâ€™s. In HL everything was well thought through and everything was in its place, in this things are a bit random. A couple of times there are scripted sequences that open up your path, these are obvious and makes the game fell scripted. There are reused sections from HL, although these have been altered and are not meant to be the same place as the ones visited in the original, there is even one section that seemed to be reference to a map in HL but it was evidently different and happened after another map, where that map happened first in the original. In addition there is not much of a story, at all.

The same can be said for the enemies, they are uninspired, overpowered and are just there to be something new. Valve cut a lot of content from the original because it wasnâ€™t that great, Gearbox hasnâ€™t seemed to have done that. A lot of the enemies are just not that fun to fight, and furthermore the use of the Black Ops in the original was infrequent, because they were much more powerful than the grunts. In this, they are used way too often, although most donâ€™t go invisible. But ultimately Gearbox was just using an enemy that wasnâ€™t used that much in the original, instead of what they should have done is create new human enemies, perhaps Black Mesa security forces or something. The use of the new aliens and overuse of the Black Ops was just an easy way to make the game seem different to the original, a lot of really good enemies were not used purely because they were used in the original.

The same can be said for the weapons, a lot of really good weapons from the original are not there and instead you have gimmicks and there are far too many of them. Furthermore there are way too many weapons that have regenerating ammo, once you get them you need never use bullets. There is a reason why Valve cut a lot of weapons from HL2, a methodology that Gearbox did not get.

But ultimately, this is not Half-Life, this was not made by Valve. It was a quick expansion made by Gearbox for those who liked the original. Considering that it is still a good game, it is not anywhere good as the original, but thatâ€™s more because of how good the original is. The design of the maps, weapons and enemies are uninspired, but it is still a Half-Life expansion, so itâ€™s ok.
 
Dark Light

Non recommandÃ©
10.2 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 1 janvier 2022
Here you will see why I love Half-Life: Opposing Force, but in my review you will read about why I gave it a negative review due to some problems.

I love Half-Life: Opposing Force I love the story behind Shepherd. I love being able to play from the views of a United States Army soldier (U.S.) to catch Gordon Freeman and in Half-Life the United States Army soldiers (U.S) Artificial Intelligence (A.I.) of the NPC's they try to kill the Black Mesa NPC's, I do not try to do that in Half-Life: Opposing Force at all.

Now I remember back in 2005 when I first played Half-Life: Opposing Force it had DirectX 8 support and now with VALVe pushing Linux support and removing DirectX 8 from the Gold Source engine video games adding OpenGL support to the Gold Source engine video games I keep getting OpenGL errors every now and then and some freezing issues, which I do not remember ever happening with DirectX 8.

Here is a screenshot of one of the few OpenGL errors I experience here and there. Followed by freezing of the video games that use OpenGL, before crashing.

https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/887417416764768257/926930307003850792/OpenGL_errors_on_video_games_that_use_OpenGL_on_Windows.png

VALVe please add DirectX 8 support or at least a more up to date version of DirectX 9 support which supports 64-bit, which is DirectX 9.0C I believe?

I have that same save game bug that I have in Half-Life and Half-Life: Source.

Otherwise I cannot give Half-Life: Opposing Force a positive review due to these technical issues, which I cannot seem to fix even if I reinstall Windows or Half-Life: Opposing Force.
 
Johnathanamz

Mememaster 2.0
52 produits enregistrÃ©s

8 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
1 personne a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation amusante
0
RecommandÃ©
5.3 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 9 juin 2017
An enjoyable offshoot

As blasphemous as it may sound to some, I have personally gotten to like this 5-6 hour expansion pack more than the base game. While the controls, the graphics, and everything in between stayed the same, the storyline had no big gaps and was pretty consistent. The more frequent appearances by G-Man invoked a greater sense of mystery and left wondering what on earth he's trying to pull off. The new enemy types added some challenge, while several tie-ins with the main game (such as recognizable locations) gave a true sense of being "behind-the-scenes" of the primary narrative. The only minor turn-offs were a very boring final boss fight and the lack of a proper soundtrack yet again.

8/10
 
DM
561 produits enregistrÃ©s
2
6 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
13.4 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 16 aout 2015
Half-Life: Opposing Force is very well made expansion for Half Life. The ideas for the expansion are brilliant. Returning to the same research facility, but this time as Corporal Adrian Shephard, fighting government agents and aliens and wondering if I will meet myself (Gordon Freeman) at some point, if I can change the history, if more will be explained by experiencing it from a different perspective..

New enemies, new weapons, eventually an assistance of up to 3 fellow U.S. Marines. Even though I was playing it on medium difficulty as Half Life before, I felt like I was easier passing through the game with almost no moments of frustration.

What I didn't like about the expansion was night vision, being stuck in elevator glitch and the final boss fight. The night vision is way too green, which makes the walking in the darkness very unpleasant. Remember to save before you enter elevators or small tunnels. And finally the last boss frustration. I really liked the game, but the final boss took me 2 hours to kill. First I tried to shoot it and there I wasted most of my ammunition so after I figured out what needs to be done, I decided to use Shock Roach to defeat it. They said I just need to repeat all the action several times and it will eventually die. It didn't. This alien weapon is completely uneffective against it. Even though the final fight destroyed the extremely positive feeling I had about the game, I still recommended it. Avoid the frustration. Learn from mistakes of others. Enjoy the expansion!
 
PlasmaWasp

Out of the three original Half-life games/expansions this one is easily the best. Better weapons, better action, great level design with less platforming, it doesn't over stay it's welcome and on top of all that no Xen. Give it a try if you wanted more of a action oriented Half-Life.

Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 15 fÃ©vrier 2023
It's a classic 90s expansion pack. More Half-Life goodness with new weapons, new enemies (which aren't as good as the originals in my opinion but still good) and a decent length single player experience. All in all, still fun today, although I maintain the real ending is following Gordon into Xen at the Lambda Teleporter and creating a time paradox.

-ĞšĞ°ÑĞ°Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾ Ñ‚ĞµÑ…Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ‡ĞµÑĞºĞ¾Ğ¹ Ñ‡Ğ°ÑÑ‚Ğ¸ Ğ³Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ¾ÑĞ¾Ğ±Ğ¾ Ğ¸ Ğ½ĞµÑ‡ĞµĞ³Ğ¾ - Ğ²ÑÑ‘ Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ‚ Ğ¶Ğµ Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ³Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ HL,ÑĞ»ĞµĞ³ĞºĞ° ÑƒĞ»ÑƒÑ‡ÑˆĞµĞ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ´Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ¶Ğ¾Ğº,Ğ° Ğ²Ğ¾Ñ‚ Ñ‚ĞµÑ…Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ‡ĞµÑĞºĞ¸Ğµ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ±Ğ»ĞµĞ¼Ñ‹ ĞµÑÑ‚ÑŒ.Ğ›Ğ¸Ñ‡Ğ½Ğ¾ Ñ Ğ²ÑÑ‚Ñ€ĞµÑ‚Ğ¸Ğ» "Ğ¡Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ´Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¼ ĞŸÑƒÑÑ‚Ñ‹Ğ½Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ ĞŸĞ°Ñ†Ğ¸Ñ„Ğ¸ÑÑ‚Ğ°" - Desert Eagle Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ‡ÑŒ Ğ¾Ñ‚ĞºĞ°Ğ·Ñ‹Ğ²Ğ°Ğ»ÑÑ ÑÑ‚Ñ€ĞµĞ»ÑÑ‚ÑŒ, Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ°Ğ´Ğ°ÑÑ‰Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ğ·Ğ²ÑƒĞº,Ğ° Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸Ğ½ Ñ€Ğ°Ğ· Opposing Force Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ñ€ĞµÑˆĞ¸Ğ»Ğ° Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ»ĞµÑ‚ĞµÑ‚ÑŒ.Ğ’ Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ²ÑÑ‘ Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ»Ğ¸Ñ‡Ğ½Ğ¾.

Old but Good.

Pretty good game even in the recent year of 2020. Only complaint that I have is the lack of direction in some maps. but that could just be my small brain not figuring out things a normal human being would. either way, great game 10/10.

RecommandÃ©
5.1 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 21 mars 2015
The game follows the storyline of the original Half-Life game but goes even deeper showing the final hours before the destruction of the facility that weren't in the original game. The game follows a marine who is sent to a classified mission in Black Mesa.

The story is the same as the original Half-Life but from a different perspective. Some events that happened in the original game can also be seen in this game adding to the experience if you've played the original game. Later, the player encounters completely new types of enemies.

The game has the same feel as the original Half-Life with all the puzzles and boss fights. Overall the game is very fun to play and is a great FPS experience.
 
jgfghfhgf

5 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile

RecommandÃ©
4.9 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 17 janvier 2022
Most of my pals and I hadn't played Opposing Force, because 20 years ago, it wasn't easy to get your hands on an Expansion Pack, at least where I lived. I had played Half Life, but never got to try this. I had it on Steam for years, but never felt like playing it because it was too old, I already knew the story. Until now though, I wanted to give it a shot a couple of days ago and boy I was not disappointed. It felt fun, it had a good singleplayer experience unlike the contemporary games. The story was captivating too, I honestly feel Adrian Shephard (the protagonist) is underused in Half Life series, I hope he'll be a recurring character in upcoming Half Life sequeahaahahahhahahahah just kidding there will be no 3rd.

Ğ ĞµĞºĞ¾Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ğ´ÑƒÑ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ, ÑÑĞ¶ĞµÑ‚ Ğ¾Ñ‡ĞµĞ½ÑŒ Ğ¸Ğ½Ñ‚ĞµÑ€ĞµÑĞµĞ½.
 
VENOĞœ
142 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
6 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
7.5 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 16 juin 2019
ALINTIDIR!
Gelmis gecmis en iyi 3 genisleme paketi arasina rahatlikla girecek mukemmel half life eklentisi.

Oyun valve tarafindan gelistirilmemesine ragmen orijinal senaryoyla ic ice gecen konu akisi, genel seri konusunu etkilememesi ancak black mesa'nin verdigi gercekcilik hissini gelistirebilmesi ile insanlarin seriye daha da baglanmasini saglamistir.

Opposing force'ta ilk oyunda yaratik - bilim adami herkesi temizlemeye gelen askerlerden birini oynariz. black mesa'da olaylar bas gostermis, gordon freeman ortalikta potansiyelini konusturmaya baslamis, biz de verilen gorevi (olaylari ortbas etmek) yerine getirmek icin ucaklarla black mesa'ya dogru ucarken xen'den gelen dev ucan yaratiklarin saldirisi nedeniyle ucagimiz black mesa yakinlarinda cakilinca hayatta kalmak icin mucadele etmeye baslariz.

Oyun â™¥â™¥â™¥ basarili yeni yaratik dusmanlar ekler, ozgun bir boss'u vardir ve bu boss'u oldurmek icin seriye yakisir bir bulmaca sunmayi basarir.

Oyundaki asil can alici atraksiyon ise black mesa'ya girmemizden itibaren ilk oyunda oynadigimiz serinin ana karakteri gordon freeman'in cevrede bir yerlerde oldugu hissini devamli olarak vermesidir. bir mekana gireriz, orda bir pencerenin ardindan bir odayi goruruz. ilk oyunda o odada gordon freeman olarak bulunmusuzdur, hatirlariz. ilerleriz duvarin otesinden ayak sesleri duyariz, gordon freeman kosmaktadir. yani gordon biraz once baktigimiz odadan tam da biz bakmadan once cikmistir. en guzeli de tam gordon freeman xen'e isinlanmak uzere actigi portala atlarken portalin oldugu mekana girmemizdir. gordon'u arkadan gorur, kosarak portala atlarken izleriz. tek kelimeyle harika bir deneyimdir, biliriz gordon'un o ana kadar yaptiklarini, o portali nasil actigini, ne catismalardan gectigini. ne de olsa ilk oyunda biz yaptik onlari.

Sonuc olarak sundugu yeni silahlar, yeni dusmanlar, half life ile ic ice gecen bir zaman araliginda vuku bulmasi ve gordon freeman'in varligini her an hissettirebilmesi nedeniyle seri icin yapilabilecek daha iyi bir genisleme paketi dusunemiyorum. half life oynayip bunu oynamadiysaniz siktirin gidin gozum gormesin sizi. serrefsizler. oyuncuyuz diye geciniyosunuz bi de.

RecommandÃ©
25.8 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 24 novembre 2020
I don't want to come off as a fan-boy, but, I can't really find anything wrong with this game. See, I was born in 1994 and exposed to M rated games at a very early age (I know, "I'm edgy AF") and the Half Life series was one of the few I was introduced to as a kid. Back then, you actually had to have that orange disk to play regular old Half Life; you know, the one that opened with Sierra's logo in space? Then from there I got hooked on Opposing Force, and then Blue Shift. It wasn't until much later into my early adolescent years that I discovered Counter Strike.

Anyways, these games were always a blast to play. Blowing up aliens, the mercenaries, and the assassins and then watching their gibs fly everywhere was always a hoot for me. I loved the fact that they introduced the "next stage of mutation" zombie where they throw their own blood at you. I loved having a heavy crowbar, a regular crowbar, and a knife. Plus, in general, all the newer weapons. This game is addicting and I'll play this game to kill a couple hours before returning to working. 10/10
 
PandastcASMR

La historia no es tan densa como la original pero deja bien cerrado esta trilogia. 1,289 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
6 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
8.7 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 6 aout 2018
Half Life 1 was great. This game, while being about half as long from start to end, is just as good as the HL 1. Maybe even better in some circumstances. It offers several new weapons not found in Half Life, at the expense of a few from HL1 not appearing at all. In addition, not only does Opposing Force have new weapons and level design, it has has entirly new enemy types, mostly for the aliens which you spend most of the game fighting, unlike HL1 where you alternated between military and aliens for most of the game. One of the other benefits is that it doesn't have any real BAD levels. While HL1 had excellent level design, with good mix of shooting, platforming, and puzzle solving, it also had several moments or levels that fustrated me greatly. From my playthrough of this, I can only really recall a couple of moments that bothered me personally (like the area where if you hit certain explosives you instantly die, just like in HL1 or the final area with the high and strong enemy count). Though it was less the levels themselves and more the enemies you fight. Compared to HL1, Opposing Force throws you against stronger enemies a lot more often, and while it's not terrible, I found it easier to ignore some battles rather than fight my way through. Especially in the final area where they have several rooms that just throw enemies at you with reckless abandon. This does work well for people who wanted a tougher game, but I feel like Half-Life 1 was at a good level of challenge, minus some cheap â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ it pulled. So I'm not sure if I like the higher base difficulty overall. Another issue is that like Blue Shift, the story is pretty much throwaway. Though, I do appreciate that we see a different view of the situation, even if I think they could have done more with it. (These guys are supposed to go after Freeman, making them like the bad guys killing everything. But then they just turn out to be victims too, which I feel was kind of a cop out) Overall, while there are a few nags I have with the game, it's far outwieghed by the positives of being more Half-Life 1, and the new things it brought to the table. That doesn't even include multiplayer. Yeah, this game had multiplayer. Really odd, but still a nice addition regardless. If you have a spare $5 (or less if you wait for the Valve bundle pack sale) and want more Half-Life, this is an easy yes. You owe it to yourself to play it if you like Half-Life, but haven't touched this game at all.
 
Marcueid

- Level design was fun and made some sense
- Voice work (for the time) was great too
- Great final boss
- Overall fun and engaging campaign

RecommandÃ©
7.8 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 30 janvier 2022
This game has an amazing story, new weapons, great level design, lots of enemy types and much more, so it must mean it's a great game, right? Well, yes, it is, but an awful amount of bugs and glitches sometimes made me angry. I have experienced countless crashes, corrupted saves, many times I got stuck inside walls and sometimes levels bugged. The AI of your friendly marines can sometimes be annoying as hell, also the graphics and controls also didn't age well. It's a great game if you can withstand those things and if you like classic games. I would like this game on sale instead of the full price. If its on sale its usually -80%, sometimes even -90% or you can get it in a package with some other games. btw i forgot to mention you probably can download some patches but i never tried.
 
DanielCZ7

Et aujourd'hui ? Pareil que pour Half-Life, "difficile si vous avez moins de 25 ans et Ãªtes habituÃ©s aux jeux modernes" : le jeu Ã  pas mal vieilli techniquement et c'est normal. (Bundan sonra yazacaklarÄ±m spoiler olucak) Xen dÃ¼nyasÄ±ndan black mesaya girmeye Ã§alÄ±ÅŸan Ã¶nemli bir boss'u Ã¶ldÃ¼rdÃ¼kten sonra Gman bizi aynÄ± gordona yaptÄ±ÄŸÄ± gibi zaman boÅŸluÄŸuna hapsediyor.

Oyunun eksileri, yani Ã§Ä±ktÄ±ÄŸÄ± dÃ¶neme gÃ¶re Ã§ok bir eksisi yok ama beni en Ã§ok rahatsÄ±z eden ÅŸey size yardÄ±m(!) etmeye Ã§alÄ±ÅŸan npcler oluyor. Tamamen size zararlar o yÃ¼zden bÃ¼yÃ¼k bir kÄ±smÄ±nÄ± onlarÄ± peÅŸime takmadan oynadÄ±m.

0
RecommandÃ©
11.9 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 4 mars 2018
A great example of how expansions (or DLC) should be made!

Opposing Force managed to differentiate itself just enough from the original Half-Life, while remaining fun and non-repetitive.

The story was quite interesting, as you take the role of Corporal Shephard, a military specialist assigned to eliminate Gordon Freeman, after the initial events of the first game.

During his mission you encounter a big variety of enemies, both human and alien. The aliens especially were quite many.
As usual, the G-Man made a few cameo appearances as well, while observing and evaluating you.

Many new weapons were included too and particularly the alien ones were a nice innovation from the original game and made you truly feel how it is to play on the alien side (a few years before Halo successfully did it, too).

Aside from the added enemies and weapons, new allies came along too: the medic and the engineer, which could respectively heal you in battle and enable you to access new areas. This was another nice addition, from the allies of the original that could only follow you and assist you for a bit.

The length was also good enough for an expansion, about half the duration of Half-Life (duh).
Revisiting Xen was nice too.

All in all, Opposing Force was a good nostalgia trip, on the trail of what made the first game great.
Recommended definitely!
 
Buttman
0

RecommandÃ©
11.1 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 6 fÃ©vrier 2020
Produit reÃ§u gratuitement

You know what? This is actually more enjoyable than the base game. The platforming segments are still hella obtuse sometimes (like glitching yourself through a window that you ought to be able to just crawl through to get onto a swinging platform that is impossible to access otherwise), but since the game is so short, it doesn't drag on like HL1 does. I also found the black ops to be a lot more fun to fight than the HECU. And since the action-y parts are closer together on account of there being less platforming segments, it was just all around more fun.

Not that I mind the inbetween parts. HL2 has less action and more "inbetween" parts than HL1 and yet it *feels* more action-packed because you aren't getting stuck on contrived environmental puzzles every 5 minutes. Even when the solutions aren't obvious, they are still more discoverable without holding the player's hand, i.e. the level design is better. I'm going on a tangent though. Point is, yes, OF is as good as they say it is.
 
Braden

A nice expansion with more weapons and new enemies. Hit scan still sucks and Shock Troopers are a nuisance, final boss was a bit dull too but at least it was easier than Nihilanth. Still worth playing if you want some more Half in your Life.

Netshu
325 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
4 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
7.0 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 30 septembre 2015
Half-Life: Opposing Force is an expansion for the original Half-Life. This time you are Corporal Shepard, a soldier tasked with hunting down Gordon Freeman while fending of aliens at the same time. It soon turns out that in general chaos everyone fights everyone, including new alien species and black ops soldiers.

There are a few new weapons (alien lightning gun, Desert Eagle) and some new features. You get to lead other soldiers with various specialties: engineer who can cut doors, medic who can heal you. You learn to climb ropes and at one point you can use alien technology of grappling gun.

Graphics is not great, but it's cool enough and the level design with brilliant color schemes and lighting styles makes up for it.

Music sets the mood nicely, especially dynamic themes when something serious is going down.

It's 2015 and I definitely enjoyed playing Half-Life: Opposing Force!

GAMEPLAY 8/10
GRAPHICS 7/10
AUDIO 8/10
STORY 9/10

Ğ§Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ñ‚Ğ°ĞºĞ¾Ğµ Half-Life: Opposing Force? Ğ­Ñ‚Ğ¾ - ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ½ ĞºĞ°Ñ‡ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ°, ĞºĞ°Ğº Ğ¸ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ, Ñ‚Ğ°Ğº Ğ¸ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ñ‹, Ğ² Ğ¶Ğ°Ğ½Ñ€Ğµ FPS, Ğ¿Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼Ñƒ, ÑÑ€Ğ°Ğ·Ñƒ Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ¹Ğ´Ñ‘Ğ¼ Ğº Ğ¿Ğ»ÑÑĞ°Ğ¼ Ğ¸ Ğ¼Ğ¸Ğ½ÑƒÑĞ°Ğ¼:

ĞŸĞ»ÑÑÑ‹:

ĞĞ¸ĞºĞ°ĞºĞ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ñ‚ÑƒĞ¿Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ñ‡Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°, Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒĞºĞ¾ Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¿Ñ€ÑĞ¶Ñ‘Ğ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ğµ ÑÑ…Ğ²Ğ°Ñ‚ĞºĞ¸, Ğ¸ Ñ‡Ğ°ÑÑ‚ĞµĞ½ÑŒĞºĞ¾ Ğ²Ğ°Ğ¼ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ´Ñ‘Ñ‚ÑÑ Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¿Ñ€ÑĞ³Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ ÑĞ²Ğ¾Ñ Ğ³Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ²Ñƒ Ğ´Ğ»Ñ Ñ€ĞµÑˆĞµĞ½Ğ¸ÑÑ… Ğ³Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğº, Ñ…Ğ¾Ñ‚Ñ Ğ¾ÑĞ¾Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ½ĞµÑ‡ĞµĞ³Ğ¾ ÑĞ»Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ½ĞµÑ‚. ĞšĞ°Ğº ÑƒĞ¶Ğµ ÑĞºĞ°Ğ·Ğ°Ğ», ÑÑ…Ğ²Ğ°Ñ‚ĞºĞ¸ Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¿Ñ€ÑĞ¶Ñ‘Ğ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ğµ, Ğ¾Ñ‡ĞµĞ½ÑŒ Ğ¸Ğ½Ñ‚ĞµÑ€ĞµÑĞ½Ñ‹Ğµ, Ğ±ÑƒĞ´ĞµĞ¼ Ğ²Ğ¾ĞµĞ²Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ - Ğ³Ğ´Ğµ Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¼ Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒĞºĞ¾ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ´Ñ‘Ñ‚ÑÑ! - Ğ² ÑĞµĞºÑ€ĞµÑ‚Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ¸ÑÑĞ»ĞµĞ´Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ÑŒÑĞºĞ¾Ğ¼ ĞºĞ¾Ğ¼Ğ¿Ğ»ĞµĞºÑĞµ, Ğ² Ğ³Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ°Ñ…, Ğ² Ğ¼Ğ¸Ñ€Ğµ Xen Ğ¸ Ñ‚.Ğ´. ĞŸĞ¾Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¼ Ğ² ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ±ÑƒĞ´ĞµÑ‚ Ğ¾Ğ±ÑˆĞ¸Ñ€Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ°Ñ€ÑĞµĞ½Ğ°Ğ» Ğ¸Ğ· Ğ²ÑĞµĞ²Ğ¾Ğ·Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ¾Ñ€ÑƒĞ¶Ğ¸Ñ, Ğ¸ Ğ½Ğ°ÑˆĞ¸ ÑĞ¾ÑĞ·Ğ½Ğ¸ĞºĞ¸ - Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ñ‡Ğ°Ğ½Ğµ, ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‹Ğµ Ğ¸Ğ¼ĞµĞµÑ‚ ÑĞ²Ğ¾Ğ¸ Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¸ (Ğ¼ĞµĞ´Ğ¸Ğº, ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶ĞµÑ‚ Ğ²Ğ°Ñ Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ»ĞµÑ‡Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ, ÑĞ²Ğ°Ñ€Ñ‰Ğ¸Ğº, ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ€ĞµĞ¶ĞµÑ‚ Ğ°Ğ²Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ³ĞµĞ½Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ²Ğ°Ğ¼ Ğ´Ğ²ĞµÑ€ÑŒ Ğ´Ğ»Ñ Ğ´Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½ĞµĞ¹ÑˆĞµĞ³Ğ¾ Ğ¿ÑƒÑ‚Ğ¸ Ğ¸ Ñ‚.Ğ´.) Ğ¸ Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ÑĞ¾Ğ½Ğ°Ğ» ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ½ĞµÑÑ‡Ğ°ÑÑ‚Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ¸ÑÑĞ»ĞµĞ´Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ÑŒÑĞºĞ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ñ†ĞµĞ½Ñ‚Ñ€Ğ°. Ğ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ² Ğ²Ğ°Ñ Ğ±ÑƒĞ´ÑƒÑ‚ Ğ¸ Ğ»ÑĞ´Ğ¸, Ğ¸Ğ· ÑĞµĞºÑ€ĞµÑ‚Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ´Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ğ´ĞµĞ»ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ Black Ops, Ğ¸ Ğ°Ğ¶ Ğ´Ğ²Ğµ Ñ€Ğ°ÑÑ‹ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸ÑˆĞµĞ»ÑŒÑ†ĞµĞ²!

+ Ğ¡ÑĞ¶ĞµÑ‚. Ğ—Ğ°Ğ²ÑĞ·ĞºĞ° Ñ‚Ğ°ĞºĞ¾Ğ²Ğ°: ÑĞ¾Ğ»Ğ´Ğ°Ñ‚Ñ‹ Ğ¸Ğ· Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ´Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ğ´ĞµĞ»ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ Hazardous Environment Combat Unit Ğ»ĞµÑ‚ÑÑ‚ Ğ½Ğ° Ğ·Ğ°Ğ´Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸Ğµ Ğ² ĞºĞ¾Ğ¼Ğ¿Ğ»ĞµĞºÑ Black Mesa, Ğ² ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¼ ÑĞ»ÑƒÑ‡Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ¾ÑÑŒ Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾-Ñ‚Ğ¾ ÑÑ‚Ñ€Ğ°ÑˆĞ½Ğ¾Ğµ (ĞšĞ°ÑĞºĞ°Ğ´Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ñ€ĞµĞ·Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ°Ğ½Ñ Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ±Ğ¸ÑˆÑŒ), Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ğ¾ Ğ¿ÑƒÑ‚Ğ¸ Ñ‚ÑƒĞ´Ğ° Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ°Ğ´Ğ°ÑÑ‚ Ğ² Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ´Ñ€ÑĞ³Ñƒ - Ğ¸ Ğ²ĞµÑ€Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ»Ñ‘Ñ‚ ÑĞ±Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ°ÑÑ‚, Ğ¸ Ğ³Ğ»Ğ°Ğ²Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¼Ñƒ Ğ³ĞµÑ€Ğ¾Ñ - 22-ÑƒÑ… Ğ»ĞµÑ‚Ğ½ĞµĞ¼Ñƒ ĞºĞ°Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ°Ğ»Ñƒ Ğ¨ĞµĞ¿Ğ¿Ğ°Ñ€Ğ´Ñƒ, Ğ¾Ñ‡Ğ½ÑƒĞ²ÑˆĞ¸Ğ¼ÑÑ Ğ±ĞµĞ· Ğ¾Ñ€ÑƒĞ¶Ğ¸Ñ, Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¼Ñƒ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ´Ñ‘Ñ‚ÑÑ ÑĞ²Ğ¾Ğ¸Ğ¼Ğ¸ ÑĞ¸Ğ»Ğ°Ğ¼Ğ¸ Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ±Ğ¸Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‚ÑÑ Ğ¸Ğ· Ğ¼ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ° ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ²ÑˆĞµĞ¼Ñƒ Ğ°Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ¼...
Ğ Ğ´Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒÑˆĞµ ÑÑĞ¶ĞµÑ‚ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ°Ñ‘Ñ‚ÑÑ Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¼ Ğ²Ğ½ÑƒÑ‚Ñ€ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ğµ, Ñ‡ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ· Ğ´Ñ€ÑƒĞ³Ğ¸Ñ… Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ÑĞ¾Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¶ĞµĞ¹, Ñ‡ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ· ÑĞ°Ğ¼Ñƒ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ñƒ - Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ½Ğ° Ğ¸Ğ· Ğ³Ğ»Ğ°Ğ²Ğ½Ñ‹Ñ… Ğ¾ÑĞ¾Ğ±ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ğ¾ÑÑ‚ĞµĞ¹ Half-life. Ğ¡ÑĞ¶ĞµÑ‚ Ñ…Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ñˆ, Ğ¸Ğ½Ñ‚Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ³ÑƒĞµÑ‚, Ğ¸ Ğ´Ğ°Ñ‘Ñ‚ Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¼ Ğ¼Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ¸Ğ½Ñ„Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¼Ğ°Ñ†Ğ¸Ğ¸ Ğ¾ Ğ²ÑĞµĞ»ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¹ Half-life.

+ ĞÑ‚Ğ¼Ğ¾ÑÑ„ĞµÑ€Ğ°. Ğ”ĞµĞ¹ÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ¸Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾, Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ° ĞµÑÑ‚ÑŒ, Ğ½ĞµĞ¼Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ´Ñ€ÑƒĞ³Ğ°Ñ, Ğ½ĞµĞ¶ĞµĞ»Ğ¸ Ğ² Half-life - Ğ·Ğ´ĞµÑÑŒ Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ° Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ»ĞµĞµ Ğ±Ğ¾ĞµĞ²Ğ°Ñ, Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğ¸ Ñ‡ÑƒÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ½Ğµ Ñ…ÑƒĞ¶Ğµ. ĞŸÑ€Ğ¸Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ·Ğ´ĞµÑÑŒ Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ñ‘Ñ‚ÑÑ Ğ¿Ñ€ĞµĞºÑ€Ğ°ÑĞ½ĞµĞ¹ÑˆĞ¸Ğ¹ ÑĞ°ÑƒĞ½Ğ´Ñ‚Ñ€ĞµĞº.

+ Ğ¢ĞµÑ…Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ‡ĞµÑĞºĞ¸Ğµ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ±Ğ°Ğ²Ğ»ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ. Ğ¢Ğ°Ğº ĞºĞ°Ğº OpFor - ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ ĞĞ´-Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ½, Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğµ, Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ²ÑÑĞºĞ¸Ğµ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ±Ğ°Ğ²ĞºĞ¸ Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğµ Ğ½ÑƒĞ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ¼ĞµÑ‚Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ. Ğ˜ Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ¼ĞµÑ‚Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ Ñ‚ÑƒÑ‚ ĞµÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾: ĞºÑƒÑ‡Ñƒ Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ¾Ñ€ÑƒĞ¶Ğ¸Ñ, Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ñ‹Ñ… Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ½ÑÑ‚Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ², Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ñ‹Ñ… Ñ‚ĞµÑ…Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ‡ĞµÑĞºĞ¸Ñ… Ğ¸ Ğ³Ñ€Ğ°Ñ„Ğ¸Ñ‡ĞµÑĞºĞ¸Ñ… Ñ„Ğ¸ÑˆĞµĞº, Ğ²ÑÑ‘ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ´Ğ°Ñ‘Ñ‚ ÑĞ¾ÑĞºÑƒÑ‡Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒÑÑ - Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ·Ğ½Ğ°Ñ‡Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ğ»ÑÑ.

+ Ğ‘Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒÑˆĞ¾Ğµ ĞºĞ¾Ğ»Ğ¸Ñ‡ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒĞ·Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ÑŒÑĞºĞ¸Ñ… Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸Ñ„Ğ¸ĞºĞ°Ñ†Ğ¸Ğ¹.

â€¢ Ğ ÑƒÑÑĞºĞ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ ÑĞ·Ñ‹ĞºĞ° Ğ½ĞµÑ‚. (Ğ•ÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ñ€ÑƒÑĞ¸Ñ„Ğ¸ĞºĞ°Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‹)
â€¢ Ğ”Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ¸Ğ¶ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ Ğ¸ ĞºĞ¾Ğ»Ğ»ĞµĞºÑ†Ğ¸Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ğµ ĞºĞ°Ñ€Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ‡ĞºĞ¸ Steam Ğ¾Ñ‚ÑÑ‚ÑƒÑ‚ÑĞ²ÑƒÑÑ‚.
â€¢ ĞŸĞ¾ ÑĞºĞ¸Ğ´ĞºĞµ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ° ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¸Ñ‚ ~32 Ñ€ÑƒĞ±Ğ»Ñ.
â€¢ Ğ’Ñ€ĞµĞ¼Ñ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ…Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ´ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ Ğ²Ğ°Ñ€ÑŒĞ¸Ñ€ÑƒĞµÑ‚ÑÑ. Ğ’Ñ‹ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶ĞµÑ‚Ğµ Ğ±Ñ‹ÑÑ‚Ñ€Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ±ĞµĞ¶Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ñƒ Ğ·Ğ° 4-5 Ñ‡Ğ°ÑĞ¾Ğ², Ğ° Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶ĞµÑ‚Ğµ Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ»Ğ¸Ñ‡Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ²ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ¸ Ñ‡Ğ°ÑĞ¾Ğ² ÑĞ´Ğ°Ğº 12-13. ĞÑƒ Ğ° Ğ¼ÑƒĞ»ÑŒÑ‚Ğ¸Ğ¿Ğ»ĞµĞµÑ€ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶ĞµÑ‚ Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ»Ğ¸Ñ‡Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ²Ğ°Ñ Ğ·Ğ°Ñ‚ÑĞ½ÑƒÑ‚ÑŒ. Ğ ĞµÑĞ»Ğ¸ Ğ¸ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ·Ğ°Ñ‚ÑĞ½ÑƒÑ‚ÑŒ, Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ñƒ Ğ²Ğ°Ñ Ğ²ÑĞµĞ³Ğ´Ğ° Ğ±ÑƒĞ´ĞµÑ‚ Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ·Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ñ…Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾ÑˆĞ¾ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ²ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ¸ Ğ² Ğ½Ñ‘Ğ¼ Ğ¿Ğ°Ñ€Ñƒ Ğ¼Ğ°Ñ‚Ñ‡ĞµĞ¹.


Ğ˜Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ³:
Half-Life: Opposing Force - ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ğ´ĞµÑ‚Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ°Ğ±Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ°Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ°Ğ´Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ½, Ğ´Ğ° Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ñ‚Ğ°Ğ¼ Ğ°Ğ´Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ½ - Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ´ĞµĞ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ°Ñ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ°, Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ²Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€ÑÑÑŒ - ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ½ ĞºĞ°Ñ‡ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ° FPS Ğ¸ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğ¹.
Ğ’ÑĞµĞ¼ Ñ€ĞµĞºĞ¾Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ğ´ÑƒÑ Ğº ÑƒĞ¿Ğ¾Ñ‚Ñ€ĞµĞ±Ğ»ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ. 10\10.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
What is Half-Life: Opposing Force? This is the same Half-life, but with a new vision of the world, through the glass of the gas mask of the fighter H.E.C.U., with new gameplay additions, with a good story, revealing new parts of the Half-life universe.
This - the standard of quality, as well as add-ons, and games in the genre of FPS, so, immediately move on to the pluses and minuses:

Pros:
+ Gameplay of a single player. He is thoughtful and multifaceted. No blunt mochilov, only intense bouts, and often you will have to strain your head for solving puzzles, although there is nothing much complicated. As already said, the fights are intense, very interesting, we will fight - where we just do not have to! - in a secret research complex, in the mountains, in the world of Xen, etc. To help us in this will be a vast arsenal of all kinds of weapons, and our allies are fellow soldiers who have their roles (a medic who can cure you, a welder who will cut through the autogen to you door for further ways, etc.) and the staff of this unfortunate research center. And against you will be people from the secret division of Black Ops, and already two races of aliens!
In general, the gameplay on a solid five with a plus, the gameplay is diverse and tense, not giving boredom.

+ Multiplayer. Live and also varied, depending on the society and the server mode on which you are playing. Do you want - will you be fleeting, meat drive defmatch, want to be tactful, with the definition of their own roles in the attack and defense, capture the flag. That's cool.

+ The plot. The plot is as follows: the soldiers from the Hazardous Environment Combat Unit are flying to the Black Mesa complex, in which something terrible has happened (Cascade resonance, I mean), but on the way they get into trouble and they shoot down the helicopter, and the main character - the 22-year- wit the old corporal Sheppard, waking up without a weapon, one will have to get out of the place with his own strength ...
And then the plot is given to us internally, through other characters, through the game itself - one of the main features of Half-life. The plot is good, intriguing, and gives us a lot of information about the universe of Half-life.

+ Atmosphere. Indeed, it is, slightly different than in Half-life - here it is more militant, but not nearly worse. Moreover, there remains the most beautiful soundtrack.

+ Technical additions. Since OpFor is an Ad-Don, an addition, then all sorts of additives should also be noted. And note there is that: a bunch of new weapons, new monsters, new technical and graphic chips, all this does not let you get bored - definitely a plus.

+ A large number of custom modifications.

Minuses:
I personally did not find it for myself.

Notes:
â€¢ There is no Russian language. (There are crackers)
â€¢ There are no achievements and collectible Steam cards.
â€¢ At a discount, the game costs ~ 32 rubles.
â€¢ The travel time varies. You can quickly run the game in 4-5 hours, or you can perfectly spend 12 hours. Well, multiplayer can perfectly tighten you. And if you do not tighten, then you will always have the opportunity to spend a good pair of matches in it.


Outcome:
Half-Life: Opposing Force - this is a detailed addon, but what is the addon - a separate game, I repeat - the standard of quality FPS and add-ons.
I recommend it to everyone. 10 \ 10.

Ğ­Ñ…, Ğ° Ğ²Ğ¾Ñ‚ Ğ² Ñ‚Ğµ Ğ²Ñ€ĞµĞ¼ĞµĞ½Ğ° DLC Ğ´Ğ»Ñ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€ Ğ±Ñ‹Ğ»Ğ¸ Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒÑˆĞ¾Ğ¹ Ñ€ĞµĞ´ĞºĞ¾ÑÑ‚ÑŒÑ, Ğ¸Ñ… Ğ±Ñ‹Ğ»Ğ¾ Ğ¾Ñ‡ĞµĞ½ÑŒ Ğ¼Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¾, Ğ° ĞµÑĞ»Ğ¸ Ğ¸ Ğ±Ñ‹Ğ»Ğ¸ Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ²Ñ‹ÑĞ¾ĞºĞ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ ĞºĞ°Ñ‡ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ°, ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ ÑĞµĞ¹Ñ‡Ğ°Ñ Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ñ€Ğ°Ğ±Ñ‹ Ñ…Ğ¾Ñ‚ÑÑ‚ Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ½ÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ñƒ Ğ½Ğ°Ñ ĞºÑƒÑ‡Ñƒ Ğ´ĞµĞ½ĞµĞ³ Ğ·Ğ° Ğ¼ĞµĞ»ĞºĞ¸Ğµ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ¿Ğ¾ ĞºĞ°Ğº Ğ±ĞµÑĞµĞ´ĞºĞ° Ğ½Ğ°ĞºĞ»ĞµĞ¿Ğ°Ğ»Ğ° Ñ‚ÑƒĞ¿Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‹Ğ»Ñ‹Ğµ DLC Ğ½Ğ° Ñ‚Ñ€ĞµÑ‚Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ğ¸ Ñ‡ĞµÑ‚Ğ²Ñ‘Ñ€Ñ‚Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ¤Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ», Ğ° Ğ·Ğ° Ğ¿Ğ¾Ñ‚Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‡ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ğµ Ğ´ĞµĞ½ÑŒĞ³Ğ¸ Ñ„Ğ°Ğ½Ğ°Ñ‚ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»ÑƒÑ‡Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ Ğ»Ğ¸Ğ±Ğ¾ Ğ¼ĞµĞ»ĞºĞ¾Ğµ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğµ ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğµ Ğ¾Ğ½ Ğ·Ğ°Ğ±ÑƒĞ´ĞµÑ‚ Ñ‡ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ· 3-4 Ñ‡Ğ°ÑĞ° Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ñ‹, Ğ½Ñƒ Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ¸ Ñ‚ÑƒĞ¿ÑƒÑ ÑÑĞ¶ĞµÑ‚ĞºÑƒ. Ğ’Ğ¾Ñ‚ VALVE Ñ€ĞµÑˆĞ¸Ğ»Ğ¸ Ğ² ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ¿Ğ»Ğ°Ğ½Ğµ Ğ´Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ¾ĞºĞ°Ğ¼ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½Ğ¾Ñ†ĞµĞ½Ğ½ÑƒÑ Ñ‡Ğ°ÑÑ‚ÑŒ ÑĞµÑ€Ğ¸Ğ¸, Ğ½Ğ°ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒĞºĞ¾ Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ° Ğ³Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ±Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ°. Opposing Force ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğ°ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ÑÑ‰Ğ¸Ğ¹ ĞºĞ»Ğ°Ğ´ Ğ´Ğ»Ñ Ñ„Ğ°Ğ½Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ² HL, Ğ·Ğ´ĞµÑÑŒ Ğ¼Ñ‹ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ°ĞµĞ¼ Ğ·Ğ° Ğ²Ğ¾ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ HECU ĞĞ´Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ°Ğ½Ğ° Ğ¨ĞµĞ¿Ğ°Ñ€Ğ´Ğ°, Ğ¾Ğ½ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸ÑˆÑ‘Ğ» Ğ½Ğ° Ğ¾Ğ¿ĞµÑ€Ğ°Ñ†Ğ¸Ñ Ğ² Ğ§Ñ‘Ñ€Ğ½ÑƒÑ Ğ¼ĞµĞ·Ñƒ, Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ‹ Ğ·Ğ°Ñ‡Ğ¸ÑÑ‚Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ»Ğ°Ğ±Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¸Ñ. Ğ’Ğ¾ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ğµ Ğº ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼Ñƒ Ğ²Ñ€ĞµĞ¼ĞµĞ½Ğ¸ ÑƒĞ¶Ğµ Ğ½Ğ°Ñ‡Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¸ Ğ½ĞµĞ¹Ñ‚Ñ€Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾ Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ½Ğ¾ÑĞ¸Ñ‚ÑÑ Ğº Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ÑĞ¾Ğ½Ğ°Ğ»Ñƒ, Ğ¸ Ğ´Ğ°Ğ¶Ğµ Ğ·Ğ°Ğ±Ñ‹Ğ»Ğ¸ Ğ¾ Ğ³Ğ»Ğ°Ğ²Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ñ†ĞµĞ»Ğ¸ Ñ Ğ±Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ¸ Ğ¾Ñ‡ĞºĞ°Ğ¼Ğ¸ ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ñ‚Ğ°Ğ¼ ÑƒĞ¶Ğµ Ğ¿Ñ€Ñ‹Ğ³Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ Ğ¿Ğ¾ Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ²ĞºĞ°Ğ¼ Ğ² ĞšÑĞµĞ½Ğµ, Ğ½Ñƒ Ğ° ĞºĞ¾Ğ³Ğ´Ğ° Ğ¼Ñ‹ ÑƒĞ·Ğ½Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¸ Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ ÑƒĞ¶Ğµ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ·Ğ´Ğ½Ğ¾, Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ° ÑĞ²Ğ°ĞºÑƒĞ¸Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒÑÑ, Ñ‚Ğ¾ G-Man Ñ€ĞµÑˆĞ¸Ğ» Ğ¿Ğ¾-Ğ´Ñ€ÑƒĞ³Ğ¾Ğ¼Ñƒ, Ğ¸ Ğ·Ğ°ĞºÑ€Ñ‹Ğ» Ğ¨ĞµĞ¿Ğ°Ñ€Ğ´Ñƒ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ…Ğ¾Ğ´ Ğº ÑĞ°Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ»Ñ‘Ñ‚Ñƒ Ğ´Ğ»Ñ ÑĞ²Ğ°ĞºÑƒĞ°Ñ†Ğ¸Ğ¸, Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ´Ñ‘Ñ‚ÑÑ ÑĞ°Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¼Ñƒ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¹Ñ‚Ğ¸ Ñ‡ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ· Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ³Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ğ¿ÑƒÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ¿Ğ¾ Ğ»Ğ°Ğ±Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¸ÑĞ¼ Ğ¸ Ğ´Ğ°Ğ¶Ğµ Ğ½ĞµĞ¼Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ³ÑƒĞ»ÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ¿Ğ¾ ĞšÑĞµĞ½Ñƒ.

ĞŸĞ»ÑÑÑ‹
ĞÑƒ Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ ĞºĞ°ÑĞ°ĞµÑ‚ÑÑ Ğ³ĞµĞ¹Ğ¼Ğ¿Ğ»ĞµÑ, Ğ¾Ğ½ Ñ…Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾ÑˆĞ¸Ğ¹. Ğ”Ğ¾Ğ±Ğ°Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ¸ Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ¾Ñ€ÑƒĞ¶Ğ¸Ñ, Ğ¸ ĞµĞ³Ğ¾ Ğº ÑĞ»Ğ¾Ğ²Ñƒ Ñ‚ÑƒÑ‚ Ğ¼Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾, Ğ½Ğ°Ñ‡Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ°Ñ Ğ¾Ñ‚ Ğ±Ğ°Ğ½Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ñ‹Ñ… ÑĞ½Ğ°Ğ¹Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ÑĞºĞ¸Ñ… Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ½Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ğº Ğ½Ğ° Ğ·Ğ°Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ñƒ Ğ°Ñ€Ğ±Ğ°Ğ»ĞµÑ‚Ñƒ Ğ¸ Ğ³Ğ°ĞµÑ‡Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ ĞºĞ»ÑÑ‡Ğ° Ñ Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ¾Ğ¼, Ğ·Ğ°ĞºĞ°Ğ½Ñ‡Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ°Ñ ÑƒĞ½Ğ¸ĞºĞ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ĞµĞ¿Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‚Ğ°Ñ†Ğ¸Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ¿ÑƒÑˆĞºĞ¾Ğ¹ ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ°Ñ Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ¼ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ¸Ñ‚ Ğ²Ğ°Ñ Ğ² Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ğ½Ñ‹Ğµ Ğ¼ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ° Ğ² ĞšÑĞµĞ½Ğµ, Ñ€ÑƒÑ‡Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ±Ğ°Ñ€Ğ½Ğ°ĞºĞ» ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶ĞµÑ‚ ÑĞ¾Ğ¶Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ½Ğ¸ĞºĞ° Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸Ñ†ĞµĞ¿Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑÑ Ğ½Ğ° Ğ½Ğ°Ñ€Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ñ‹ Ğ¸Ğ· ĞšÑĞµĞ½Ğ°, Ñ€ÑƒÑ‡Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¹ "Ğ¿Ğ»ĞµĞ²Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒÑ‰Ğ¸Ğº" ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ¨ĞµĞ¿Ğ°Ñ€Ğ´ Ğ¾ÑĞ¾Ğ±Ğ¾ Ğ»ÑĞ±Ğ¸Ñ‚, ĞºĞ¾Ñ€Ğ¼Ğ¸Ñ‚, Ğ¸ Ğ³Ğ»Ğ°Ğ´Ğ¸Ñ‚. Ğ, Ğ½Ñƒ Ğ¸ ĞµÑ‰Ñ‘ Ñ‚ÑƒÑ‚ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸ĞºĞ¾Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ°Ñ Ñ‚Ñ€ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ²ĞºĞ° Ğ² Ğ°Ñ€Ğ¼ĞµĞ¹ĞºĞµ, ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¸Ñ‚ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¹Ñ‚Ğ¸ Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ´ Ğ½Ğ°Ñ‡Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ñ‹.

ĞœĞ¸Ğ½ÑƒÑÑ‹
ĞœĞ¸Ğ½ÑƒÑĞ¾Ğ² Ğ¿Ğ¾Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¸ Ğ½ĞµÑ‚Ñƒ Ğ´Ğ»Ñ Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ñ, Ñ-Ğ±Ñ‹ Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ¼ĞµÑ‚Ğ¸Ğ» ĞºĞ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ‚ĞºÑƒÑ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¶Ğ¸Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾ÑÑ‚ÑŒ, Ğ½Ğ¾ ĞºĞ°Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ½, ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ğ¶Ğµ DLC, Ğ²Ğ¾Ñ‚ Ğ² Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ»Ğ¸Ñ‡Ğ¸Ğµ Ğ¾Ñ‚ Ğ´Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½ĞµĞ¹ÑˆĞµĞ³Ğ¾ Ğ°Ğ´Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ° Ğ½Ğ° Ğ¾Ğ±Ğ·Ğ¾Ñ€ Ğ·Ğ´ĞµÑÑŒ Ğ²Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½Ğµ Ğ´Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ‡Ğ½Ğ°Ñ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¶Ğ¸Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾ÑÑ‚ÑŒ. Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¹Ñ‚Ğ¸ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ°Ğ´Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ½ Ğ·Ğ° 1-2 Ğ´Ğ½Ñ, Ğ½Ğ¾ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ ÑĞ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½Ğ° Ñ…Ğ²Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¸Ñ‚ Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ‹ Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒÑÑ. Ğ˜Ğ· Ñ€ĞµĞ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ñ‹Ñ… Ğ¼Ğ¸Ğ½ÑƒÑĞ¾Ğ² Ñ‚ÑƒÑ‚ ÑĞ±Ğ¸Ñ‚ ĞºĞ¾Ğ½Ñ„Ğ¸Ğ³, Ğ²Ñ€Ğ°Ğ³Ğ¸ ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¸ Ğ»ĞµĞ³Ñ‡Ğµ Ğ´Ğ°Ğ¶Ğµ Ğ½Ğ° Ñ…Ğ°Ñ€Ğ´Ğµ, Ğ° Ğ·Ğ°Ñ€ÑĞ´Ğ½Ğ¸ĞºĞ¸ Ğ½Ğ° Ğ»ÑĞ±Ğ¾Ğ¹ ÑĞ»Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ¸ Ğ´Ğ°ÑÑ‚ 50-70 Ñ…Ğ¿, Ğ° Ğ½Ğµ 35 ĞºĞ°Ğº Ğ½Ğ° Ñ…Ğ°Ñ€Ğ´Ğµ, Ğ½Ğ¾ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ğ»ĞµĞ³ĞºĞ¾ Ñ„Ğ¸ĞºÑĞ¸Ñ‚ÑÑ Ñ‡ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ· Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¸Ğ¼Ñ‘Ğ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ñ‚ĞµĞºÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ñ„Ğ°Ğ¹Ğ» Ğ² Ğ¿Ğ°Ğ¿ĞºĞµ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ñ‹.

Ğ˜Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ³
ĞÑ‚Ğ»Ğ¸Ñ‡Ğ½Ğ¾Ğµ DLC, ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¸Ñ‚ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¹Ñ‚Ğ¸ Ğ²ÑĞµĞ¼ Ñ„Ğ°Ğ½Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ°Ğ¼ HL Ğ¾Ğ±ÑĞ·Ğ°Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾, ÑĞ»Ñ‹ÑˆĞ°Ğ»Ğ¸? ĞĞ‘Ğ¯Ğ—ĞĞ¢Ğ•Ğ›Ğ¬ĞĞ! Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 11 janvier 2023
Half Life Opposing Force Ini Adalah Expansion Pack Pertama Dari Half Life. Dan Expansion Pack Ini Sebenarnya Dapat Episode Baru Dari Half Life Dari Storynya. Storynya Kita Sebagai Tentara Specialist Dan Misinya Harus Bunuh Gordon Freeman. Dan Ada Senjata Baru Juga Di Opposing Force. Dan Developernya Oleh Gearbox Software Release Date Tahun 1999 Sekitar 1 Tahun Sudah Release Game Half Life. Multiplayer Masih Aktif Juga. Dan Menurut Kata Para Fans Bilang Ini Adalah Best Expansion Pack Half Life.

9/10
 
KaptenMarshal
236 produits enregistrÃ©s

53.2 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 25 janvier 2018
This was fun. But I got frustrated and confused in certain chapters. In my opinion, this game is meant for people with very quick reactions and people who think outside the box. Overall, if you want a constant shooter, sudden attacks, and slightly confusing "puzzles", then this game is meant for you.
 
The Wizard
49 produits enregistrÃ©s
1
5 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
1
RecommandÃ©
4.9 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 17 dÃ©cembre 2023
Half-Life: Opposing Force is one of the three official expansion packs to the original 1998 game Half-Life that were developed by the Gearbox Software, the other two being Half-Life: Blue Shift and Half-Life: Decay.

Opposing Force doesn't derail itself from the original game's formula, but doesn't hesitate to introduce new mechanics, new weapons and the opportunity to view the conflict from the eyes of the marines. Albeit from a brief dialogue in the original game, Half-Life doesn't make it completely explicit that the marines aren't willing to shoot upon civilians, but Opposing Force makes it quite clear that they're under the ambiguous orders to silence the facility and cover up the incident as much as they're able to.

The newly introduced arsenal is quite satisfactory to use. Ranging from the traditional sniper systems to squad automatic weapons, to absurdly utilizing living organisms as biological firearms. Of course, what good are new weapons if you haven't got new enemies to use them on, and Opposing Force doesn't hesitate to introduce a bunch of new designs. The Black Ops are your new nemesis, just as the marines were in the original game. Another entirely new race of aliens is now attacking the facility, the aptly named "Race X" (did Musk work with Gearbox back in the 1999?). Shock Troopers and other abstract yet familiar looking designs roam the halls of the once decommissioned silos that served as science labs up until recently, and it's your duty to dispatch them with any means possible.

Of course, it doesn't mean that the game doesn't have any sort of flaws; far from it actually. There's quite a few things that I don't particularly like. Of course, they're all going to be just subjective criticism, and if you disagree with me then... well, you're able to do that. Anyways...

I didn't quite like the manner that the story progressed in Opposing Force. It feels all too sudden, in all honestly. At least it is for my tastes. For example, the introduction of the Race X is quite jarringly sudden. No explanation, no backstory provided on what they are, where'd they come from, etc. Their motive is only briefly explained; the Gene Worm is trying to get in through the dimensional portals, and their intentions are to use it to drain the Earth's supplies and make the planet more habitable for the Race X themselves. What makes it even more aggravating, is that you catch a glimpse of infant shock troopers being held as test subjects in one of the labs. Which leaves me with even more questions; were these experimented on before the incident? Did Black Mesa enter not one, but two different dimensions at once? Who knows, it's been 2 decades and I'm not going to get my answers anytime soon.

My second complain about the game is how much of a bullet sponge the enemies can be. Now, I do like enemies in video games that're tough to take down, no problem there. Problem is when there's multiple of them in one place and it makes the combat turn into a slog. Shock Troopers for example take two grenades to take down. Two whole grenades, which is a tad bit absurd in my opinion. Even the armor clad Black Ops don't take that much abuse to go down. I dislike the sponginess of the enemies here for the same reason I dislike the Barons of Hell in the original DOOM; they turn combat into an uninteresting slog.

Otherwise, I'd give the game a good 8/10. It's a great game, and of the three expansions, I'd say this one is a must if you're a fan of the original game.
 
Amaruq Wulfe
0
5 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile

Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 10 fÃ©vrier 2023
This game is probably the greatest Half life extension/mod,it's great and classic, This gives Half life a whole new look,instead of being through the eyes of Freeman,you're behind the eyes of Corporal Sherman,a US Marine who kicks ass and takes no names,This game inspired mods and mystery,From the starting to the Ending Gene Worm,it's just a kick ass time.Combined with blue shift,it's just an awesome time,and a great buy.

v0vassiN

4 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
11.3 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 24 mai 2020
A worthy side-story to the original Half-life. you play as Corporal Shepherd who is one of the army soldiers deployed to the Black Mesa Research Facility to combat the alien invasion. Shepherd's path intersects and goes parallel to Gordon's at times, and offers some further insight into what was happening during the aftermath of the resonance cascade. Definitely worth playing if you enjoyed the original game, this shorter expansion pack includes many new weapons and enemy types, to mix up the gameplay.

Eas
0
6 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
39.0 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 7 mars 2014
Whee... nostalgia.

A spin-off game of the original Half-life made by Gearbox, now better known as the buggers who make the Borderlands games. Instead of playing as the nerd Gordan Freeman, you instead play as one of the lunkhead Marines that you had to fight in the original game. Yey.

So what does this change? Not too much. You get options to control some other soldiers at times who help you open doors, heal you, and of course shoot aliens. There are also plenty of new weapons, several of which are rather awesome like the M249 SAW... or whatever it's called. It's a light machine gun, ok? Beyond these little things, there's little to differentiate the game from the original Half-Life, except that you fight far more aliens than humans. And that some of those new aliens are rather nasty.

Well, it's also shorter. Alot shorter. I cleaned this out in just under 4 hours, though I had the benefit of past memory that seemed to instantly remember exactly how to get through everything despite not having played this in a decade.

Anyway, it's a little extra Half-Life funtimes. Might as well play it if you liked the original game. :o
 
Yureina
1,461 produits enregistrÃ©s
0

0

>>> ĞŸÑ€Ğ¾Ğ²ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ½Ğ¾! Ğ˜Ğ³Ñ€ÑƒÑˆĞºĞ° Ğ¸Ğ´ĞµÑ‚ Ğ½Ğ° Win 10;

ĞÑ„Ğ¸Ğ³ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ°Ğ´Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ½ Ğ´Ğ»Ñ Ğ»ĞµĞ³ĞµĞ½Ğ´Ğ°Ñ€Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ñ‹, ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ²ÑˆĞ¸Ğ¹ "Ğ½ĞµĞºĞ°Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¼" Ğ¸Ğ·-Ğ·Ğ° Ğ½Ğµ Ğ² Ğ¼ĞµÑ€Ñƒ Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ñ„Ğ°Ğ½Ñ‚Ğ°Ğ·Ğ¸Ğ¸ Gearbox. ĞĞ´Ğ½Ğ°ĞºĞ¾ Ğ½ĞµÑĞ¼Ğ¾Ñ‚Ñ€Ñ Ğ½Ğ° Ğ½ĞµĞºĞ°Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ‡Ğ½Ğ¾ÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ² ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ğ½ÑƒĞ¶Ğ½Ğ¾, Ğ¿Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼Ñƒ Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ğ²ÑĞµ Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ‚ Ğ¶Ğµ Half-life, Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒĞºĞ¾ Ğ»ÑƒÑ‡ÑˆĞµ Ğ¸ Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ğ½ĞµĞ¹.

ĞŸĞĞ§Ğ•ĞœĞ£ ĞĞ£Ğ–ĞĞ Ğ˜Ğ“Ğ ĞĞ¢Ğ¬?
- Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ñ‹Ğµ Ğ²Ñ€Ğ°Ğ³Ğ¸;
- Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ñ‹Ğµ-ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ñ€Ñ‹Ğµ ÑƒÑ€Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ½Ğ¸;
- Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ğµ Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ½ĞµÑÑ‚Ñ€ĞµĞ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾Ğµ Ğ¾Ñ€ÑƒĞ¶Ğ¸Ğµ (Ñ‡ĞµÑ€Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ Desert Eagle, ÑĞ½Ğ°Ğ¹Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ÑĞºĞ°Ñ Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ½Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ²ĞºĞ° Ğ¸ Ğ´Ñ€.);
- Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ğµ Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ³Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ‡ĞµÑĞºĞ¾Ğµ Ğ¾Ñ€ÑƒĞ¶Ğ¸Ğµ (Ñ Ğ°Ğ¿Ğ¿ĞµÑ‚Ğ¸Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼ ĞºÑƒÑˆĞ°ĞµÑ‚ Ğ±Ğ¾ĞµĞ¿Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ¿Ğ°ÑÑ‹ Ğ¸ ÑÑ‚Ñ€ĞµĞ»ÑĞµÑ‚ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ñ‡ĞµÑÑ‹Ğ²Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ¸ Ğ±Ñ€ÑÑˆĞºĞ°);
- Ğ¾Ñ‚ Ğ»ÑĞ´ĞµĞ¹, ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‹Ğµ Ğ²Ğ¿Ğ¾ÑĞ»ĞµĞ´ÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ¸ ÑĞ´ĞµĞ»Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¸ Borderlands (ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ñ‡ÑƒĞ²ÑÑ‚Ğ²ÑƒĞµÑ‚ÑÑ);

Ğ˜Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ³: ÑƒĞ²ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ğ¾ Ñ€ĞµĞºĞ¾Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ğ´ÑƒÑ. Ğ¡Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¸Ğ´Ğ½Ğ°Ñ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¶Ğ¸Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾ÑÑ‚ÑŒ, Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ±ĞµĞ· Ğ½ÑƒĞ´ÑÑ‚Ğ¸Ğ½Ñ‹, Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒÑˆĞ¾Ğµ ĞºĞ¾Ğ»Ğ¸Ñ‡ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ ĞºĞ¾Ğ½Ñ‚ĞµĞ½Ñ‚Ğ°. Ğ˜Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ğ¾ Ñ‚Ğ°ĞºĞ¸Ğ¼Ğ¸ Ğ¸ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¶Ğ½Ñ‹ Ğ±Ñ‹Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ°Ğ´Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ½Ñ‹.

Half-Life: Opposing Force
ÄalÅ¡ie rozÅ¡Ã­renie staruÄiÄkÃ©ho Half-Life prinÃ¡Å¡a novÃ½ pohÄ¾ad na udalosti v Black Mesa z pohÄ¾adu armÃ¡dy. Indian0
236 produits enregistrÃ©s

7 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
148.5 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 10 aout 2019
Arguably vastly superior to the original in all aspects, bar length, Back in the bronze age, this was known as a challenging game. In >current year, I'd not be surprised if the average gamer finds it very difficult. Unlike HL, this game focuses on combat (you're a HECU marine sent in to 'silence' the facility and all associated assets) and, though primitive, things like taking cover behind terrain, baiting enemies with grenades, scoring fat gibs with the handful of satchels the game gives you, and using your advanced AI (for the late 90s) squad members properly is satisfying, and a reward all of its own, not to mention the huge selection of new weapons that augment the arsenal.

The theme of the game, for those who are interested in such things, is 'survival at all costs.'

The game's fairly stingy with supplies, but early into the game, you're given a special weapon that's all-but useless for offensive purposes, but teleports you to hazardous breather locations, as it were, where supplies, healing ponds, and so on, may be found - however, ammunition for this weapon is extremely limited, so you'll at most be using it once per level.

I played this when it came out, almost 20 years ago, and it still holds up today - though you'll want to set a more modern resolution, and tune the uber dark environments to accommodate 20 years of monitor technology and progress. About 8000k to 9300k monitor temperature should do the trick, then adjust the actual contrast, and you'll be fragging like it's the 90s.

Highly recommended. One of my favorite oldschool shooters. It was then, it is now, and likely forever will be. If you're skimping out on this one, you're doing yourself a great disservice.
 
Vassago Rain

18.7 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 2 juillet 2016
Pros:
- Familiar environments, different gameplay
- Actually new content for an expansion!
- A great twist on Half-Life's campaign
- A much more satisfying final boss

â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥:
- Some outdated game mechanics
Much like Half-Life, this game didn't age well. It did significantly better, however
- Boss fights
Much like Half-Life, this game struggles to give a satisfying end to boss fights. They're still challenging and fair, however.
- Short
This is to be expected of an expansion. You get so involved that it ends before you know it.

9/10
It suffers from similar issues as the original Half-Life, but is a very welcome addition to the franchise. A must-have for fans of the series.

5.1 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 17 juin 2019
Whatever happened to Shepard?

PROS: The game has all the polish and finesse of the original Half-Life. If you enjoy the combat that came with it, this is a much better title, with fewer puzzles, less platforming, but more gun play. The soundtrack still kicks in at some solid moments, providing tension to amp up the moment.

â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥: If you didn't like the combat in Half-Life, then this is not going to sell you on it. It's mostly combat, and the problem comes about with a lot of small hallways. This gives little room to dodge incoming fire.

FINAL: This is a nice little supplement to the original Half-Life story, weighed down only by it's questionable canon nature due to no consequence of the finale. A fun game for old school FPS fans, but completely unneeded for the broader Half-Life story.

Nebulous Idea
0
7 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
10.1 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 28 dÃ©cembre 2014
Opposing the Forces

Half life, which I used to pass the time again and again, is still my favorite FPS game. There are many reasons for that (including countless LAN parties in my teenage years), but the thing is, only recently, and thanks to my friend who bought me HL pack, I've discovered that apart from Blue Shift, (which I personaly call The Blue Sh*t) there has been another expansion. This time more interesting, since we get to see the Black Mesa events from perspective of a Solider. After beating the game, I decided to share my thoughts on it.

1. The Lord is our Shephard. - The main character, the idea of the game

Shephard. Well that's basically who our protagonist is, just like in the first HL, we play the part of the people's hero, leading the frightened flock through the dangers of the warzone that the Black Mesa compound has become. Groups of two, three soliders can be found scattered along the whole game. I think it's a good idea to view the original HL story from a different perspective. The point of view is the key here, for it gives greater insight to certain things, like:
- Humanizing the Grunts, whom, in the first HL we understandably percive as an evil force, not very much different from the aliens from Xen. Here, we realise they are just pawns, placed in a similar position to the BM personnel.
- Outside of Black Mesa, we get to see what happens on a larger scale, exploring the military grounds.
- We revisit certain places, like the laboratory in which Freeman teleports to Xen, and get to see what happens then.
The entire storyline follows in the wake of Gordon Freeman, so it has a nice feeling to it, for the players who enjoyed the plot of the original game.

2. Panta Rhei - What's different from the original HL

I must say I'm not a fan of the changes to the armory, or for that matter, to the way we can fight here. Some of the weapon options recived a failry mirrored replacement, like the Colt Python. Some, in fact about a half, remained unchanged - Glock 9mm, the HK MP5, Spas-12, and RPG. The new weapons include three alien biological weapons, which are very ammo efficient since each of them posesses a way of replenishing the ammunition indefinitely. I don't like their concepts however, since for me, they don't serve any purpose in expanding our combat possibilities (except for the melee weapon, but it's nearly impossible to use in serious combat, due to it's nature).
I don't understand the replacement of the crowbar. It has been devided into two weapons - Pipe Wrench, which has 2 attack modes (a normal hit and a loaded attack which takes 3 seconds to fully load) and a knife, quick and low damage/range weapon. For me, the crowbar was perfect. After getting the glock I barely even used the wrench, since there is plenty of 9mm ammo everywhere, despite playing on Hard difficulty. The explosives remain unchanged. We get the granades, Laser Tripmines and Satchel Charges. More new weapons include Sniper Rifle, Heavy Machinegun or an experimental Displacer Cannon.
Casual, Casual.. ehh. C'mon, the three best weapons of the series, being (in my humble opinion) The Crowbar, The Crossbow and The Gauss Riffle, are gone. What fun is there in slashing Xen'ians with a regular knife?
The enemies are also different, considerably tougher and more challanging than in the first HL, altough less fun in my opinion. We hardly see any zombies or headcrabs. We mostly battle organised Xen soliders and their.. warmachines?

3. Nihil novi sub sole - So what is this game all about

It's Half Life. Reskinned, rearranged, rewritten. But it's all the same. The ideas were eaten, chewed and spat out in a mixture of green paint. I like the game, I really do. It's just - we don't do anything new (oh ok except for using a rope two times). Literally. It's all crawling through the pipes, trying to figure out how to get out of old storage-like places, fighting, jumping. There is no new element. We don't even have a chance, despite being a Corporal, to actually implement this element, for commanding people or anything. We just run around exactly like Gordon did, and fight a war we don't understand. there is one thing worthy of mentioning here though - The game passes on, and even expands the element which is one of the reasons for my deep affection for the first HL, this being the nessecity of strategic usage of the enviorment. There are situations and places in which you have to actually figure out what to do. In most of today's games you are given a minimap that shows you where to go. These games explain, step by step, what button to touch and what wire to cut. In this series you've got to rely on your instinct, and that's awesome.

4. Leave a light on for me - More about concepts, changes and the game

Am I the only person who hates the night vision? Man, it's such a terrible concept. I understand that we play a solider and military has to possess some high tech, but damn. You (or at least I) can hardly even see anything in this green light, even in the dark. I'd like a regular flashlight instead, please. What's the deal - couldn't they just leave the flashlight AND add the night vision? If they could implement 3 melee weapons, why not 2 light variants? I know not. Besides, there are like 3 or 4 places in the game where it actually comes in handy. Let's say HL has way more to do with a solid horror climate, where you had to use the flashlight actually more than the pistol and the battery was almost always red. The game is too long. Most of the locations are artificially stretched by repetition. In my opinion the game could be reduced to the 60% of its current length and still have the same, if not the better impact. By the way - there are hardly any bosses here, the ones that do exist are reused HL 1 bosses or boss ideas. Sad. Also, what the hell is with this Displacer Cannon's secondary fire mode? So we can basically teleport to safety at any moment we just need ammo. Did I mention that I hated the Night Vision?

5. Too much love will kill you - my final opinion

The game is decent, overall. It lacks some elements of the original HL atmosphere, which made it a hit, but perhaps it was meant to be this way. Despite playing as a solider I almost haven't felt the military spirit in the process, except for some parts when the combat music carried us. As I mentioned earlier the action is stretched like granny's breasts. There were moments where I've felt like I was meeting some kind of a Force Opposing my completion of the level. Oh, lest I forget - my ultimate complaint. The game was way too easy. Playing on the Hard difficulty, through the most of the game, save for perhaps two last chapters, I was running around will full health... and armor. For old HL veterans this must sound like a blasphemy since HEV armor was hard to come by in HL 1. There are also way too many medpacks in this game. Well perhaps I am tainted with my multiplayer experience. Anyways, I recommend this game, adding 0.5 to my original score, for the sentiment towards the series.

Half Life: Opposing Force - 6.5 / 10

Proxym 2014
 
Proxym
0

Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 23 janvier 2022
WHAT IS YOUR MAJOR MALFUNCTION, MAGGOT!?

Half-Life: Opposing Force is the first expansion pack for Half-Life, developed by Gear Box before Randy got all weird and sleazy on everyone. Or he always was, I donâ€™t know dude looks like he goes to trucker strip clubs.

You play as Adrian Shepard, US marine and part of the Special Forces HECU unit, developed and trained to fight in hazardous environments but also shoot nerds. Adrianâ€™s helicopter is shot down en route to Black Mesa and he falls unconscious. After being saved by the NERDS, Adrian is tasked with linking up with his unit, finding King Nerd Gordon Freeman, putting a bullet in him, and then getting out of Black Mesa before things get worse.

Opposing Force was that expansion pack everyone as a kid wanted to play because it had the cool soldier guy on the cover. But other than that, Half Life: Other Guys does things semi different from the original release.

For one you have new weapons, like the Desert Eagle, Sniper Rifle, a big ass Wrench, and a knife which is basically just a reskinned crowbar. Other than that you get some alien weapons to play with, I donâ€™t want to spoil too much in case you, somehow, have never played OF, so Iâ€™ll just say Barnacle Grappling Hook and leave it at that.

Outside of new weapons, you also get to team up with the Marine guys you were wasting in the original Half Life. But instead of just being dudes with guns, they come in several delicious flavors. I donâ€™t know what theyâ€™re actually called so just bare with me.
Heavy Gunners are big bastards carrying SAWs, theyâ€™re surprisingly good at wasting aliens and can hold their own in a lot of ranged engagements as well.
Engineers carry pistols and are used to unweld doors and smoke cigarettes.
Medics can heal you, but also help fix injured soldiers in your squad.

If I told you OF was kind of a squad shooter you probably wouldnâ€™t believe me. And then call me mean names. Or take my jokes out of context and think Iâ€™m being completely seriously like in my other reviews.
I donâ€™t like you, youâ€™re mean to me.

It should only take you about four or five hours to get through the campaign, in which you get to visit areas across Black Mesa that you didnâ€™t get to see in the original game. You also get to contend with new enemies like Alien X or race X or whatever they were called. Theyâ€™re cool too, but I doubt theyâ€™re actually canon. If that even matters.

This is also the game to first introduce Otis, the lovable security guard that can completely waste you in 2 or 3 shots. Heâ€™s cool to have around and good in a fight, I like Otis.
Because Otis is NICE to me.

Opposing Force is pretty good. If I had to recommend one of the expansion packs over the other I would absolutely recommend Opposing Force over Blue Shift. The multiplayer is also some what active as well, at least when I played I found a few people booling around in Deathmatch. I also played it for a bit with some friends, its just mindless deathmatch fun. Thereâ€™s probably someone whoâ€™s good at it but they canâ€™t reach me in my doom fortress.

Half Life: The One with the Soldier Guy gets 8 forgotten USB sticks at Medieval Times out of 10.

Ketchup was sold in the 1830s as medicine.

Join the curator or the Drill Instructor will yell at me again.
 
Dirk Dickbutt

gilbert the gluttenous
338 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
3 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
7.4 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 7 mars 2019
So I finished the first Half Life last summer and found it to be a pretty great game albeit with a few fairly big flaws. It's expansion, Opposing Force, unfortunately has these exact same flaws so it's disappointing nothing was improved upon here. The first problem is that there are several sections where the difficult spikes to an insane degree, placing you in rooms with no escape surrounded by way too many enemies, many of whom are complete bullet sponges that only serve to eat up your ammo. There were several points in the game that were just exhausting to play through, as I was constantly save scumming and searching every nook and cranny desperately for just one measly med pack. Another problem in this game, like the previous entry, is that the level design can get quite confusing at times and forces you to backtrack fairly often. This is made even worse in this game by the fact that in certain sections you have a squad that you must direct through the hallways and corridors in order to advance to the next section. I'll just say that the path-finding AI was still very primitive for it's time and these sections probably should have been skipped all together. By far the worst flaw however is the â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ platforming. My god has the platforming not aged well with these games at all. There is no weight to your character and you feel like you're floating on a pocket of air or sliding on ice pretty much the whole game. Sounds like the perfect physics system to include platforming doesn't it? I was almost driven to tears in the original Half Life due to platforming â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ rearing its ugly head in the final boss fight. Thankfully, the final boss in this game is not nearly as hair pulling, but there are still several ugly sections that require death after death until you nail the jump just right.

Now to what I enjoyed. The combat in this game is still top notch and the tension is incredibly high. There are no slow moments in this game and no chance to breathe, it's an action packed thrill ride from start to finish. I'm not sure if this is one of the first games to do the multiple perspectives on an event thing (I know Resident Evil 2 did this a year earlier), but it does it well and you really feel like complete hell and chaos is happening around you through radio broadcasts and several in game cut-scenes. The game itself starts about one hour or so before the end of the original Half Life and greatly expands on the lore of the world, adding many new weapons and enemies to keep the experience fresh. Only real complaint about the story I can come up with is that I thought the build up to the final boss was quite weak. In the original you go through a ton of â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ to finally get to the creature who opened the portal in the first place and it's built up as this huge powerful entity that isn't to be â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ with. In this game you just suddenly find yourself in an ammo supply room and are told "something big is coming". It felt pretty underwhelming.

Overall it was a pretty positive experience with the same flaws as the original game. I definitely enjoyed my time with it and look forward to the next expansion, Blue Shift, to finish out the trilogy
 
Deadguy
0

RecommandÃ©
7.4 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 1 janvier 2017
In Half Life: Opposing Force you play as Adrian Sheperd, a man part of the "opposing force" in Half Life, rather than playing as Gordon Freeman.

I like playing as Adrian Sheperd as his perspective of the Black Mesa incident is interesting. The new weapons introduced in the game were a great addition and I also liked the night vision goggles. In Half Life I found myself having to look at a guide at some bits in the game as I wouldn't know what to do or where to go next but I didn't find that problem in Half Life: Opposing Force.

The game was a bit short however, but that's to be expected as originally this game was an expansion to Half Life. I also found the storyline to be very straightfoward and not as compelling to Half Life's story. Although I did like the ending to Half Life Opposing Force and would like to see what the G-Man does with Adrian Sheperd in a future Half Life game (if another Half Life even comes out)

Overall I'd give this game a solid 8/10

Also there's an epic Full Metal Jacket reference

Prvy oficialny datadisk pre Half-Life nesuci sa v zelenej farbe, kde sa na udalosti v Black Messa pozriete z ineho uhlu pohladu. V kozi clena specialnych jednotiek sa budete snazit znicit hlavne Gordona Freemana, cize sami seba z povodnej hry, co by mohlo viest k miernej demotivacii, ale bavime sa tu o znacke Half-Life, ktora take slovo, akym je demotivacia proste nepozna.

Half-Life: Opposing Force bud hrajte, alebo zomrite! :)

Jaeger
378 produits enregistrÃ©s

6 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
2 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation amusante
0
Non recommandÃ©
2.7 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 14 mars 2023
Never reviewed a game on Steam, but I had to speak against the consensus on this one. HL1 is still a great game and mostly holds up today, but this outsourced (heh) expansion does not.

I will probably play it to completion but my qualms so far are:

1. Environments are drab and boring: you're constantly wandering around a grey corridor listening to the same 1-second clip of electricity crackling. Very poor sense of atmosphere.

2. "Puzzles" are both cryptic and mind-numbing: often-times the solution to clearing a room is simply waiting for a scripted event to finish.

3. Horrible jump vertical: you need to crouch-jump to overcome a milk carton. Surely a soldier is more athletic than this? I know crouch-jump is in the original, but this game makes you jump on boxes constantly.

4. Feels like a chore to play: I'm not given any motive except getting out of the aforementioned boring environments.

5. I HATE the wrench.

Positives:

1. New enemies are sort of cool.

2. The knife is fun, but it's not our beloved crowbar.

Overall I would not recommend this Gearbox take on HL1, it feels very much a bootleg of the original rather than something which "expands" it.
 
vatha
0

Half-Life: Opposing Force

Pontos Positivos

+ Adiciona uma visÃ£o alternativa Ã¡ histÃ³ria do jogo principal que Ã© muito bem executada
+ Adiciona uma quantidade relativamente grande de novas armas e inimigos.
+ Ambientes Ã³timos e Ãºnicos, tanto os que reaparecem do jogo original, quanto os novos.
+ Trilha sonora boa.
+ Campanha de bom tamanho (em torno de 6 horas).

Pontos Negativos

- Extremamente difÃ­cil, sendo injusto as vezes. Zerar esse jogo no hard Ã© extremamente frustrante, e nÃ£o posso dizer que vale a pena. Ã‰ recomendado jogar no easy (sÃ©rio).
- O jogo da crash e corrompe seu save com uma certa frequÃªncia, mas o auto-save costuma te salvar.

Half-Life: Opposing Force recebe a nota 8.5/10

A partir de aquÃ­ ya sabÃ©is lo que toca, luchar por sobrevivir contra nuestros enemigos, principalmente los comandos negros (un gran numero de ellos) y alienigenas (los ya vistos en el juego original + una nueva raza mas conocida como raza X) utilizando un amplio arsenal entre el que se encuentran armas ya vistas anteriormente, ademas de una arma experimental y varias alienÃ­genas.

Half-Life: Opposing Force is an awesome content extension in regards to the original Half-Life following a new characterâ€™s perspective going through new areas of Black Mesa dealing with new enemies, new weapons, and new bosses. Pretty fun, not that long but, not as short and â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ as Blue Shift. Worth getting if you like the original game.

+An additional story to Half-Life following one of the marineâ€™s POV going through new maps of Black Mesa
+Not incredibly short like Blue Shift but not that long either just a nice sweet game
+Great ost

+New enemies
+New bosses
+Lots of new environmental dangers and new rope climbing physics
+New kind of allies
+Multiplayer igâ€¦
+Cheats
+Cool tutorial

-Multiplayer is dead af as you can expect for a 20+ game. No real point of even trying to play as the majority of the servers are empty and usually only have 5 people or less online at once only for them to all be in a private server or in a server with bots and you canâ€™t tell the difference between the 2.
-Game has the same mouse glitch as Blue Shift where it keeps locking to a fixated position again and again. Enabling input mouse raw some â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ idk fixes this.
-The initial room in the observation deck with the giant green claw alien where you have to use the barnacle weapon to traverse into an elevated room was without a doubt so annoying. The game never explains or seems as if to show you that you can latch onto green glowing balls on the wall with the barnacle leaving you confused on what to do.
-Remote play? I donâ€™t understand how all the original Half-Life games have a remote play option when there is no split screen whatsoever. â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ ainâ€™t gonna work.

Opposing Force is a really fun new continuation
to the Black Mesa incident with all kinds of new levels, aliens, soldiers, and very cool new weapons. Lots of fun totally worth it just some minor glitches and a dead multiplayer. Still awesome very yes donâ€™t get Blue Shift lol.

wetpaz
483 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
5 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
12.4 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 13 septembre 2018
A long, long time ago, in the splendid days of yore, there was a thing called an expansion pack. This might seem odd, but these expansion packs usually packed a full new single-player campaign as well as multiplayer maps and other little extras. That was way back when, in the days of CRTs, dial-up internet connections. Back when the kids would go outside and play for hours without carrying any communications devices, a time of 3DFX and Nintendo 64, a time when Gearbox released great games inspired by Aliens and Predator.

Man, how I miss those days, but thankfully Opposing Force is here to remind us of a humbler gaming industry when content reigned over pretty much everything else, games came in embossed cardboard boxes as big as your head and ran off CDs. Yes, CDs. You see, back then these expansions would be priced at around 40$ a piece so they pretty much had to justify that price tag.

Lo and behold, Opposing Force came with around a dozen new maps for multiplayer, new multiplayer modes including CTF and a 7-9 hour single-player campaign. Compare that to that today's micro-DLC and lootbox bullcrap and you'll see how great those days were.

As for Opposing Force? It's quite possibly the best FPS expansion pack of all time. New enemies, new weapons, new levels and they all feel every bit as natural as anything that came in Half-Life. You even get to watch Freeman jump into the portal in the Lambda complex. How's that for awesome?

If you were gaming around when this was released, buy it for the sake of nostalgia. If you weren't, buy it so you can see how consumer friendly and inspred game developers were back in the late 90s and early naughties. Either way, you won't be disappointed.
 
AssKicker47
0

Half-Life: Opposing Force

â˜ Good
